Hi Kids! The 'Malaya' quiz is specially created for you. It's an exciting, stimulating and educational board game set against the scenario of Malaysia's rich and colorful history.
'Malaya' quiz will bring you through a journey back in time from the founding of melaka, the coming of the European Powers, the British Interference, the Japanese Occupation to the Road to Independence.

Game description:
The game is a simple history trivia game focusing on Malaysia's history from the Melaka sultanate period to the independence of Malaysia.
Players start from a common starting point and move towards a common ending point. Players roll a die and move the stated number of places, and one opponent will draw a trivia question card from a deck of 40 and ask the active player a question from the card. Each card has 4 categories (each with a question and an answer) and which question the player is asked depends on the spot the player lands on.
If the player answers correctly, he is allowed another turn.
If the player answers incorrectly, play passes on to the next player.
Along the way to the ending point, there are special spots on the board where the player will have to perform special actions such as answering 2 questions (instead of 1), losing a turn or rolling again.
The first player who reaches the end wins the game.

name: Georgia Trivia
description:
Two game booklets are provided, each containing over 1500 questions in the categories of Geography, General Information, History, Art/Literature/Music, Science/Nature, and Sports/Leisure, all relating to the U.S. state of Georgia.

The booklets can be used to play a basic quiz game between two teams (first team to answer 30 questions wins) or as replacement questions for other trivia games.

name: Soap Opera Challenge:  General Hospital
description:
[From back of card deck:]

"Challenge yourself and your friends to remember great moments from General Hospital including the stormy marriage of Alan and Monica and the adventures of Anna, Duke and Scorpio."

This is a trivia game consisting of 54 cards and a "drama die". There are 6 categories of trivia questions:

1. Love Affairs and Friendships

2. The Family Tree

3. Characters and Circumstance

4. Disappearing Acts

5. It's a Crime

6. Challenge Plus (extra-difficult questions)

Each face of the die has a logo corresponding to one of the 6 categories. A player rolls a die and has the top card of the deck read to them, based on the category rolled. If the question is answered correctly, the person keeps the card and rolls again. If incorrect, the card goes on the bottom of the deck, and it's the next players turn.

The game is over when the draw deck is empty. The person with the most cards wins.

Note that due to the recycling of the cards, this can be a very lengthy game if the players are not experts on General Hospital of the mid 1980s.

There are also rules for solo play (go through the deck once, rolling the die for each one -- if you get 27 or more correct, you win.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Godfathers & Goodfellas: The Organized Crime Trivia Game
description: "Godfathers & Goodfellas" is a trivia board game that is driven by the popularity of the "wiseguy" genre, particularly in movies and on TV series such as “The Sopranos.” The game consists of a series of categories relevant to the 'mob scene' with questions in each category. The player is a good guy -- a special agent assigned to break up the mob by answering questions. With every correct answer, down goes another bad guy. The harder the question the bigger the bad guy … until the whole gang is gone.

name: Bok
description: Quoted from the game box: “BOK is a fast paced strategy game that is more demanding and challenging than Backgammon or Chess. Truly a remarkable and intriguing concept, unparalleled in the history of games. BOK will remain unchallenged in years to come as The Ultimate Strategy Game.”

name: Dice Hockey
description:
The Dice Hockey game set features three top quality, 18mm molded dice which look and feel like natural pearl, along with an attractive pocket size container with easy-off cap, detailed guidelines and two copies of brief game rules tabulated for quick reference.

Although usually played One-on-One, DICE HOCKEY may be played by two teams with each player taking turns in rotation.

Players first agree on the number of goals to be scored to win or the number of minutes to be played.

Offense rolls the Red die to show PASS, UP ICE, FOULED, OFFSIDE or SHOOT (2 faces).

Defense waits until Offense rolls SHOOT or FOULED, then retaliates by rolling the Blue die to show BLOCK , TURN-OVER, ICED, GOAL or SAVED (2 faces).

A new Face-Off results when OFFSIDE, ICED or GOAL is rolled and a Power Play results when FOULED shows up.

A game tied at the time limit may be decided by either of two ‘Sudden Death’ options.

When there’s no Ice Hockey...
Play DICE HOCKEY!

All you need is a reasonably flat surface and a thirst for ACTION!!

name: Don't Blow That Load
description:
The Truck Loading Game
The game takes place in a truck loading warehouse or terminal. Players must completely load their truck with 4 different colored cubes and then race to the finish. On the way to the finish they must check the trucks weight on the scales. Too much and the player must start over again.
A light family game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Eastern Operation: Invade Oahu! Dec. 7, 1941
description:
Taken from the website:

EO is a complete naval, ground and air system simulating what might have happened had the invasion of Oahu been carried out immediately after the Pearl harbor raid. The game uses a double blind system for the naval aspects, as the US/Japanese carriers attempt to locate one another and destroy them. Each player is put in their historical counterpart's position just after the PH raid. The game uses two maps, a tactical map showing the island of Oahu for the ground battle, and a operational map for the naval and air operations.

Solitaire rules included.

Game includes:
280 counters
1 Operational map
1 Tactical map
Rulebook

name: Walt Disney's Goofy Darn Socks Game
description:
"Be the first to patch Goofy's holey socks and win!"

Players choose one of four pairs of tri-colored socks. Each pair of socks have 6 holes in them that must be repaired by a patch chip of the same color. The patch chips are face down in a common pool. Taking turns pulling a chip from the pool, each player may potentially repair up to two holes each turn. But if a moth chip is drawn, that player must return a played patch chip to the pool. The first player to patch all their holes wins.

The chips are not drawn at random. All chips remain in sight during the game, but all look identical when face down. This introduces a memory element to the strategy.

Recommended for ages 5 through 9.

Manufactured in the USA by the Western Publishing Company Inc., Racine WI 63404

name: Kaua Mauna (Mountain Battle)
description:
From the box:

In ancient times, oceans and mountain streams ran red with blood of brave Hawaiian warriors until king Kamehameha conquered and united the Islands.
Though the Hawaiians were poetic and daily worshiped their gods, they took great pride in perfecting the art of war.

These muscular six- to seven-foot warriors in war helmets and loin cloths could trip, paralyze, strangle their enemy, dodge blows and strike with speed and force.
They used spears, clubs daggers, rocks and could bring down the enemy two hundred feet away a single slingshot stone.

In Kauna Mauna, you will relive heroic adventures of the past when you command your warriors to encircle the island, battle the enemy and invade their villages.
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Teddy Bear's Picnic
description: In this British card game, likely inspired by the children's song, everyone tries to get 10 teddy bears to come to his/her picnic. 54 cards show teddy bears, honey pots, food items and other objects.

name: In Search of Identity
description:
"An Exciting Way to Discover Black Heritage!"

This is a well-produced game that tests the players' knowledge of famous black people, black history, and black culture, with a predominantly American focus. The primary goal of the game is to score points by answering questions on the above subjects, with individual turn actions keyed by a basic roll-and-move mechanic.

The significant twist in the game is that each player takes one of twenty cards sets, each set consisting of 11 cards. Ten are clue cards related to a single black historical figure or celebrity. Another card in each set has the person's name and picture. During the game, the other players have the opportunity privately or publicly hear the clues and try to guess the character. The clues are divulged based on the players answers to toss-up questions on cards ("Words of Wisdom" and "Go Back to your Roots"), drawn when they land on the corresponding squares. Other squares allow free guessing of secret identities, answering questions for additional points, and other more typical roll-and-move actions. Points for answers/guesses are tallied on paper for as the game progresses.

This game appears to have a good balance between movement, deduction, and trivia mechanics. An unfortunate rule is that players who have their secret identities guessed are then out of the game, so it would help to have the most obscure figure possible. (There were two of twenty I was completely unfamiliar with, and a couple more I needed a clue to recognize.)

There will not be much replay after all the IDs have been used...but if that happens the game will have largely succeeded in it primary educational goal.
publishers: Identity Concepts Inc., Identity Toys Inc.

name: Spot the Tune
description: This is a British game from the 1950's or 60's. It originated from a T.V. show of the same name starring Marion Ryan. The game comes with a 33rpm record with a few bars of 96 tunes; the object for the three to twelve players is to Spot the Tune. It reminds one of the American TV show called NAME THAT TUNE (I can name that song in 4 notes ...... etc.).
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Les Cracks
description: This French cycling game from the '80s is played on a 69*22cm. board that 2 to 5 cyclists, each controlled by a player. Before the game starts, players choose how many étappes will be played (usually between 4 and 8). At the start each player has 6 cards in his hand. A card can contain advantages or bad luck (when this card is played it is played as bad luck to another cyclist). After every turn a the hand is refilled till 6. Every étappe is 200km. The winner of the game is the player who scores the best in the overall classifying of all étappes.

name: Madelinette
description: Madelinette is a small, simple game of blockade, probably invented by J & J Loader for their book, Making Board, Peg and Dice Games. There seems to be no reference to this game before the publishing of this book. Two players strive on a board of seven points, each with three pieces, to block in their opponent's pieces so that the opponent cannot move. Information on this game is sparse, as it is overshadowed by the similar-looking three men's morris, for which it is often mistaken. A game board in the Hull and East Riding Museum, in Yorkshire, England, is often mistaken for this game in photographs but would rather seem to be an incomplete three men's morris board, this has been confirmed by the curator.

name: Extreme!
description:
Publisher's Description:

You are an Extreme! athlete, trying your hand at a variety of Extreme! sports. But be careful. Extreme! sports pose Extreme! risks. Injuries can happen at any time. Choose your sport, roll the dice, and try to have the longest, most Extreme! career!

A humorous "injury management" game about Extreme! sports.

Contains:
3 custom Extreme! Dice
4 player mats
50 Extreme! condition markers

name: Surfing
description: This game appeared in the '70s and has an original theme with windsurfing. The game consists of a board with mainly water, surfboards and a small boats on. The mechanics are quite simple, it's a dice controlled game. The players move over spaces on the boards, each player controls a surfboard, the player who reaches the final space first has won the game.

name: Sludge
description:
From the cover:
SLUDGE Pick up your sludge at the factory, then sell it to your distributors around the board. Sounds easy - but watch out for the competition; and the Income Tax; and those business cards! Fun for the whole family ages 8 to adult.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Let's Get Sh*t-Faced
description:
Description from Kheper Games website:

"Players select one of the drinking assignment die colors to represent each player or each team of 2+ players. Then players take turns rolling the dice. The brown die tells you who drinks, and the other dice determine how much. Perhaps the highest or lowest numbers drink, the last person to perform a gesture drinks, or the losers of a silly contest drink. Contest ideas are included on the back, such as: hairiest ass, loudest belch, dirtiest joke, or best armpit fart. This is a game for 2 to 100 players!"

The game comes with five six-sided dice, each with text on all faces. The brown die indicates the action and the other dice are alike except that they are colored blue, yellow, orange or purple, to represent four different teams. The game has no stated objective or winning conditions, but presumably it is the same as all drinking games - to get away with drinking the least (or you may prefer the most).

Amusingly, this drinking game comes with a warning, "Not to be played with alcohol".
categories: Dice, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Goth or Gauche?
description:
From the publisher's website, 2003, via the Wayback machine:

"In Goth or Gauche? you take on the role of a peripathetic freak and traipse around the club, quothing, posing, and angst-dancing the night away. Bottle Dancer on the floor? You'll shudder in horror and avoid her like the plague until you can Make Them Leave. Is Phoenix showing off his prodigious jewelry again? Just wait 'til he gets Entangled and laugh your head off. Now, not every night is going to be Goth. Sometimes Fire & Brimstone, the Graver, the Lech, and the Manic Goth may show up together - and you may not be able to Make Them Leave fast enough. That doesn't mean it's a bad night, though. NO! Enjoy your Gaucheness and laugh along with the uncool."

Limited print run, released Dragon*Con 2002. Box unfolded to become the game board.

name: Het Beleggingsspel
description: This game was released at the end of the '80s in Belgium and only distributed by the Generale Bank (General Bank) who gave it as a relation gift or sold it to it's customers. The goal of the game is to teach people how the stock market works.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Stock Holding

name: Trumpalar
description:
Trumpalar Based on the book "The Riddle of the Trumpalar" by Judy Bernard-Waite.

The aim is to be the first to travel from the Trumper Tree, through the tunnels marked on the large colorful gameboard, to the Throne of the Trumpalar. As the game progresses, players are given the opportunity to choose between improving their own position or placing one or more of their opponents at a disadvantage.

The game is won by entering the Throne of the Trumpalar, which can only be achieved through the tunnel indicated on the spinner.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Context
description: Crossword tile game. Similiar to scrabble but using words not letters. Tiles are color coded indicating point values.

name: Three Little Pigs
description:
A realistic storybook game. No reading required. Ages 4 to 8.

Each child moves a pig following the path. A spinner is used to determine which space the pig is moved to on each turn. A wolf is also moved each turn according to the spinner (which has two colors at each point). Whichever pig gets to the end first wins.

name: Schmetterlingsfest
description:
A butterfly party with tasty fruit-juices is being prepared. Every player sets a table with the different juices. The butterflies help. They are attracted by the colors and the smells of the fruit and will bring the juices to the table.


Ein Schmetterlingsfest mit leckeren Fruchtsäften ist in Vorbereitung. Jeder Spieler soll einen Tisch mit den verschiedenen Säften decken. Die Schmetterlinge helfen dabei. Sie werden von den Farben und dem Duft der Früchte angelockt und bringen die Säfte zu den Tischen.

name: Arrest and Trial
description:
Deduction game based on the ABC TV show "Arrest and Trial" starring Ben Gazzara and Chuck Conners.

Move around the city collecting clues and questioning witnesses.

It is the same board and mechanics as "Dragnet".

name: Hand 2 Hand
description:
In Hand 2 Hand, players take turns drawing various things while other players attempt to guess what's being drawn. Points are scored for correct guesses.

The trick is that partners must use the "double-handed drawing arm", working together to properly draw each subject.

name: Combination Board 4 Games
description:
Combination Board, 4 Games (boxed):
Manufactured by Wilder Mfg. Co., St. Louis, MO., U.S.A., around 1920, before they carved up Germany and Austria-Hungary and created Poland, etc., because the map matches 1918 Europe.
This set of 4 games (designed for 2 to 4 players) in one box includes two folding game boards with a game on each side. The four games are: 1. Indian Home Game (looks and plays like Parcheesi); 2. Game Hunt (move around the board scoring points for shooting critters -- Rabbit = 1, Lion = 12); 3. Army and Navy (move around a map of WWI Europe, scoring points for capturing enemy officers and weapons -- Zeppelin = 1, Flag and General = 10); 4. Auto Race (race around a track, avoid obstacles, cross finish line 1st).

Contents: Two 12" x 12" mounted game boards with a different game on each side, 16 1/2-inch round wooden playing pieces (4 red, 4 yellow, 4 green, 4 blue), and 1D6 (wooden) in a 6.5" x 14" x 1.5" flat box. The rules for 3 games are inside the lid; the Auto Race game has the rules right on the board.

name: Donner Knispel
description:
Donner Knispel is very much like Pachisi, but instead of dice rolling, movement is done by playing cards. Card have values and special abilities, what makes the game much more tactical than Pachisi.

With 4 players it is a partner game and your partner´s pieces can be moved with your own cards.

The game is set in the children's fantasy world of Donner Knispel.

Home Page: http://www.myfleat.com/
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Noel's House Party
description:
NOEL'S HOUSE PARTY is a board game spin-off from the UK's TV Show of the same name. It involves recreations of the main features of the show.

From the box:

"Round and around Crinkley Bottom you go... in for the Music Game .... down the cellar for 'Wait till I get you home'. But who's that at the door? - better go and find out, oh no! you've landed in the grunge tank - or worse still you've to face the NTV talent test.

This new and exiting family game is fast-paced and action packed and features a fully working three-dimensional 'Grad a Grand' booth complete with miniature money".

The aim of the game is to collect the most money by moving around the board and performing a variety of actions based on the draw of a card:

NTV - act out the instructions on the card.
KNOCK KNOCK - Guess the identity of someone from clues on the card.
WAIT TILL I GET YOU HOME! - Guessing what answer another player will give to a question.
MUSIC GAME - Music based trivia or performance card.

Other spaces require you to spin again, miss a turn or take possion of the Gotcha! (allowing you to score double points whilst you have it).
categories: Deduction, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music

name: Radio Star
description:
A collection of three activities designed to test your musical knowledge.

Chart Toppers- Guess the decade that a song debuted.
Lyriculous-name a song using only the new lyrics provided.
Bubba-Lips-name a song by humming melody while putting a finger across lips rapidly.

Team Game, with 10 rounds.

name: Dino Trivia
description:
Dino Trivia is jam-packed with questions and quirks about dinosaurs! Amaze your friends when you know the answer to: "Where was the first Velociraptor fossil found?" If you are a junior player, do you know the answer to "What did a T-Rex eat?" When you cannot answer some questions correctly, you might be asked to perform an outrageous action and pretend you are an Allosaurus chasing your prey!!!

[Text from back of box]

Players take turns asking the person to their left questions from the back of the next card drawn from the pile. Standard questions may be quite difficult, even for an adult, while "junior" questions are very simple to accommodate younger players. A correct answer earns the player the card while an incorrect answer may require them to perform an "outrageous action," such as flapping their arms like a Pteranodon.

The winner is the first to construct a T-Rex skeleton composed of four separate images on the backs of the cards they earn. Obviously many cards contain duplicate images, so reaching this goal may require more than four correct answers.

All information is taken from the book Dinosaurs by Michael and Caroline Carroll; religious content is held to a minimum on the cards themselves (2 of 100 questions).
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Prehistoric, Religious, Trivia

name: Flight Deck
description:
This children's game consisted of a plastic replica aircraft carrier deck and a movable joystick attached to a nylon filament pulley system which would be connected to an item of furniture. A model F4 Phantom jet was able to make landings on the mock-up carrier deck.

An arrestor hook on the undercarriage of the jet would catch a nylon trip wire on the replica flight deck during a landing, stopping the plane and raising a trap door on the deck, indicating a point scored for a successful landing.

Flight Deck was played in competition between two players, but was also suitable for solo play.

Airfix released an improved version - Outside the Scope of BGG - in 1975, featuring a catapult launch system and improved mechanics -

name: Grand Prix
description:
Vintage Formula 1 racing game from the '70s.
Roll and move with no choices. Each player rolls the dice and moves their car around the track. Events occur when players land on specific spaces. Usually miss a turn or go slow.
First over the line after the chosen number of laps wins.

name: Garments Galore
description:
The box contains 12 cards, each with a list of words which are all types of garment, and a short story which has certain words omitted. The players must use the word list (or homonyms) to fill in the blanks, each word in the list being used exactly once. The winner is the player who correctly completes the task first.

"Game no. 94"

name: Golems
description: Fantasy Wargame for 2-4+ players. You are a mighty Wizard. Use your Magic to make Golems to defeat you enemies. Use tiles to make the board. Units are created with a combination of size, shape, and material cards. Lots of Flavor and special fiddly rules. A fair amount of record keeping because each unit is unique. Free copy of the rules available at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Golem.html

name: Upon the Stars Backs
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

"As the Turkish union moves through the stars, a combined group of Euro-Union, and Japanese fleets move to protect their assets. Recently though the Turkish fleets have been growing ever so stronger with their eventual rise as a major space power. Right now they are attempting to land grab and then settle for peace!"

A simple game of spaceship fleet combat from the One Page Wars game series. Up to three players take on the GM controlled Ottoman forces.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Battles: Win or Lose
description: Battles: Win or Lose is a two-player game that challenges players to use instinct and intuition to defeat their opponent. Don the powers and strengths of 20 different characters and pit them against each other in an all-out slugfest of the fittest. Be the cunning Rogue, or the powerful Fire Mage. Swap blows with the Barbarian while your Thug hides, waiting for the opportunity to strike with deadly precision. Empower your party with the holy blessings of the Paladin or send your Opponent to the grave with the Necromancer. The way you play is up to you.

name: Dial Away
description:
This game was made for British Telecom.

Players must complete a given phone number , with the country, area code and the cost of the call.
To do that, players spin a dial and collect the needed numbers available on the section where the dial points at.

If players don't get the correct combination of numbers they must pay a forfeit consisting of talking about a certain topic for a minute.

name: Perfect Bowling Game
description:
This bowling game comes with a bowling alley that measures 25” long by 6” wide.

It works by having a bowling figure that can be moved from side to side to aim your shot. The ten pins are set in the location holes and when they are all in place you push the locater into the down position. This lifts the locater set up and gets the lane ready for a frame. You then push your bowling figures' arm back to lock him in position and place your ball in the groove. When you are ready press the button to release the bowlers arm and bowl.

Afterwards the ball return dispenser will return the ball back to the bowler When the ball gets back to you, you press a button and the ball pops up ready to use again.

Game includes score sheets so you can keep score
The bowling alley measures 25” long and 6” wide
comes in a display box

name: Wagon Train
description:
This game is based on the TV show of the same name that was on from 1957 through 1965. It starred Ward Bond as Major Seth Adams and Robert Horton as Scout Flint McCullough. Bond died of a heart attack in 1960 and was replaced by John McIntire who played Christopher Hale

Wagon Train followed the trials and tribulations of pioneering families as they set out from the East to carve out a new life in the West soon after the American Civil War. For some of the travelers it was a happy ending, but not for all, which only heightened the drama along the way.

The game itself is a simple roll and move game as you try to guide your Wagon Train safely to California. Indian Attacks along the way make the trip difficult.
categories: American West, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: O.W.C.H.
description:
Owch is a game for two or four players based on the classic game Ludo/Parcheesi. Each player takes on the role of a construction foreman (Ollie, Wally, Holly, or Carlie), and each team of two foremen must get all of their workers to the job site to win.

Players sitting opposite from each other are partners. Partners can stack their workers to block their opponents, or play cards to impede their progress around the board.

Ollie, Wally, Carlie and Holly are four contractors desperate for work for their squads. There's a big contract up for grabs and it goes to the first team on site. The contract is too big for one squad and so Ollie has tams up with Wally and Carlie has teamed up with Holly.

Times are hard and Ollie, Wally, Carlie and Holly will stoop to any kind of underhand skulduggery, obstructing and back stabbing to get the job.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game
publishers: Owch Family games, Simply Great Games

name: Thomas and Friends: Maze Game
description:
This game is one of the many Thomas and Friends games available in New Zealand.

This game involves moving around the board to collect passengers

The players move around a 4 by 4 board (15 tiles each with a picture of track on both sides of them and one station) from a central station following the track. The 4 x 4 grid is randomly created at the beginning of the game and the tiles can also have the 'action' or 'passengers' attribute on them as well as the track. Players move by rolling a die and moving around the tiles following the arrows and only on track that can connect, if they end on an 'action' tile then they take an action card, if they end on a 'passenger' tile then they collect 3 passengers. The next player then continues to play from the position of the last player

The action tile cards have different effects such as flipping the tiles over to the other side, making the player lose all their passengers, moving them to the bottom of the board, or cause them to end their turn.

The game continues until either a player decides to end the game, this gives the other players 2 turns to get additional passengers or the game ends when there are no more passenger cards left. In both situations the player with the most passengers wins.

The box includes 16 track maze cards, 14 action cards, 40 passengeer cards and 1 player token (which is used by all players).
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trains, Transportation
publishers: Crown Products, HiT entertainment, M.J.M. Australia

name: Hungry Homer
description: Homer Simpson is guarding an entire tray of his favorite sugary snacks, and it's your job is to try to remove them from his clutches! The three different sizes of donut earn players different amounts when removed successfully. The bigger the donut, the more points earned - but the higher the risk of upsetting Homer! On each turn, players roll a dice to determine which size of donut they go for. Play continues until Homer reaches the end of his tether, when he shoots forward, sending the donuts flying. This is a game of risk, nerve and lots of fun.

name: Drive-Rite
description:
Drive-Rite
(Recommended Age 6 to Adult)

"Test Yourself
In a Game of Fun
Drive A Car
Like it Should be Done"

Drive-Rite is a basic roll and move game where each player competes to move their car down the path and be the first to reach "home".

Movement is accomplished by rolling two 6-sided dice to determine your speed. Each road along the board has a posted speed limit. If on your turn, you exceed the speed limit, you have to roll another dice and move that many spaces backwards as a penalty for speeding. There are a few different routes you may take (each with different speeds) as well as various spaces on the board where you must stop.

Overall the game is very simple and there is little strategy.

name: Shop 'Til You Drop
description:
(From the box description):

Shop Till You Drop is the game where a roll of the die tells you what to drop in and what to take out. But mind the jittery trolley!

Load up too much and it'll collapse! But taking things out can be just as tricky. Carefully does it or Yikes! You'll send your shopping flying! One false move and you're out!

name: Decade
description:
From the back of the box:

The aim of the game is to pit your wits against your opponents on the way to being the first to collect a full "decade" of the biggest news stories from the past 40 years.

On the surface, Decade is a feel good game that allows all its players to share in their mutual history. But be warned. There'll be both good news and bad news along the way - making it a game which can both unite and divide its players.

Victory may be only one news story away, but a simple act of sabotage from a cunning opponent can throw the game wide open. Tempers can flair. Being bad can be beautiful. And victory is sweet indeed!

Decade defines the times - the legends, catastrophes, joys, victories, winners and losers. Because of this, it's a game which generations will enjoy for decades.

name: The Young Talent Time Game
description:
This is a board game based on the highly successful Australian TV series Young Talent Time which included young stars like Kylie & Dannii Minogue and all the rest of the Young Talent Time Team.

The object of the game is to make your way around the board by obeying the instructions on the cassette tape. The end of the game is when the first player scores 100 points or the 'Game Over' card is revealed.

The credits are as follows: Created and designed by Darryl Cotton and Nir Pizmony. Design & artwork is by Ian Costello. Photography by George Vernon. Tape was recorded at Emerald Hills Studios, South Melbourne. Additional Music by D. Cotton and C. Lim.

name: 88: Digital Dramatic
description:
A game for ages 8-88.
All players play at the same time, trying to change the digital numbers on their display board to get as close as possible to the goal number.

name: Happy Retirement
description: The object of the game is to achieve a Happy Retirement by obtaining a balanced lifestyle (an outcome that most people do not achieve in real life). Players acquire lifestyles and an income that are generally beyond a typical person’s means. Players have to make sets consisting of three different types of lifestyles: expensive (e.g., Traveling the world), not so expensive ( e.g., mountain-bike trips), and one that is free (i.e., good friends).

name: Een Dijk van een Spel
description:
In Een Dijk van een Spel 2 to 4 player play a dikereef and must protect low-lying areas (dike-rings) with dikes. The first dikereef, to successfully protect 4 areas in two different regions is declared the winner. Storms and high water makes this a difficult job, though.

Een Dijk van een Spel(literally translated: "a dike of a game") is a game published by the dutch Ministry of Transport, Public Works and Water Management. It features all 53 dike-rings in the Netherlands - areas that need to be protected against the sea and/or rivers.

name: Left out
description: 7 colored cubes/dice are rolled. When 4 of the same color show each player grabs the appropriate colored chip. The one that doesn't get a chip must slide the scoring slide to show 1 letter at a time until the words left out are revealed. The game continues until one player is left.

name: Oppdrag: Misjon
description:
(Translated from the box and homepage)

A Christian strategy game with witnessing obligation as its focus!

In Oppdrag: Misjon the participants will build missionary bases, upgrade them to congregations and churches around the world.

To be able to build one, one has to have access to resources. As the term strategy hints at, you need to be smart and make a strategic plan deciding where it's favorable to build missionaries, in order to secure the resources you need. One may suddenly be struck by drought catastrophes or a grasshopper invasion, so nothing is predictable.

The aim is to collect 5000 missionary points, but in addition answer questions from 3 of the information cards you have received during the game.

33 of the missionary organizations in Norway have written some information about their work and the countries where they evangelize in.

This game is clearly influenced by "The Settlers of Catan". The basic gameplay with rolling for reaources and using these to build various things is lifted straight off of Settlers.

name: The Fox and the Hound Game
description: This very simple children's game based on the Disney film of the same name is essentially a spin and move game with minor strategy involving a second dial located under the spinner which gauges if you can move friend or foe.

name: Tivoli
description:
The game consists of a small board with 5x6 holes, some marbles and a "marble launcher" made of wood.
The point is to use the marble launcher and shoot the marbles on the board, trying to hit the holes to score points.
The holes give different points, ranging from 5 points for easiest holes to hit to 100 points for the hole in the center of the board.

This is Damm game number 324, probably published sometime in the 1950's.

name: Cause & Effect
description:
Publisher:
"The object of the game is to be the first player to reach the top of the mountain."

name: Die drei ???: Nacht in Angst
description: Another Game of the ??? series. Roll and move, collect sets of three identical counters. The player with the most sets in the end wins.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Duckopoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μœåνος (alone or single) + polein πωλε·øñν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The University of Oregon version of Late for the Sky's series of college themed Monopoly clones.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Build or Bust
description: The object of the game is: to "build" larger and larger houses, changing them from one size to the next. The Player first to complete the final House is the winner. You draw cards in turn and collect or return to the pool - bricks, windows, doors, etc. - as the cards direct. When you think you have all the parts you need, you "Build", but take care and act quickly, or you "Bust".

name: Ett litet spel om... schlager
description:
Swedish trivia game with 250 questions about the Eurovision Song Contest.

The questions come in 5 different categories:
1. Winners
2. Lyrics
3. Costumes and Show
4. About the Contest
5. Losers

Box Contents:
- 50 cards with 5 questions each
- 1 card with rules
- 1 card with copyright and disclaimer

name: Le grand jeu du cyclotourisme
description:
From the Publisher:

"For the last 72 years, cycle tourists from all over the world have covered the PARIS-BREST-PARIS cross country cycle ride, 1200 Km to be run in less than 90 hours, passing through forests, towns and villages of 9 Districts. This is what the organizers of this exceptional meeting offer you: the opportunity to participate in the official PARIS-BREST-PARIS-Randonneur board game.

The objective is to be the player who achieves the best time in completing the PARIS-BREST-PARIS circuit, a journey consisting of some 1200 Km (750 miles). The player is expected to avoid the many pitfalls of the route, to arrive at control points within the required time, to achieve a good average time, to not waste time at controls points and to persevere despite the sometimes adverse weather conditions and other hazards which will get in their way!

A second objective of the game is to see which players can get all of their team past the finish line in Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines intact.

The game is played in two sequences: 1) The practice Lap at St. Quentin-en-Yvelines, 2) The Paris-Brest-Paris-Randonneur."

name: Word Roulette
description:
Read the clue on the card, spin the wheel and the first person who calls out a correct answer starting with the letter spun keeps the card which is counted as one point.

Similar to another game I know but this has a very solid well made wooden spinner with all the letters of the alphabet on it.
publishers: (Unknown), Brio AB, Developmental Design Auckland New Zealand

name: Pyramid
description:
Pyramid is a memory game for children. 2 to 6 players explore a Pyramid by lifting two lids. Should the icons be the same as the icons on any of the cards the player is holding in his hand, he may discard the card in question. The first who get rid of their cards is the winner.

Contents:
1 board with windows
15 lids to cover the windows with
15 tokens with icons
42 playing cards
categories: Arabian, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: UCSD-opoly
description: This is a University of California at San Diego themed variant of Monopoly. Houses and Hotels are replaced by Years of Credit and Diplomas. There are no auctions, and all money required to be paid other than rent and the purchase price of properties is placed in the center of the board. Any player landing on Spring Break (Free Parking) collects all of the money from the center of the board. Playing pieces are History, Art, Anatomy, English, and Calculus textbooks. Unique properties include the Quonset Huts, the Price Center, the Guardian, the Sun God, the Koala, Revelle Plaza Fountain, the Hump, Genesee Avenue, Che' Cafe, Canyon View Pool, Muir College, Warren College, Fifth College, Revelle College, and Thurgood Marshall College.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Say Cheese
description:
Grab the entire card deck, Say Cheese and win!

Based on the War card game. Your goal is take all the cheese cards by drawing higher numbered cards than your opponent. In the event of tie, extra cards are drawn and compared to determine who wins the playoff. But keep an eye out for the cat and mouse trap cards as they can help you get additional bonus cards.

name: The Bodleian Game
description:
Evoking memories of hours spent in scholarly pursuit, players are given a subject of research and told to compile a bibliography made up from books to be found in the Bodleian and its dependent libraries.

Throughout the game 'readers' are confronted with the familiar frustrations of finding a book that is 'out to another reader' or 'not in place' and with having to deal with such distractions as being tempted away from work into the Kings Arms.

This unique and entertaining game comprises a set of 102 cards (the rules say 105, but are incorrect), each portraying a different book; a board representing the libraries and their reading rooms; and chance cards and playing pieces for up to six participants.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Take Stock
description:
The object of the game is to become the wealthiest player through buying and selling stocks.

The board and play resembles Monopoly. Play begins on the opening bell and $20,000 is collected each time the spot is reached. Roll & move to a space for the opportunity to purchase that company's stock. When all of a company's stock (a color group) is owned by one person, a mutual fund is formed, and an opponent landing on this stock owes increased dividends. On Bull and Bear market spaces, cards are drawn that penalize or reward. Purchasing on margin is allowed.

Contents:

Game Board
7 Denominations of Play Money
20 Bull Cards & 20 Bear Cards
28 Stock Certificates
8 Heavy Metal Playing Pieces
45 Gold Bar Markers
Pair of Dice
Instructions
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Wetten, dass..?
description:
"Wetten, dass..?" is a very popular television show in German-speaking countries. The main concept of the show are bets: Common people perform some unusual/difficult tasks and the celebrity guests must bet on the outcome of the performance and offer a wager.

The game includes a board and 3 different decks of task-cards: Knowledge, Activity, Wildcard. While one player has to fulfill the task, the other players must bet on the outcome. They wager chips and may move forward (to the center) if they are right.
If you reach the center and fulfill the Activity-card, you will win!
The Wildcards are blank cards, all players are allowed to think of new tasks before the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Peacock Game
description:
The game board is marked with four studios: News, Sports, Western and Music, plus the NBC Peacock in the center. Players move along the pathways to collect the 5 puzzle pieces of the Peacock by visiting spaces with matching pictures. If players marker stops on a space showing a picture of a part of the Peacock, he takes the matching piece from the pool and uses it to build his Peacock. First player to build a complete NBC Peacock from the puzzle pieces in the Pool is the Winner.
A trip trough television land. The fast-moving game of color matching and observation. Ages 5-10.
Under license from NBC-TV.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bay City Rollers On Tour
description:
A game for 2-5 players, the winner is the first to arrive at the concert hall in the centre of the sheet.

Before arriving at the concert, each player must have collected four items, pictured on the Concert Entry Cards: a tartan scarf, an autograph book, a Bay City Roller's LP & a concert ticket.

B-A-Y, B-A-Y,
B-A-Y, C-I-T-Y,
With an R-O-double-L, E-R-S,
Bay City Rollers are the best!

Rare to find this game complete & in such good condition !

name: Baseball
description:
An early card driven pitch-by-pitch baseball simulation designed for two players.

Game Contents: Playing Board, Deck of 36 Baseball Cards, 4 Wooden Markers for Batter and Base Runners, 2 Wooden Markers for Strikes and Balls, 1 Wooden Marker for Outs, 1 Wooden Marker for Runs Scored in an Inning, Score Sheet, Instructions.

To play, the cards are shuffled and held in the hand of the player at bat. The player in the field calls a pitch (fastball, curve, slow ball, drop, or knuckle ball). The result of the pitch is read from the top card. Pitch results include strike, ball, foul ball, hit batsman, wild pitch, balk or "field play."

When "field play" is the result of the pitch, the card is turned over to the Field Play side to determine the play outcome. Different play outcomes are included on each card, and the specific outcome used is based upon the number of outs and the number and location of baserunners.

After the result for a particular pitch has been determined, that card is discarded and play continues with the next card in the deck.

Although the game concept is simple, it works quite well, and play can be very competitive. However, the strategic aspects of baseball are ignored. There is no bunting, hit and run, positioning of the defense, etc.

This game has one notable oddity. The game board is a depiction of a baseball field with defenders drawn at the normal defensive positions. The defenders are numbered based upon standard baseball scoring conventions, except that the corner outfielders are reversed--that is, the rightfielder is shown as "7" and the leftfielder as "9."

This game was produced and marketed for at least 10 years under a variety of names: "Baseball", "Baseball Game for Young America", and "Little League Baseball".

name: Zombie Chow-Down
description: Zombie Chow-Down is a game by Aaron Williams (of Nodwick fame), where players try to be the first to eat two whole human beings. It's a simple dice-rolling game, with the standard sense of humor one would expect from the author. A set of dice are required to play the game; standard dice will work, but the author recommends using body-part dice.

name: League Leader Gaelic Football
description:
This boardgame has all the familiar aspects of Gaelic football including rules, terminology, tactics, and of course, excitement.

Players play their games against the board.
A single game is played by traveling from the throw in square to the final whistle square. Goals/points are scored during each game.

Essentially, the board creates realistic results that players record on a league table.
Each player has their own league table for recording results.
When each players league table has been completed, the player with the most league points wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Junior Police Five Game
description:
The game is tied in to a popular children's TV programme of the era, in which presenter Shaw Taylor used to ask viewers to 'keep em peeled' on the watch for stolen goods and missing cars. The box cover carries the logos of London Weekend Television and ATV, and a picture from the show.

The large map represents the roads of the West End of London around which players move according to dice-rolls, choosing to walk, bus or use the tube, each of which allows different styles of movement. Each player has a number of cards in his hand representing Police Notices of stolen goods or missing cars, and the corresponding items are on cards placed face down in various locations on the board. A player passing through such a location may examine the card and if he has a matching Police Notice may take it and place it in front of him. Players may pick up further police notices by visiting police stations.

When all the cards have been claimed, the player who has recovered the highest value wins.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Super Series Baseball
description:
Super Series Baseball is a game that uses dice to simulate the positions on the field and the pitches.

The pitcher die is thrown, showing the kind of pitch (curve, knuckleball etc) and a number (1-6). The batter then choses the die shown on the pitcher die, a fastball is a 1, and that die is rolled. The result of that die shows what happened on the pitch.

There are 9 dice for the defensive team, one for each position, 6 batting team dice and 9 pawns, used to simulate batters and count the balls, strikes, runs and outs. The game also includes a board and a deck of scorecards.

name: Rubbish
description:
This is a simple sequence game with a challenge element.

There are 104 cards each marked with a letter. There are 4 of each letter of the English alphabet.

In the center of the table, there are 4 stacks - 2 ascending from A-Z, and 2 descending from Z-A. A "Higher/Lower" marker is placed between the piles.

In front of each player, there are 2 stacks - a face down draw pile and a face up discard pile.

At the start of the game, all cards are dealt to players, so the only stacks with cards are the player draw piles.

Cards must be played onto the stacks in sequence - D on top of C if going "Higher", C on top of D if going "Lower". Cards may also be played onto another player's discard pile if it is 1 higher or lower than the top card. A player's turn ends when he draws a card that cannot be played anywhere - it is then placed in his own discard pile.

The winner is the person who gets rid of all their cards first (discard piles are recycled).

Other players can challenge a move by shouting "Rubbish". All players give 1 card to a validly challenged player, or to the challenger if wrong.

To encourage a noisy game with lots of challenging, the rules suggested that players play quickly in order to make mistakes.

The game consists solely of the marker, the cards and the rules.

The rules say that whilst any number of players is possible, it is best with 4-10 players.

name: Sata
description:
From the box:

This magnetic game with colour-changing pieces puts your logic and memory to test!

The special SATA pieces each contain four different colours. Depending on which space and orientation they are placed in on the SATA board, a different colour will be displayed in the window. The object of the game is to make a “triad” – a straight line of three SATA pieces in a row that show the same colour in their windows. This is not as easy as it sounds, since each time you move or twist a piece, its colour changes.

Learning to play SATA is very simple – but to become a SATA Master you will need to learn the patterns behind the colour changes. SATA is a captivating logic game for everyone aged 7+!

Contents: SATA board with 3 score markers, 8 SATA pieces and rules.
The pieces are stored in the flip-down sides of the board.

name: Underdog Game
description:
This is a children's game for 2 to 4 players Ages 5 - 12.

This is believed to be the first Underdog board game as it was released in 1964, the year that the animated series voiced by Wally Cox first appeared on NBC.

This is a humorous game of give and take in which the players try not to become the Underdog. The game has all the familiar cartoon characters. When a playing piece stops on a space, the player draws a card. If the card matches the character on the space, the player keeps the card. If the playing piece lands on one of the bright yellow Underdog spaces, the player takes a card from each player. The game comes with a gameboard, four wooden playing pieces, die, and 24 cards.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Word 2
description:
The advanced version of The Word, The Word 2 is a vocabulary game which expands the players' knowledge of vocabulary. The object of the game is to race around the board, answering questions whenever they land on "The Word" spaces or "At a Loss for Words" spaces. The first player to finish is the winner, but other players can continue the game to determine second and third place winners.

Ages 13 and up

name: Voetballuh
description:
‘Voetballuh’ is a Dutch soccer game with the same graphics as the comic book series of FC Knudde by Toon Van Driel.
The players decide who’s the best team in ‘the Derby of the Low Countries’, Holland and Belgium. Gameplay is straightforward: You take a spin on the spinning wheel, move your player on the path to the other goal. When a player arrives in the box, a chance is given to score. First player to reach 10 points is the winner.

name: Metagon
description:
From the description on the back of the box:

Metagon is a game of skill in which chance plays a small part. It can be played by two, four or six players either singly, in pairs or teams of three. The components of the game are 36 different octagonal tiles or metagons and a playing board.

The object of Metagon is to gain tiles from the playing ground. This can be achieved in either of two ways.

1. The simplest way of winning tiles is to create a straight line with three adjacent tiles having the same coloured motifs in the same relative position on each tile. Lines may be horizontal, vertical or diagonal. When a player has formed a straight line, he removes the two tiles placed earlier in the line and places these in a separate 'scoring stack', face up.

2. The second way of gaining tiles is to form a parallelogram by aligning the same coloured motifs on four tiles in the same relative position on each tile. Parallelograms may be any size and aligned horizontally, vertically or diagonally. When a player has placed a parallelogram he removes the three tiles placed earlier and adds these to his scoring stack.

The game ends when players have placed all their playing stack tiles on the board. The player with the most tiles in his scoring stack is the winner.

name: Bop Hockey
description:
Advertised as a 'Family fun Game" for Ages 3 and up.

Game box advertises that the game comes with a super speed roller puck, carom boards and a slick durable playing board.

Hockey for two. Hit the puck into the other person's goal. A blocker is located in front of each goal to act as a helper "goalie".

name: OOPS!! Travel Card Game
description:
Game consists of cards and "speedometer" dials for players to keep score. On one's turn, one draws a card and moves one's speedometer pointer the number of mph indicated. If one goes over 65 mph, a penalty of reducing one's speed is incurred.

The first player to land exactly on 65 mph wins.
publishers: Warren Built Rite Games, Warren Paper Products Co.

name: Go Diego Go! Treasure Quest
description: Go Diego Go! Treasure Quest is a roll and move game where each player is trying to collect a "Play Scene Board" which is a picture of a location like a desert or waterfall. Once all the players collect a Play Scene Board and make it to the Treasure Chest to find Baby Jaguar, the Play Scene Boards are used to create stories using Colorforms Stick-Ons of Diego and his pals.

name: Thlink
description:
Thlink is the family game of linking by lateral thinking for 2-6 players. Imagination is the key because in this game there are no set answers - it is up to you to link as many of the 16 dealt picture cards to ghe given category as you can. - Taken from the rule book

Thlink is a family friendly party game in which players bid on a the number of "links" they can make between 16 picture cards and 1 category card. Other players have the right to challenge a link and voting determines the outcome.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Voting

name: Numba Duel
description:
A game for two players:

Object of the game is to arrange unbroken diagonal rows of 3 or more tokens of one color and, by doing so, to score the highest number of points at game's end.

Alternatively, each player have to roll dice and place a token of his colors on the board, selecting a free spot near one of the number rolled. If its not possible, the turn is lost for the current player.

After a player went out of token, the game end. The winner is the player with the most points according to the number and length of the diagonal rows of his color on the board.

The scoring is:

3 - 1 point
4 - 3 points
5 - 6 points
6 - 10 points
7 - 15 points
8 - 21 points
9 - 28 points

The game include:
- 2 dice
- 58 colored tokens (29 for each player)
- a game board (58 holes braketed by two numbers from 1 to 6))
- Rules sheet

name: Mummi: Hattespillet
description: Based on the "Moomin" characters of the Finnish writer Tove Jansson, the players of this game searches in the garden of the Moomins to find the lost hats of Moominpappa.

name: Ordjakten
description: Each turn, the players get a topic and must take turns to name an object of that class (flowers, countries, Norwegian animals etc).

name: Pelle Politibil: Trafikkspillet
description:
Pelle Politibil: Trafikkspillet is a Norwegian children's game where each player controls "Pelle politibil" (a police car from a children's television show).

When playing this game, children learn traffic signs and rules.

name: Se og H√∏r: Det store kjendisspillet 2007
description:
As paparazzi photographer, you are hunting for the best pictures of famous and/or royal people.
You get points if you can guess who is hiding behind the mustache, hat or sunglasses, and if you can answer questions about them.

A follow-up to Se og H√∏r: Det store sladderspil with updated photographs.

name: Chicor√©e le Jeu
description:
(From the publisher's site)

A game of bidding to discover the world of chicory while building up a commercial empire !

Easy to understand, you have to win all the cards that make up the chicory chain : from the purchasing of the first seeds, to the roasting process, and then the marketing of your chicory product.
Compelling, chance alone cannot help you to see your project through. Bidding will enable you to win the cards you lack. Just find out the best way to manage your gold mine !
Entertaining, special cards will help you to slow down your opponents' progress or to speed up your own.
Simple, suitable from age 9, each game lasts between 15 and 30 minutes.

name: Hestespillet
description:
(Not to be confused with Hestespillet (1996), also by Damm / Egmont.)

Hestespillet (The Horse Game) is a children's racing game, where the players play gallop cards to advance in the course. Players must also play jump cards to overcome the hurdles. There are also some special cards to push or swap the hurdles.

Contents:

Game board
36 move cards
4 pawns with plastic feet
20 hurdles

name: IQ p√• boks
description:
(Translated from the publisher's site in Norwegian)

Anne Lene Johnsen is Norway's IQ-queen! With this playful game she wants to teach YOU some clever tricks. Of course you can get smarter. EVERYBODY can get smarter. We exercise our bodies, so why not our brain?

IQ på boks (IQ in a box) contains:
468 exercises, surprises and questions (312 cards in total)
4 individual gameboards
1 notebook
1 category die
64 chips
4 pens
Rule booklet

With IQ på boks you can romp about in lots of delicious candy for the brain. Whom is the quicker thinker? Whom is the smartest strategist? Whom is the luckiest, and is clever enough to snatch victory in front of the ones who think they are smartest. Here you get to use both your IQ and your logic skills, your memory and creativity, your quick mind and gambling willingness, and not least: Luck. You may also think tactical and do cunning moves along the way to better your situation or hinder the others. It is allowed to be clever!

Gulp down a strengthening drink (Anne Lene's recipe is included!), kick start the little grey ones and go ahead!

Who can play? The game is best suited for a maximum of 4 persons if one plays individually, alternatively one may play with 4 teams. You may also use the game to test yourself or challenge a buddy for some mental work out.
categories: Deduction, Educational, Math, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Ponnyspelet
description: This is a fairly basic roll-and-move game, imitating an equestrian (dressage) competition. Players race their horses through a track which has various printed events as well as "Chance" and "What the judge says" spaces, both of which give cards that the players keep for the duration of the game, and which represent events happening during the competition, giving either positive or negative points. Unlike most roll-and-move games, while getting to the Finish first (and second, third etc.) carries a good bonus it does not mean automatic victory; once all the players have reached the Finish line, points gathered from the cards are counted also and the one with highest point total wins the game.

name: Bryplay Show Jumping
description:
A simulation of International Show Jumping competitions with a choice of 16 identical horses, jumping over a choice of 16 jumps.

Players choose a course, choose a horse, or horses, and proceed around the course turning over Action Cards to decide the outcome of the round. After 3 rounds, the winner is decided based on how few faults each horse has collected.

name: Bugged!
description:
In Bugged! You can play one of the four main races that inhabit the galaxy in an attempt to wipe out any opposition. You could be anything from the mutant bugs with their limited intelligence but powerful weapons to the more resourceful but heavily outnumbered human marines.

It is a hex-based wargame that uses cards to add spice to what units can do. It is available free to print & play but the designer states that it has never been play tested and welcomes feedback.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Kukkokiemuu!
description: Players have to gather the different animals of the farm together. Everytime the die is cast it gives the sound of one of the animals and in that way tells you what to do next.

name: Keeping Up With the Jones'
description: Players try to out do each other by acquiring a house and material possessions and eventually being debt-free. The game involves auctions, rebates, shopping sprees, liens, and housing upkeep.

name: Sport Teasers
description:
A collection of several different sports-themed games (e.g. baseball, basketball, football, tennis, golf, soccer, bowling) with simple wooden boards and pegs for score keeping and a pair of dice for each game.

Packaging is a round metal tin.

Most games require players to take simple actions that correspond to the different possibilities of dice roll from 2 to 12.

name: Doc Holliday Wild West Game
description: Simple roll and move game that has the theme of Doc Holliday going after the "bandits."

name: Kannst du die Monate?
description: An educational game for children to help them learn the months of the year, and what event occur in each month.

name: Eamonn Andrews Presents Questo
description:
'Questo' is a question and answer game that traded on the popularity of the then very young Irish television presenter Eamonn Andrews. It consists of a slotted spinning disc that reveals a letter through the slot when it stops, and a pack of 48 question cards. The first player to answer the question on the card correctly with an answer beginning with the letter disclosed is given the card. The winner is the player who has the greatest number of cards at the end of the game.
Eamonn Andrews also presented "What's my line?" and "This is your life", amongst many others in his career.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Counties of England
description:
This game's components are cards related to counties in England. Cards list the towns in that particular county and a varying number of town cards (from two to seven) that include illustrations of the town on them and include interesting facts such as main industries, attractions, and population. The game was released in four series, each covering a different region of England:

1st Series: Northern
2nd Series: Midland
3rd Series: Eastern
4th Series: Southern


Players compete to complete county sets by obtaining the set of relevant town cards. The winner is the player who completes the greatest number of sets.

The game is similar to Happy Families, also published by John Jaques of London.

name: The Great Pyramid
description: The first player to climb to the top of the Great Pyramid becomes the Pharaoh and rules those beneath him. This game may be played by two, three, or four players. Each player moves around the board by rolling dice, following directions on the color coded hieroglyph cards and avoiding being sent to the tomb. A more refined rule set for adults is included. A brief history of ancient Egypt and a map are also included.

name: Plan-It
description: The objective of the game is to form an unbroken line adjoining two opposite sides of the board. You have link (move one space)and key link (move any number of spaces) pieces. pieces line up black left right, white top bottom and key links in the middle.

name: Stress am Strand
description:
A game as varied as one day at the beach. The sun shines, the sunscreen disappears, and the boombox blares. Appears to be a companion game to Freche Mädchen - Liebe, Jungs & Mädchenträume, also by Kosmos for the same gender and age group, based on the FRECHE MÄDCHEN FRECHE BÜCHER or IMPUDENT GIRLS IMPUDENT BOOKS.
Designer's site says it is for girls Ages 10 - 14.
http://www.burkhardt-spiele.de/Meine%20Ludographie.2.htm

name: Beat the Bookie
description: Beat the Bookie published by Chad Valley/Barclay Toys from London in 1965. Game features a four foot long mechanical track, a game betting board and 5 metal "horses". Turning a crank on the game board moves the horses down the track and eventually produces a winning horse.

name: Kosmopoliya
description:
Kosmopoliya is a Russian board game about space exploration, economy and warfare. The goal of the game is to gain a cosmic monopoly and be the last player on the board.

The game board shows a circle of planets. It is players task to start the economical development on the planets by establishing space ports, mines and factories. Players can do investments on several planets. Players also need to secure their economy by investing into space ships that can protect their convoys. Thus the game is about the balance of maintaining and moving of the their space ship fleet and at the same time developing the economy of planets to get more money. All attacks on planets are solved by throwing dice.

Zvezda game number for Kosmopoliya is 8608.
categories: Economic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Angelina Ballerina's Big Performance Game
description:
From the publisher: "Angelina can’t wait to be a ballerina
And dance in the big performance! But everything takes time and practice. Before she dances on center stage, she needs To learn her dance steps and collect all the
necessary items to be a prima Ballerina!"

While learning and performing steps along the way, players try to collect all the items necessary to take ballet classes for the big performance at the Royal Theater. The game features a dual number/color spinner so children who can't count yet can still play.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: B.S. Degree Game
description:
The object of B.S. Degree Game is to earn enough college credits (units) to graduate before any other players.

The board is laid out into four quadrants; Freshman, Sophomore, Junior and Senior years.

The playing time is approximately 1-2 hours for two players. Add additional 30-60 minutes for each additional player.

There are also instructions for using other trivia games in conjunction with this one.

name: Doodlebops Get on the Bus! Game
description: Based on the children's TV show/performers, this game is a basic roll and move. The goal is to get the Doodlebops characters on the bus in time for their concert. Players try to collect all three Doodlebops instruments - keytar, guitar and drum set along the way. The first player with all the instruments and all the Doodlebops on the bus is a winner. Includes: Game Board, 12 Doodlebops Play Pieces, 12 Instrument Chips, Die and Instructions. No reading is required, Ages 4 and up.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Gathering
description:
Coloured balls are drawn at random from the bag and placed onto the board, filling up all the spaces.

Each player then draws one coloured figure at random to determine which coloured balls they will control and places it in one of the four home areas.

Some neutral coloured balls are then removed depending on the number of players before the game begins.

Players take turns moving either one of their own balls or a neutral ball and the game ends when one player gets all of their own coloured balls into their home area.

name: Trivia: Omaha
description: This is a roll-and-move style trivia game based on the city of Omaha, Nebraska (USA). The trivia questions are based on local features of the city of Omaha and surrounding area, and are in 5 categories: Sports, History, Entertainment, Arts, and General Trivia. The game includes 4 Movers, 10-Second Timer, 4 Score Cards, 1 Die, game board, and 320 Question Cards with 1,600 questions.
publishers: HGI Marketing Services, McGill Sales, Inc., MetrOtrivia

name: Criss Cross Quiz
description:
Criss Cross Quiz was a quiz programme that combined the game 'Noughts & Crosses' with general knowledge questions and aired on the ITV network for ten years from 1957- 1967 and was produced by Granada Television. The show was based on Tic Tac Dough in the States.

The game was basically the same as the American Tic Tac Dough. Two contestants played the game with the champion playing cross ("X"), and the challenger playing noughts ("O"). They faced a Noughts & Crosses (Tic Tac Toe) game board of nine subjects. Player take turns (starting with the champion) picking categories and answering questions in those categories. Correct answers placed his/her symbol in the board and adds money to the pot; the centre box was worth £40 while the other boxes were worth £20. First player to get three in row (across, up & down or diagonally) wins the game and became champion.

name: Urians H√∂llenfahrt
description: The aim of the game is to proceed slowly on the way to hell and to be the last player outside the hell.

name: Domingo
description: Japanese card game, which looks similar to UNO, but is a set collection/hand management game. Domingo is spelled with the "m" turned on one end resembling a three as the game is about collecting triplets (three of a kind.)

name: Course de la Paix
description: The Course de la Paix was the most important cycling race behind the iron curtain. It started in 1948 and is still running. This is a Czech game from 1991. Unique for a cycling game is that it feature hexagons. The board is big (90x60cm.) and reversible. Each team consists of 4 wooden riders (20 in total since it can be played with up to 5 people).

name: The Teachers Game
description:
The teachers game consists of four different, all slightly silly, but entertaining games, based around school room subjects. The aim of the game is to score more points on your School Report Card than any other pupil.'

English questions involve completing a phrase using an adjective beginning with a particular letter without repeating a word already used or hesitating for more than 10 seconds.

Geography questions involve naming a country, town, river, or state that begins with the last letter of the name of the country on the question card.

Maths questions involve arriving at a given number using four other numbers also given and multiplying, adding, subtracting, or dividing.

Art questions involve choosing a word from a card and communicating the word by drawing on a pad.

name: Onnimanni
description:
Your opponent has placed a treasure under the pictures. Your job is to find out where it is!
By making clever questions you get clues where to find the treasure. But it's not so simple the opponent can only answer yes or no to your questions and the amount of questions is also limited.

Similar to Secret Square with a different player count and slightly different rules.

name: Goldmine Trails
description:
Goldmine Trails - A Wood Building Game

"The Fun of a game... The challenge of a construction kit... The reward of accomplishment... All in one set."

Players roll the die, then add, subtract or move the wooden trail-building pieces accordingly. The object is to construct a trail on each turn so that the gold rolls successfully from the entrance of the trail to the red miners' pan at the end of the trail. The first player to collect 10 gold pieces wins!

name: Cursed Earth Game
description: Game based on the Judge Dredd comic. Mega-city 2 is threatened by a deadly plague and Judge Dredd sets out on dangerous journey through the Cursed Earth to deliver a vaccine. Guide your player - Judge Dredd, "Spikes" Harvey Rotten, Tweak or a nameless judge - from Mega-city 1 to Mega-city 2. During the game, you will spend resources and credits to get through the dangers of the Cursed Earth. The player with the most credits when the game ends is the winner. This game was originally published in the 2000AD comic book issues #75-80.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Science Fiction, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Walt Disney's Uncle Scrooge Lost Money Game
description:
This game appears to be a typical children's Spin and move game with the object being to collect all the "lost" gold and return it to the center.
According to the box the contents are:
16 playing pieces (colored plastic cups in 4 colors)
spinner (for movement)
Gameboard
Winner card
Though its not listed I'm assuming that instructions of some kind are included (though my copy is missing so maybe not)

name: Eurooppa-peli
description:
Eurooppa-peli [Finnish for "The Europe-Game"] is an educational party game. It combines a simple roll-and-move mechanic with trivia. Players move their pawns around a map depicting the 2006 member states of the European Union. After each move the players answer questions arranged in five broad topics: A) The EU; B) sport; C) history & geography; D) art, science and technology; and E) society, nature & culture. For a correct answer the player receives an EU-flag within that topic. After collecting ten flags (two flags of each topic A-E) the player heads for goal and wins the game.

This seems a very simple game that has its primary purpose in teaching matters concerning the EU with European history and culture. The components of the game are nice and look professional enough, but there is very little to call a design here.

name: Tiamat
description:
This is an abstract game that kind of resembles the old old video game "Snake" -- where you moved your snake around the screen eating blocks, and each block you ate lengthened your tail, making it harder to move.

But, your moving around a set of circular rings, collecting blocks that have different scoring values, in competition with everyone else collecting blocks that will grow your snake, and trying to end at the centre square with the most valuable snake you can get.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=18
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Benjamin Bl√ºmchen: Verstecken im Zoo
description: Aim of the game is to be last own who still got a hidden animal. Preparation of the game is that every player gets 3 animal tiles (bushes on the reverse side) and 5 other tiles with bushes on each side. Starting with the first player every player places a tile face down,so that a matrix is built. after every one has played his or her cards, starting player place his figure and can turn over an adjacent tile. If its an animal he gets another move (vertically or horizontally, turn over another tile)
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Don't Wake the Giant
description: A game similar to Operation where players attempt to retrieve stolen treasures from a giant without waking him up by using a pair of tweezers and not touching the edges where the treasure is stored. Ages 6 and up.

name: Get That Toy
description:
Description from box back:

"A fantastic toy is being sold in the toyshop and it's the only one left. You want that toy and you want to get it as fast as possible. So get your shopping carts and go, go, go for that toy!

Move your character playing piece on the stairs by moving your shopping cart playing piece around the board and landing on the shape, which is the same as the shape in front of your character playing piece and also has the same colour. Be the first to reach the toyshop to get the toy and win!

This matching game will not only develop the children's motor, and visual and observation skills but also provide them with fun and enjoyment. "

Ages 5 and up

name: Space Rockets Card Game
description:
"From the Makers of UNO!" #-1079 As it so boldly claims on the package, while this was also 'Made in Belgium'! There are 34 cards in denominations from 1 to 10, as well with 2 instructions kinds for the couple of variations with this. One of those is a seemingly "WAR!" sort of game for just 2 players, and the other means would be through a "Rummy" type that allows from 2 to 4 of whom can play, using the same deck. There are some decently rendered 'Spaceships' drawings for EACH of the 10 cards and the entire contents are contained within a DECK "pack" for it all.

Recommended Ages 4 - 7, while parents may wish to have this in order to teach younger players some of the varying methods that "cards" can be used in playing GAMES with such.

name: J√§nnitt√§v√§t j√§ljet!
description:
"Exciting Tracks!"

Each player represents one of six large mammals found in the Finnish nature (wolf, lynx, elk, bear, wolverine and rabbit). From the starting area, paths of circles lead to a picture of each animal. The game is divided in two phases; in phase I, players try to collect the footprints of their chosen animal, being occasionally hindered by Wind or Snow. Phase II starts as soon as one player has collected all 14 footprints of their animal, and in this phase the players use their collected footprints as "stepping stones" to reach the picture of their animal on the board; naturally, in this phase those who managed to collect more prints in phase I have a better chance of success. Winner is the first player to reach their goal.

This is a reworking of a similarly themed game by Peliko's preceding publisher Paletti, WWF Taktinen Luontopeli, using very similar components and game board.
