5 Finnish marks (about 1.30€ in 2020) from the sale of each copy were donated to Lastenklinikoiden Kummit RY, a Finnish charity raising funds in support of five university hospitals providing a clinic for children.

Published with the new Peliko logo already, while the Finnish mark is still in use; therefore, this is from sometime in the 1990's.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Popeye Playing Card Game
description:
A basic childrens card game with the cartoon character Popeye as the theme.

It appears there are two Popeye Playing Card Game the other is Popeye Card Game. One set has the split cards the other is used for playing Animal Rummy. Most likely this should be listed as two separate games with the one falling under a rummy version.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Angel in the Attic
description:
In Angel in the Attic, players take the part of the Willowby family, who must search the house to find the missing pieces of the nativity set on Christmas morning. The children in the family liked to play with the nativity set so the pieces are scattered throughout the house. Players must use logic to correctly discover which piece was the last to be found, which room it was found in, and who found it.

This is a Christian Family game, which uses a mechanic similar to that of Clue (the cards players try to identify are placed in an envelope under the board), but without the murder theme. There are variations provided in the rules to make it more or less challenging depending on the ages of the children involved.

The game features a miniature nativity set and distinctive art on the board, box, and player tokens. The game also came with an offer from the publishers to order new custom drawn player tokens of your family based on a photo you mailed in.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Greyhound Racing: The Great Game
description: Similar to many horse racing games, in this case the players control greyhound dogs going around an oval track.

name: Etch-A-Sketch Games Pack
description: This is a cool set of overlays that allow solo play or pass back and forth type games for 2 players. Most games have solo options, but not all. It really brings new life to the Etch-A-Sketch.

name: Attraction
description: This game is based around magnetism. The board consists of 80 chips, some of whom are magnetic. Players take turns trying to pick the chips up using a magnetic stick. Differently colored chips are worth a different amount of points, and the player with the most points when all chips have been picked up is the winner.

name: Gormiti
description:
Gormiti (The Invincible Lords of Nature) is a collectible mineatures game with a very big board.

The player chooses a team of creatures with every creature having a number under their left foot, and a corresponding card with their (single) stats.

The gameboard is divided into squares, and the game consists of moving the creatures and attacking the opponents creatures.

An attack is played out with the attacker moving a monster up to the number under the foot, and then adding the remainder to the number on the creatures card; if this number is larger than the defenders number on foot plus card value, then the attacker wins, else the defender does. The loosing creature is removed from the board.

The winner is the player with the last surviving monsters.

name: Battle of the Atlantic: The Epic Struggle of the Wolf Pack vs Convoy
description: The game is a simulation of the World War II Battle of the Atlantic between Germany against Britain and the US. The game scale covers the entire Atlantic ocean from England to the US East Coast and from Greenland to South America. The game is strategic in nature but it includes U-boats, surface raiders and aircraft on an individual ship scale. The campaign game can be picked up and played to completion from multiple points in time.

name: Red Caboose
description:
(From the back of the box)
Join the Engine, the Red Caboose and their circus friends as they make their way from the station to the Big Top. Roll the dice to find out who moves. Whoever makes it to the Big Top first, wins!

Comes with 1 Die, 1 Game Board, 6 Playing Pieces: 1 Engine, 1 Red Caboose, and 4 Passenger Cars

name: The Game of Ship's Cargo
description:
This is an interesting 19th Century card game in which players take turns offering one of their goods for auction. The other players then secretly bid for the card, with all bids revealed simultaneously. The winner pays for the card, and then starts the next auction. Each player starts with 12 bidding tokens, and the goal is to collect two sets of cards. If, by the end of the game, no player has collected two sets, the player who is closest wins.

F.G. & Co. published a reprint of the game in 2004 with the subtitle A Nineteenth Century Game of Commerce.

name: Das Wissensduell: Wilde Tiere
description:
This is a trivia game about knowing or mostly estimating facts from animal behaviour and facts of all kind of animality. The game includes 100 cards with 100 Questions and answers (on the back side) and four clips in four colours used as player markers.

Players have to estimate facts and behaviours of all kind of animality. There are always 10 different possible answers. Theres a clip for each player to mark their answers on the card. Each spot with an answer can only be taken by one player. When all players made their estimations the card is flipped to the backside with the answer. The player with the correct answer or is closest to it gets the card. If theres a tie the next question/card is worth two cards (the old tied card and the next new card).
The first player with 7 cards is the winner.

name: UNO: Betty Boop Vintage
description:
Another Uno Variation. The Betty Boop Vintage Edition. Comes in a special collector's tin and stars vintage Betty Boop and company.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: On-the-Go card and rule.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: J√≥lasveinaspili√∞
description: This is a simple roll and move game where the players try to get from the starting point to the end, with 90 numbered points on the route, 14 of them with special rules. 13 of those rules have something to do with one of the Icelandic Yule Lads (similar to Santa Claus).

name: Race to the Bowl with CinnaMon & Apple
description: This is a very basic roll-and-move game on the back of a Kellogg's Apple Jacks box. It has a Caribbean island theme (get it, CinnaMon?).

name: Mix Match!
description: 60 Major League Baseball logo and mascot cards are randomly placed face up on the board. Matches are made and removed from the game board. Pairs can be next to each other or many squares away as long as there are no other cards between the match. Player with the most pairs wins.

name: The Board: Chiropractic Edition
description: This game claims to be a " Fun Way to Learn Anatomy!" and is a "Chiropractic College Primer and NBCE Part 1 Board Review". Game is basically a "Trivial Pursuit" type game with hundreds of medical questions that would only be answerable by someone in a MEDICAL Field or Profession.

name: UNO: Boston Celtics Legends
description:
Another Uno variation. UNO Boston Celtics Legends Edition celebrates basketball stars such as Larry Bird, Robert Parish, Kevin McHale, Bill Russell and more of Boston's finest.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: exclusive Steal card and rule.

name: Menu Match
description:
From the publisher:

Spin, flip and spell in this sizzling memory game. Grab your spatula and collect pairs of letters and matching words. Menu Match is a hilarious way to learn letter names and letter sounds.
All Hooked on Phonics™ games give kids several levels of difficulty, so kids can learn and play at a skill level that is just right for them.
The grill of victory!

name: Realstat Racing
description: This cycling game comes with a set of statistics, tables and simple rules. You compile a team of riders, make some stages and use die and compare the results with the stats table.

name: K√∂nige der Wellen: Das Spiel
description:
This is a game based on the movie "Surf's Up". It's a quick game where the players have to roll certain combination of dice to overcome the waves.

Each player has three dice rolls to achieve the goal. Winner is the player who reaches the island first.

A quick and fun dice-rolling game.

name: Le jeu du r√©f√©rendum
description:
In teams, or one on one, you are trying to make your side victorious in the Québec referendum.
By moving from region to region, you're collecting cards that will give you votes (points) at the end of the game.

When pawns meet in the same region, a trivia question is asked to the player who has just landed. If the player fails, the other team can try to answer the question, and gain the votes for the end game.

Once in the game, each player has to collect at least one card from the media event deck, which can make you gain or lose vote.

The game, and the cards, are all written in french.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Uffda
description:
Uffda is a trivia game for Scandinavian-Americans. As players move around the board, they answer questions about Scandinavian countries, people, and languages which are chosen based on the board spaces. The first person to reach the finish line is the winner.

It appears to be marketed to first-generation American immigrants. The box is adorned with flags from Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Iceland, and The United States.

name: All the King's Horses
description:
This game is played on an 8x8 square board, with a 2x2 square in the upper left hand of the board set aside as the 'Barn'. The players decide on the number of horses that will be used for the game (8 is a good number). At the beginning of the game, each player takes turns dropping one of those horses onto an empty cell.

On each turn, each player moves all of the horses (which move like chess knights but one player must move them west-west-north/south and the other player move them north-north-west/east). When a horse enters inside the barn it is removed from play. More than one horse can occupy a space at a time. If a player cannot move some horse on their turn, that player loses.

Diverse variants exist, e.g. impartial (all 4 possible moves for a horse are available to both players), misere play (the first player who cannot move a horse on their turn wins), etc.

name: Utah Trivia
description: Utah Trivia is a party game about the state of Utah designed with several levels of difficulty so that it can be enjoyed by all ages. Players roll and move around the outside track of the board and answer questions based on the spot they land in. A unique feature in this trivia game is the players may choose to answer with or without hints.

name: Conquest
description:
From the rules: In brief the purpose of the game is to conquer as many of the 48 states shown on the map of the United States as possible.

Description from the rulebook:

Three hundred years ago the world powers were moving. Far off to the west a great unknown wilderness was opening up. North America was being conquered and empires were being built. Today in the game Conquest we re-enact the conquering of the continent.

It is a game in which keen judgement interspersed with dashes of bluff and audacity mingle with lady luck to create a game that on one is out of until the last hand is played.

The purpose of the game is to conquer as many of the 50 states shown as possible. States must be conquered in the order listed under "Order of Conquest" shown on the game board and are also one of either four colors and have a number associated with victory points at the end of the game.

There are four phases to the game - 1) Bidding your hand, 2)Marking of conquered territory and distribution of groups, 3)Dealing new cards, 4) Additional conquest.

In the bidding phase, players bid on their hand of five cards. First player is to the right of the dealer and then in subsequent hands, the winner of the previous hand starts the bid. Starting player places a bid. Bids cannot be higher than $5 million. The remaining players can either pass, meet the bid or raise the bid. Winning hands are determined in order of winning hierarchy: Single: Highest single card of color called for; Doubles: Two matching number cards, one in the color being called; Triples: Three matching number cards, one in the color being called; Sweep: All four cards of the same number.

In the second phase, the winner of the hand takes all money bid and places one of their markers on the state or states conquered, receiving the number of regiments of troops as indicated on the conquered state. 5 regiments = 1 division. Only divisions can be placed on the maps in any territories the players owns. Players may redistribute any troops that he possesses for the purposes of defense or offense. Players can also purchase additional troops.

In the third phase, the dealers asks if everyone is ready for the deal. The dealer hands out enough cards to bring all players hands up to five cards. If a player receives a money card they can immediately turn the card in to collect the cash and gets another card.

In the final phase, players may conquer states of their opponents. Starting with the player who won the last hand states can be conquered via the following rules: 1)State must adjoin the territory of conqueror and belong to an opponent 2) Must have more troop divisions that place being conquered 3) Player must pay bank sum of 10 million plus 5 million for every divsion that opponent has in the conquered territory (Max 40 million) 4) Only one state can be conquered per hand 5) Conquered troops are returned to opponent and 6) if conquests results in a complete territory being possessed than additional troops are obtained for the district.

To conclude the game: After all states have been conquered there is a final phase of general conquest until no one has any resources left to conquer with. The winner is the player having the highest score by totaling the victory points associated with the states conquered.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Territory Building, Wargame

name: All Fall Down
description:
The exciting race game where players pieces may suddenly disappear with a "plonk".

The game board consists of two layers. The top layer has a race course with hole on each square surrounded by a plastic rim to hold upright the narrow player pawns. The bottom layer is on black card with various holes and sits inside the box. When the upper board is placed on top most squares on the race track have a solid footing for the pawns, but some have holes that allow the pawns to fall through into the box and out of the game. The boards are square so that they can be rotated in relation to each other to provide variable distribution of the holes.

Each player takes 5 pawns. The winner is the first person to get a pawn to the end of the track. Players roll the dice and move one of their pawns the distance indicated. If they have multiple pawns on the track they can chose which one to move. When a hole is discovered by a player losing their piece to it all players need to remember where it is so that they don't repeat the mistake.
mechanics: Memory, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spokaneopoly
description:
Spokaneopoly is a clone of Monopoly set in the city of Spokane Washington. The game board locations are businesses and attractions from the city.

From the publisher: Welcome to a Spokaneopoly, the game of financial domination, As a player, you will become a major part of the entrepreneurial system of our fiscal community, buying, selling and trading well-known businesses and local landmarks. Spokaneopoly emphasizes the allegiance and true spirit that make this community so wonderful. Included in this game are some of the finest and most celebrated businesses, attractions and sites throughout the area.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hund och Katt
description:
Swedish game for children.

The dogs take on the cats in the back alleys. One player takes control of the dogs (six of them), the other the cats (equal amount). The players then take turns rolling the dice, moving their animals across the board. If your animal finishes its move on top of one of the opponent's you have won that fight and the loser is removed from play.

Whoever gets his animals knocked out first loses.

name: Spytak
description: An espionage-themed game that included a Traka, an electronic number generator and game device.

name: A Bug's Life Topple Hopper 3-D Game
description:
Race your ants along a path while avoiding grasshoppers, Molt and Thumper. Use grasshoppers to block your opponents.
Be the first to reach the end and topple Hopper.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Mag-nutz
description: In this game you build a structure held together by magnets. If any pieces fall off, you have to take them back into your "hand" first one to use all of his or her pieces win. the pieces are rods, nuts, S-hooks, etc.

name: Salt Lake City Scene
description: Salt Lake City Scene is similar to, though not an exact clone of, Monopoly. Players move about a square board with spaces representing areas of Salt Lake, "the fastest growing city in the west" in an attempt to control and develop the most real estate in the city. Players are eliminated until only one remains.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Guelph on Board
description: Guelph on Board is an "-opoly" game featuring businesses and landmarks from the city of Guelph, Ontario.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Living a Country Song
description:
From the Designer:

"Traveling from Nashville through heartaches and pain, the big loser becomes the big winner!"

Players begin with 200 Happiness Points and take turns rolling dice to move their pawns around the game board. Landing on an "Emotion" or "Action" space cues the player to draw a card from the corresponding deck. The board also contains spaces such as "County Jail" or "The Brightwood" that lead to a die roll and one of six potential outcomes. These outcomes, most of the other spaces on the board, and the Emotion and Action cards contain either a happiness boost or drop and a country music cliche or song title. The rules state that "[t]he first player to lose all 200 Happiness Points is the winner, since in Country Music the 'big loser' is also the 'big winner.'"

name: Xtropolopoquetl
description:
Four Olmec boulder statues are demanding sacrifices of pure elements. A pyramid of offerings has been placed between the statues. The statues are picky and will only eat elements they favor, so it is your job to feed the statues every last morsel of their favorite element. The first player to feed a statue all of one element on the board wins.

Equipment:

* A chessboard
* 14 blocks (or other stackable pieces) each in 4 different colors (red, white, green, and blue) -- 56 blocks in all
* 4 boulder statues (rocks will do)

Players take turns moving the blocks around the board and feeding the statues. The first player to feed any of the 4 olmec statues all of its favorite element (i.e. colored blocks) wins.

Available at:
http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=17

name: The Wizard of Oz Game
description:
AKA Wizard Of Oz 3-D Board Game

Wizard of Oz game made by Cadaco in 1993.

It has a "colorful 3-dimensional gameboard" and is for ages 5 and up, two to four players.

A strictly spin and move game for very young children. feature art from the 1939 MGM movie. Only added for sake of completion.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Renaissance Man
description:
Another in Invisible City's line of free games, Renaissance Man is based on the designers' friend. In the game, players try to be like Ben, by spending their "Creative Reserves to accomplish nifty challenges and end the game with the most points in your Success pile."

Find the rules and the downloadable cards at:

http://www.invisible-city.com/play/468/renaissance-man

name: Het Hoe Overleef Ik: Spel
description:
A boardgame themed around Dutch author Francine Oomen's books.

Each players gets 4 pawns in one colour. The players places the walls on the board on the spaces marked with a star. These walls block their way. The cards, with questions and instructions in 3 different categories, are placed next to the board.
Each turn, a player throws the die and can move in either direction, but only one direction each turn and only one pawn. When a player throws a 6, that player has an extra turn. A player can pass other pawns, but cannot pass the walls.
To remove a wall, a player has to land exactly on the space where the wall stands. Then another player draws a card and chooses a question or an instruction. If the player answers the question correctly or fulfills the assignment, the wall is removed and placed elsewhere on the board.
The player who finishes exactly with one of his/her pawns on the destination field, wins the game.

name: Podium: The Game of Formula 1 Racing
description:
Features:
Lap by lap simulation of the 2006 season
All drivers who participated in the 2006 season are included. Each is rated in overall driving ability, retirement frequency, types of retirements, pit frequency and pit crew ability.
Each circuit is individually charted to give realistic lap times.
Circuits are also rated for incident frequency
Cumulative time sheet lets you track each drivers' lap-by-lap performance; position chart lets you see at a glance how the field is progressing as the race unfolds.

name: Queen Bee's Color and Shape Party!
description:
Learn about colors and shapes while racing to be the first guest at the Queen's party!

Teach children to identify six basic colors and five basic shapes with this delightful game you can play three ways. Use just the color cards, just the shape cards, or both! Students will also learn how to follow rules and take turns.

Includes game board, 36 cards, 4 markers, directions, and teaching suggestions. Supports NAEYC standards.

name: Salt Lake City on Board
description: Salt Lake City on Board is a Monopoly clone based on the capital of Utah. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Ouelessebougou-Utah Alliance. (Jail is replaced with The Utah Symphony and Opera. Is classical music really as bad as prison?)

name: En-Ar-Co Automobile Tour
description:
Actually a spin and move game for from 1 to 4 players. The game En-Ar-Co Automobile Tour was developed by EN-AR-CO Brands of Scientific Refining and produced by the National Refining Company in 1919. Each player spins to see who will go first. Players then spin in rotation, each player taking one turn. You then move a number of circles equal to the number that you spun. If the dial of the spinner lands exactly on a line you take another turn. If more than one auto lands on a circle they both stay there. Some circles give players one or more extra spins while at some other points you must go back a certain number of circles. If a player lands on the last circle located at number 45 before entering the large final circle, he must spin a #1 in order to win the game.

See Also:

En-Ar-Co Auto Game A similar 1925 game also issued by En-Ar-Co, with a different track.

description: Utah on Board is a Monopoly clone based on the state of Utah. Board squares are replaced with landmarks, tourist attractions, and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit Utah based charities.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Idiot's Pursuit
description:
Subtitle: The satirical trivia set

A set of 56 expansion cards for trivia games, intended to be used to spike the decks of other trivia games.
Categories:
God & Creation
Hitler & The Gang
Sex & Minorities
Aliens & Other Animals
Sports & Lesions
Excrement & Showbiz

Sample Questions:
Q: What do American Indian paratroopers shout?
A: Custer!

Q: What builds strong bodies 12 ways?
A: 12 kinds of regular exercise.

Q: What does a second throw into the ring to stop a boxing match?
A: A .38 [pistol]
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Erd≈ëgazda
description:
A Hungarian game in which you will have to create a forest containing different kind of trees. You will have to buy saplings, plant and grow them up, chop them out to sell them so you can buy more saplings, and you will have to manage wild animals.
It's a simple roll-and-move game, but in several fields you can draw cards that can contain questions about the forest and foresters, or you will have to recognize pictures of animals and plants for an extra roll.
The winner is who is the first having a full grown-up forest.

name: Culture Crazy
description:
From the Game Box:
"As one of the world's great adventurers you have charm, wit, a thirst for knowledge and a passion about the world we live in. These qualities will serve you well in this exciting game about world cultures!
The object of Culture Crazy is to collect five cards, one from each of the Landmark, History, Culture, Food and Continent categories. Cards are collected by successfully answering questions about different cultures or by simply being lucky. The questions are graded into three levels, Young Explorer, Annual Traveler and Seasoned Traveler to help players of all ages on a level playing field.
Simple really... however, pitfalls may be waiting for you. You will get competition from other players, you may lose your travel documents and some days you may just feel a rest is needed to recharge your batteries."

name: Dreamspell
description: The Dreamspell Oracle of Destiny is played using the Galactic Compas, Oracle Board, Journey Board and Book of Kin included in the box. There is also a Color Cube and Solar Seal chips. Your goal is to gather the rainbow nation in order to re-establish harmony.

name: First and Ten
description:
From the box, "New, Exciting Football Game, Ages 8 and up"
The game is played on a metal board/field with yard line markers on it. The football, yard marker and 10-yard stick have magnets on their bases. The game is played with 2D6, two nicely mounted results tables, and a pack of paper score sheets about 4" x 6".

name: Karnevalspelet
description:
Every fourth year there is a student carnival in the university city of Lund, Sweden. This game was published for the carnival of 1986. Basically, it is a variant of Monopoly and Finans with a carnival theme. Players are trying to be the first to collect five floats for the carnival parade. Players roll and move on the board, picking up cards and performing various actions. Interestingly, these `students´ can buy and sell shops on the board. There are also more believable actions, like attending lectures.

Contents:
Game board
6 pawns
2 dice
Various cards
Paper money

Pawns and dice are of traditional standard, while cards and rules are very simple but functional.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Knattespel
description:
Simple childrens game for kids Ages 4 and up.

The game includes 6 game boards, 24 wooden playing pieces, numbered 1 to 6 and a D6.

First six playing pieces are placed on each gameboard face down, on the two lower rows.

Each player throws a dice and takes a playing pieces from his or anyone else's gameboard and tries to match it to his game boards two upper rows. If the piece picked doesn't match a free space on the upper rows, the piece is placed face-down on a free square on the lower rows on any gameboard. Winner is the player who first fills the upper two rows with the matching playing pieces.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Samla Knattarna
description:
A Swedish Childrens' game depicting popular Disney characters (Huey, Dewey and Louie).

It includes 54 colour coded jigsaw game tiles and a colour six-sided die.

Each player throws the colour D6 and picks up a matching tile. The object is to collect as many three pile coloured sets.

No numbers and only colours makes it playable for kids down to three years old.

name: Tellusspelet
description:
You start at earth creation, and with help of a dice race towards the space age.

The game mechanism is simular to the game 'Snakes and Ladders'.

name: M. C. Hammer's Rap A Round Game
description:
"The game where you rap to win."

"The rap game that's played to music."

Players move around the board as they follow instructions from rapper M.C. Hammer on a cassette tape. The players attempt to finish rap songs with their own lyric lines.

Includes a colorful board with a spinner, cards, cassette tape, 6 tokens, plastic storage insert, and a "boom box" card holder.

Tiger Electronics Model 3-147 (c)1991

name: Gingerbread Boy
description: Gingerbread Boy Game was produced by Samuel Lowe Co. of Kenosha, Wis. Game number 581-4, and was part of their nursery rhyme game collection. The box has a brightly colored illustration of a giant gingerbread boy watching as a smaller version of himself runs by with the farmer and his wife chasing after him. The game includes a spinner, a game board and four wooden pieces as well as directions on how to play the game. The game is a simple spin and move game which was somewhat a kin to Sorry or any other game of that ilk. One spun the spinner and with a spin of a 6 one got a piece onto the board. After more spins that piece and others moved around the board and eventually wound up in the home square. Successfully getting all pieces into the home square resulted in you winning the game.

name: PowerLunch!
description:
All those business cards that people hand you can finally be put to good use! PowerLunch(tm) is a two-person game where these cards can be used to battle each other for the one thing they are best suited to attain: a free lunch.

Each player draws 5 business cards from a pool of at least 20. Cards are then flicked across the play area and if they land near an opponent's card, they attack using the digits of the main phone number on the card.

Cards are classified as one of three types:
1. Free Agents: Someone who is self employed or freelance (or don't specify their employment). These get two moves per turn.
2. Chiefs: Any card from an executive or someone in an obvious leadership position. These get +1 to attacks if they touch their opponent.
3. Underlings: Anyone else. These may be attached to a Chief, and then moved (by hand) to the Chief's new position after he/she is flicked.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting

name: Bienen-Stich
description:
It is a trick-taking game with 52 honey-bee cards around two rivalling honey bee-colonies.
The player with 1000 points wins the game.

name: Mein erstes Naturspiel: Kennst Du den Baum?
description: The players try to lay open the cards of a tree species and to get wood stones for this action. When all seven tree species in the row 1-5 lay open the game is over, and the player with the most wood stones wins.

name: F√∏rstehjelpsspillet
description:
From the back of the box:
Førstehjelpsspillet er et familiespill som kan spillers med opptil 6 deltakere. Deltakerne skal på tur i Norge, underveis må de løse oppgaver og utføre førstehjelp for å komme videre mot målet. På turen støter de på både behagelige og ubehagelige overraskelser. Riktig besvart førstehjelpsoppgave belønnes med en bit av "Røde Kors-puslespillet" - når en deltaker har puslet et komplett rødt kors må vedkommende inn til vårt hovedkontor i Oslo for å vinne.
...Men det er selvsagt ikke så enkelt...

Th First-Aid Game is a family game for up to 6 players. The players are going on a trip in Norway. During the trip they have to solve tasks and perform first-aid to get to the target. The players will encounter both pleasant and unpleasant surprises. Correctly answered questions rewards you with a piece of the "Red Cross-puzzle." When a player collects all the pieces he or she need to get to our headquarters in Oslo to win.
...But that is of course not that easy...

The game is manufactured by Allservice AS. A company based in Stavanger, Norway that focus on work training
for unemployed and disabled persons.

name: Cowboyopoly
description:
From the manufacturer:

RIDE’EM COWBOYS! EE-YAH!
Oklahoma State University is up for sale! You could be the proud new owner of Whitehurst Administration Building, Lewis Field, the Chi O Clock, or even Eskimo Joe’s! Whatever happens, it’s gonna be fun for alumni, students and friends of OSU. Who knows? You may soon be the newest member of the Cowboy Marching Band!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Tikkertje
description:
Simple Roll-and-Move childrens game based on the Sesame Street series.
Players attempt to 'tik' (ie tick/touch) the character/color indicated by the drawn card.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Quiz mit Pfiff
description: As many quiz-questions as possible have to be answered correctly, in order to reach the finish by correct answers and a good portion of luck. The winner may call himself "Pfiffikus".

name: UNO: Hi Hi Puffy Amiyumi
description: This is a themed version of Uno based on the Cartoon Network animated series "Hi Hi Puffy Amiyumi." This version of Uno comes with a special Rock-'n'-Swap wild card. The player who plays the Rock-’n’-Swap card can trade hands with any player or cause any other two players to swap hands. A Rock-’n’-Swap card can be played at any time - even if the player has another playable card in hand.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: UNO: Ratatouille
description: This version of Uno uses the theme of the Disney/Pixar movie: "Ratatouille." Includes a special card not found in regular Uno, the "Recipe For Chaos" card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: UNO: Magic Treehouse
description: This is a version of Uno themed on The Magic Treehouse, a series of children's books for young readers. This version of Uno includes a special card not found in regular Uno, the "Fly Away" card, which operates both as Wild card and also allows a player to "Fly Away" and look at another player's hand.

name: Paddington's Travels
description:
Millions of children have met Michael Bond's famous bear from darkest Peru, in books and television.
Now they can help Paddington on his travels!
The object of the game is to collect photographs and souvenirs of his adventure. The first person to complete their scrapbook and take Paddington back home to Windsor Gardens is the winner.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Fishing for Nephites
description: This is a children's/family card game aimed at the LDS (Mormon) community. Cards have images and information from the Book of Mormon, and the game utilizes a rule set fairly similar to that of a Go-Fish type game.

name: UNO: Kobe Bryant Special Edition
description:
Uno variation themed on Kobe Bryant, star basketball player for the NBA Los Angeles Lakers team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "Three-Pointer" card and rule which allows you to choose a player to keep drawing cards until they can draw a #1, #2, or #3 card.

name: Shah-Shah
description:
From the box cover - "Fascinating Game of Old Persia"

This game is similar to the Parker Brothers game "Sorry" but with rolling a die to move their markers instead of drawing a card. Players start with their two wooden disk playing pieces in one of the four corners of the board and attempt to be the first to get both of them safely to the middle of the board.

On the board are spaces labeled "safety" (on which pieces are safe from being returned to their home base) and "Shah" (from which the game gets its name) which allows a piece to enter the center of the board (the objective of the game.)

Players may only enter the inner rings of the board through entry spaces of their color.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: UNO: A Charlie Brown Valentine
description:
Another Uno variation. This features the theme of A Charlie Brown Valentine.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Secret Valentine" card, which lets you look into your opponent's heart (and hand) and gives you an advantage in planning your moves
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Moon Shot
description:
A game about racing to the Moon and back, while avoiding pitfalls that open up in the board during play.

Components:
- 8 wooden pawns in 4 colours (red, green, yellow, blue)
- A 14" square board with a spinner, showing concentric zones players travel through (Launch Pad - Entry - Orbit - Moon Landing - Orbit - Re-entry - Safe Landing on Earth). The board has 40 holes in it, with a separate cardboard disc underneath. The bottom disc has 21 holes and can be rotated incrementally so through-and-through holes open and close in the board as they match up.

Players have two pawns each, spin to see who starts (this is the only function of the spinner in the game), then move one space at a time from Launch Pad through the different zones, then back to Earth. If he lands on a hole in the "Orbit" zone that shows a dot in his colour, he can "shoot the Space Gun" (rotate the bottom disc one space left or right using a finger hole). This will make some new holes open and others close in the board, and any pawns falling through new holes must begin again. The winner is the first player to have both his pawns complete the journey to the Moon and back again.

Box says this game was based on "Outer Space Station #1" by Abel-Klinger, a game publisher in West Germany.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: UNO: Brian Urlacher Special Edition
description:
An Uno variation themed on Brian Urlacher, star football player for the NFL Chicago Bears Football team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "MLB" (i.e. Middle LineBacker) card and rule.

name: UNO: LaDainian Tomlinson Special Edition
description:
An Uno variation themed on LaDainian Tomlinson , star running back for the National Football League San Diego Chargers Team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "MVP" card and rule commemorating Tomlinson's selection as the NFL's Most Valuable Player

name: UNO: Los Angeles Lakers Legends Edition
description:
An Uno variation based on great players from the National Basketball Association (NBA) team, the Los Angeles Lakers. Cards feature Hall of Famers and championship winners including Shaquille O'Neal, Magic Johnson, Jerry West, James Worthy, Kareem Abdul-Jabaar & more.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Has an exclusive "SHOWTIME!" card & rule which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno.

name: UNO: New York Knicks
description:
An Uno variation themed on the National Basketball Association (NBA) team, the New York Knicks

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "Dunk" card and rule commemorating John Starks' 1993 driving, left-handed tomahawk slam.

name: Kolardo: A Space Age Classic
description:
From the rules: Kolardo will fascinate and entertain all who play, and at the same time will unfold the beautiful and subtle, yet simple language of COLOUR. Produced for ASCIA by Neil John Productions Ltd., New Zealand.

Basic Information: The Kolardo Pack comes with 54 cards representing 9 colours (3 primary, 1 secondary, and 5 tertiary colours), a rule book, and a rule card for advanced play. The basic concept of the game is capturing melds of secondary and tertiary colours by playing and discarding cards to the piles next to the draw stack.

name: Auktion
description:
In this game of auctions and dice the players try to amass the greatest fortune by buying cars in auctions, and then earning money on these by being lucky in their dice rolls.

The game consists of:
- Twenty cars: Eight blue, ten red, and two gold.
- Money: In denominations from 100 to 5000.
- A Gavel: For the auction master.
- Bonds: Six for each player.

The players are given 23.500 in cash and six bonds ranging from 1000 to 6000.

The game consists of 20 rounds where the cars are sold to the players and money are earned or lost.

First the eight blue cars and then the two gold cars are sold:


Auction the cars. The highest bidder takes the car and pays the bank.



Roll dice. Every player roll their two dice.


The players then either pay or get money from bank according to the roll:

Series (N, N+1): The player adds the dice and times this with the added up value of the cars (100 and 200). The sum is paid from the bank to the player.

Even (N, N): The player can sell the N bond to the bank. It is possible to trade with other players for this.

Tax (Anything else): The player pays tax to the bank: Number of cars times times the value of the cars (100 and 200).

Then the ten red cars are given away.


Each player rolls the dice, and the player with the highest roll is given a red car. Players also pay or recieve money as above.


When the last car has been given away, the players add up their cash, subtract their remaining bonds, and add up the value of their cars: 5.000 for blue and red, and 10.000 for gold.

The winner is the player with the largest fortune.

name: UNO: Tom Brady NFL Greatest Players
description:
An Uno variation themed on Tom Brady, star quarterback for the National Football League New England Patriots Team.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Exclusive "Passer" card and rule which does not correlate to any card/rule in regular Uno.

name: UNO: Hairspray
description:
Themed Uno game based on the the movie musical, "Hairspray"

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The special "Swap Partners" card and rule, which allows you to swap hands with another player.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: UNO: Fat Albert
description:
Themed Uno game based on the the classic animated TV Show, "Fat Albert and the Cosby Kids"

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The special "Brown Hornet Superhero" card and rule, which does not correlate to cards/rules in regular Uno.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: UNO: David Ortiz Limited
description:
An Uno variation featuring the theme of David Ortiz, the star player for the Major League Baseball (MLB) team, the Boston Red Sox.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Big Papi" card and rule (referring to Ortiz's famous nickname), which does not correspond to any card/rule in regular Uno.

name: UNO: David Wright Special
description:
An Uno variation featuring the theme of David Wright, the star player for the Major League Baseball (MLB) team, the New York Mets.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Hot Corner" card and rule (referring to Wright's position at third base), which does not correspond to any card/rule in regular Uno.

name: Spill Your Guts
description: The pressure's on as student surgeons try to assemble all the patient's organs—without spilling its guts! Using the included 100 true/false question cards, students answer questions about the human body and its organ systems. When they answer correctly, they earn an organ to place in the body tray. When they answer incorrectly, they spill the guts—and start over! Collect the most correctly answered question cards to win. Game features 11 plastic organ pieces: heart, 2 lungs, 2 kidneys, diaphragm with trachea, pancreas with spleen, stomach, liver, small and large intestines and rib cage. Clear plastic body tray measures approximately 16"L. For 2–4 players or teams.

name: This is your town: Parramatta game
description:
The object of the game is to move around the Australian city of Parramatta and acquire ten destinations cards by moving around the gameboard. The first player to do so, wins.

The contents of the game box reveal a mounted mapboard showing the cbd (central business district) of Parramatta divided into movement spaces, a pair of six-sided dice, 12 player tokens, a pack of money in different denominations, a pack of surprise cards and a pack of destination cards.

In preparation, each player is given a $100 cash scrip and a token. Tokens are placed in the locations indicated on the board, as are the shuffled surprise and destination cards. The first destination card is turned face up.

Each player takes a turn by rolling the two dice and moving round the board with the object of being first to reach the destination address. A player rolling doubles is allowed to go directly to the destination and claim the card. Each destination card claimed requires a payment of $50. Extra money may be acquired by moving to indicated spaces at a rate of ten times a dice roll (doubled if doubles are rolled). Spaces marked 'surprise' require a relevant card to be taken by a player and the text is acted upon. A player landing upon another's space may purchase a destination card for $25 from that player or take another turn.

The game ends when one player has collected ten destination cards.

name: I've Got Skunks!
description:
From the publisher:
"Bluff your way to victory! Players take turns laying matching animal cards face down. Since you can't see them, are you sure they match? Can you trick your opponents into believing you? If you can, you can get rid of your cards very quickly. But, don't get caught bluffing or you'll get skunked! Contents: 50 cards, game rules in English and French."

name: Olympic Challenge: The Boardgame
description:
From the publisher: "Take the Olympic Trivia Challenge and play through the Olympic 5 Rings. Test your knowledge while competing with family and friends. Learn how the Olympic movement inspires everyone around the world in friendly competition. Feature categories include: Athletes, Countries, Events, Olympic History, and Rules and Records."

Set includes game board, question and answer cards, medal cards, die and 5 playing pieces. For 2 to 20 players.
Purchase supports US Olympic team. Ages 12 and up

name: Roll Over Rover
description:
The color matching game with the tumbling pup!

The die in this game is a large colorful puppy. You roll the puppy to see what color you move to. You can connect the paths to make the game as long or as short as you like. The paths are also double sided to provide 2 levels of play for both beginner and advanced players. Ages 3 - 7 with no reading required.

name: Two's Golf / 2's Wild
description:
The box contains two games.

TWO'S GOLF shares some features similar to the much more recently released Box of Golf. The score sheet consists of 18 hole, each consisting of 22 spaces. The first space is the tee, the last space represents Out of Bound, and the remaining 20 in between are either various hazards (water, shrubs, sand), fairway, or the flag. The flag is usually between spaces 8 and 20, depending on the length and par of the hole.

To begin a hole, you must pick up the number of dice corresponding to your first choice for a club (3 for driver, 2 for iron, 1 for putter, 1 for sand wedge). Ball movement is determined by the sum of the dice rolled. Continue on making a new club selection, taking a swing, and marking off the ball movement until it lands in the hole.

The six-sided dice in game are all identical: 1, 1, 2, 2*, 3, 3. The asterisk gives you the ability to double the sum of the dice roll.

2'S WILD is a Yahtzee clone specifically designed to take advantage of the dice for TWO'S GOLF. Five dice are used for the various scoring combinations. There are score pads included for that game as well.

name: Die wilden Fussballkerle: Fluchduell
description:
Big talking with fast reactions...! This is what that little Kosmos title is all about.
Quickly the cards are turned over and as soon as two cards match each other a wild curse has to be spoken out loud!
However, every card shows a different curse and only the first player to swear the right curse scores the card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Real-time, Sports
mechanics: Acting, Memory, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck

name: J√§√§ tai jatka
description:
"Stay or Go"

This is a fairly basic roll-and-move aimed to teach children color recognition and set collection.

The game board is a spiral-shaped worm divided in coloured segments (4 colours/black with number/white). Players start in the head and move towards the tail. Landing on a coloured space gives the player one counter (quarter) of that colour; landing on a white has no effect; and landing on a black space causes the player to lose a number of quarters, the colors chosen by player.

Quarters collected during the game are scored when all players have either finished or dropped out. Quarters forming a circle of a single colour score the most, quarters forming multi-coloured circles score less, while left-over quarters score least.

During the game, there are four chances to drop out, identified by the grey shaded areas. This may make sense because the numbers in the black segments increase towards the end, and a player that has collected a good set of circles may want to cut her losses rather than carry on.
(This is the sole tactical choice in the game.)

Paletti game no. 4065
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Detective Game: Suspicion
description:
"Suspicion" is a detective game set in the times of the legendary private-eye Sherlock Holmes.
The playing board represents London.
Each player is a detective whose aim is to solve the crimes of three suspects. There are 24 suspects in all. Each of these bears the name of a fictional Victorian criminal and four items of information. These are:
1. a clue to identification
2. evidence of the crime
3. proof (fingerprint)
4. a district of London
To solve the crime, the detective must collect every item of information on the card.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: De schippers van de Kameleon
description: Based on the popular 'Kameleon' series, players each have their own Kameleon boat, with which they need to save four different animals from drowning. Players choose cards to plan their sailing route in the lake, where the animals are. If they have a rescue buoy in the right place in their 'route' they can save an animal. The first player to save all his animals wins the game.

name: Tiddle Tennis
description: A tiddly winks variant based on tennis, played on a cloth game board.
publishers: London Magic Company, O Schoenhut & Co. Inc.

name: Black Gold
description:
From the game bix:


Purchase leases
Acquire a rig
Drill and complete
Sell oil to create revenue


The roll of the dice and the luck of the draw combined with the skillful movement of your token and keen Wildcat bidding could make you rich in the game of BLACK GOLD. But watch out for the Patch Problems.

For ages 8 to adult

ADDITIONAL note:
The game was created in the small town of Rhein, Saskatchewan Canada. No designer name given.

Box cover has 4 colour photographs of oil well-related scenes. Good board quality. Has look as though it would play along lines of Monopoly mechanics-wise

name: Medieval Knights
description:
A small gift game sold at English heritage sights which feature castles, abbeys or some medieval history,

Game box comes with 5 pewter Knights from different ages in history, games is very basic get from one side of a slim checkered board to the other, one player has 4 figures the other player just 1.

from the back of the box:
This period in history relates to what was is know as the high middle ages, the three centuries between 1100 and 1485. the church was at the center of medieval life and castles where strongholds as well as centers of law and government. In the C11th and the C12th large numbers of knights left England for the religious wars of the crusades to the holy land. by the 1300s more than 1500 castles had been built throughout the land knights had more peaceful interests. Heraldry was the order of the day and the rules of chivalry; Tournaments of Arms and jousting were popular pastimes.

name: The Princess Bride
description:
A promotional board game issued with the Video release of the movie.
The rules are listed on the game board itself, as well as a note that you need to provide your own die and counters.

From the game board:
"Help Westley to rescue the beautiful Princess Buttercup from the evil clutches of the kidnappers. All you need is a dice, counters and the bravery to outwit the monsters and win the battles in your quest."

A simple roll-and-move game, with the odd square providing bonuses such as "Win the fight with rodents of unusual size. Go forward 3", and the occasional problems such as "Delayed by torture, go back 3".

name: High School Musical 2 CD Board Game
description:
What Time Is it?

It's Summertime! School's out! Move around the board chilling with the High School Musical gang. The goal is to win the Star Dazzle Award at the Talent Show. To do this, work hard at your summer job to collect Cast cards. Answer trivia questions and perform fun activities. If you're successful, clock out from work earning your pay - a treasured Cast card!

Collect 6 different Cast cards and get to the Stage first for the Summer Talent Show.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Singing

name: Bumpy The Funny Little Bear Game
description:
Very simple roll-and-move game for young children.

Players spin the spinner & move the indicated number of squares along the track, obeying any instructions on the square where they land. The first player to reach Mother Bear by exact count is the winner.
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: OOgal!
description:
From the back of the box:

OOgal is a fast-paced exciting game building on the dual classic concepts of word-building of Scrabble(tm) and dice play of Yahtzee(tm). In OOgal, players roll the special dies in an attempt to build words with the greatest point score. Unique 20-sided dies contain all the consonants, while the custom cubes contain all fo the vowels. If OOgal eyes on the special black die is rolled, an OOgal occurs and the score is doubled. A 60-second sand timer keeps the action going while a player races through multiple rolls to build the greatest scoring word. Multiple words, slang terms, and proper names can also be spelled at the discretion of the players. Great game for the entire family at home, at camp, or on the go. Makes a perfect gift!

name: Den magiska nyckeln
description:
This is a childrens game Ages 4 - 7.

Contents:
24 cards
1 Magic key
1 wooden board with reply opportunities

This game will help the children to be a little bit interested in learning, and also helping them to understand how things are put together.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Destination Dublin
description:
A game of taxi driving through Dublin. It's a rather random process of collecting fares, avoiding fines, and other such mishaps, while visiting many of Dublin's tourist destinations.

One of many in the "Destination" series.

name: Larva dig inte!
description: This is a children game that will teach them to play tactically. Each player has a worm card in their color. To win the game you have to get rid of yours as soon as possible and also try to affect your opponents so they cant lay their worms down.

name: Blade
description:
“Solo Card game based on the Blade Movies/Comics. Blade is a Daywalker Vampire Slayer.”

The game is played with two decks, the Aid Deck and the Foe Deck. The latter contains various Foes and Locations. Blade starts with twenty Blood Points and five Aid Cards. He must battle a series of Foes at a number of different locations.

“Victory: You win if at the beginning of Foe Phase all Foe cards in the game are in the Foe discard pile. You lose if Blade is reduced to zero or less Blood Points.”
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Newsreel Trivia
description: Newsreel Trivia is a board game which also comes with a VHS tape with original News footage from British Movietone from the 20th century. The game contains a board, video, over 2000 questions, pawns and dice.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Legend of the Five Rings Skirmish
description:
"Board & card game for 2 players. Based on the Legend of the Five Rings Games. Each figure represents a Hero or a company or unit of men. Victory: You win if you kill your opponents Warlord."

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the units. Each player has sixteen units: four Infantry, four Cavalry, four Archers, one Champion, one Shugenja, one Clan specific unit, and a Warlord.

The game describes eight Clans the players can choose from. Each Clan has a unique special unit and rules for how the clan can use Power Cards.

A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw a hand of cards from a common deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, or defend.

name: UKopoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μœåνος (alone or single) + polein πωλε·øñν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Yet another college themed Monopoly clone.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Rampage! Mamontov's Cavalry Offensive, August 1919
description:
From the Firefight Games website:

Mamontov’s offensive was launched by Denikin on August 10, 1919, and quickly broke through the front in the vicinity of Novokhopersk creating a serious threat.

It consisted primarily of the 4th Don Cavalry Corps (8500 Cavalry), 3000 infantry, although fully supported with a few tanks, armor cars, and aircraft. Over 300 vehicles provided various duties, as well. The chosen sector for the attack lay between the Red 8th and 9th Armies and was not covered well—it was very porous. The Red 36th and 40th divisions held the 100 km section of the line (with gaping holes where 40km was not covered) through which Mamontov's corps’ passed. Mamontov used air reconnaissance to find a sector where his cavalry could slip through without serious opposition to avoid contact with Bolshevik units and struck deep into the Red rear with orders to wreck the rail lines and destroy military stores as they advanced.

The Mamontov Offensive ripped through the Red lines and at lightening speed made incredible advances into the rear of the Red beast- 125 miles! Both Trotsky and Lenin were very concerned about the White advance and the ineptness of their own troops, many of which defected to Mamontov at Tambov, a supply center. Like the panzers of WW2, the White cavalry seemed unstoppable. So much so, that Red air units were sent flying to find them and attack.

Like all White attacks, it too, had begun well. However, Mamontov's men were not professionals, they more like mercenaries and were easily diverted to looting, mayhem and rape, which turned the local population against them. By Sept 10, many of his men had simply went home with the loot and soon he found himself and those that remained in a "situation" at Voronezh nearly surrounded as Red troops had finally gathered. Denikin ordered his Kuban Corps to attack from the south to divert Red divisions against Mamontov, and for the next week, a bitter battle ensued with Mamomtov trying to breakout.

The game comes with a 22x17" map, 280 counters, rules. Scale is 3 days to a turn, 3-4 miles a hex, brigades. A very fast moving game as time plays against the Whites

NOTE: Rules are split between an 11-page "Russian Civil War Series' core rulebook (actually 11 loose sheets printed single-sided), and a 5-page double sided Rampage special rules book (joined by a single staple). Counters are on a single sheet of paper and must be mounted & cut. The map is on two 11x17" sheets and must be joined together.

name: Mundo Arcana: Conquistadores del Dragon
description:
The board has tiles around it, every time a pawn ends in a tile, must fight another player to take over it; when it ends up in an Event tile, must draw a card from the event deck and fight creatures.

Fights won and areas controlled earn players victory points.

Loose translation from the game box:

MUNDO ARCANA Conquistadores del Dragon (Conquerors of the Dragon) A board full of dangers, lands to conquer, challenges to overcome, a nation to raise

Contents:
1 game board
50 challenges cards
12 conqueror cards
10 land cards
6 pawns
2 dice
Rules booklet
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Rome Is Burning
description:
"Card game for 2+ players. Roman Emperor theme. Players compete for the chance to be Emperor. The most Decadent player wins."

"Each player is either the Emperor or a Plebeian. Only one player at a time can be the Emperor At the beginning of the game all players start out as Plebeian."

The game uses a custom card deck containing numerous subdivided classes of cards, the two main categories being Assassinations and Bread & Circuses. Other cards types include Political Support, Military Support, Intrigue, Soldiers, Reputation, Private Entertainments, Public Entertainments, Orgies, Tortures, Arena Games, and Decrees.

The game board is a circular track divided into twelve spaces. Two cards are placed on each space and the players collect cards as they move around the track. The players score points based on the cards they hold, certain cards scoring points for Plebians and other cards scoring points for the Emperor.

"Victory: The player with the highest Score at the end of 7 turns wins."
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Political, Print & Play

name: Kierto
description:
Kierto (Cycle) is an educational game about recycling, designed by a group of Finnish junior high students and their teachers. The prototype won first prize in the Economic Information Office's recycling competition and was then published by EIO in cooperation with the Finnish Association for Nature Conservation.

The game board has several recycling facilities for different types of waste; each player is dealt five waste cards which they then have to deliver to the correct facilities. First one to get rid of all 5 cards is the winner. There are also event cards, which may help or hinder the players.

The die and playing pieces are wooden; the rest of the game is made of recycled paper and cardboard.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Suomen Luonnonsuojeluliitto RY, Suomen Luonnonsuojelun Tuki OY, Taloudellinen Tiedotustoimisto

name: Silja Line Risteilypeli
description:
This is a promotional game for the shipping company Silja Line.

The game board is a rough map of the Baltic sea and surrounding areas. Using Route/Ship and Place of Departure cards, the players must complete as many cruises as possible; the winner is the player who reaches Stockholm or Helsinki with the most completed cruises when the Route/Ship deck runs out.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Playoff Basketball
description: Using three dice (playing die, shooting die, foul shot die) players attempt to pass and score shots as in basketball. Pegs in the small wood board indicate court position. A small plastic container holds the rules, wood board, 3 dice, and 2 pegs.

name: Kartazma RGK
description:
Kartazma is a Polish CCG whose topic is the CCG players life. You are controlling a group of characters that are CCG fans. During deck construction you may choose from 3 general types of "heros": Collector ("Kolekcjoner"), Tournament player ("Turniejowiec") and Social guy ("Spo≈Çecznik"). There are also cards that represent locations like shops or clubs where you can play, some stuff cards: cell phones, bags, card protectors and finally some quests that you have to accomplish before your opponent does to win the game (like a good trade or wining 3 tournaments).

You will have to construct 3 decks: a main deck ("Talia g≈Çówna") with exactly 40 cards, character deck ("Talia Karciarzy") with 10 cards + one main character and quest deck ("Talia wyzwa≈Ñ") with 5-7 cards. Each of players must also have 3 locations which he will use during that game.

name: Haisuli vei
description:
Contents: 4 double-sided playing pieces, 4 6-piece sturdy cardboard puzzles, a bell (ála Halli Galli), gaming board, a die.

Each player represents a pair of Moomin characters. Players are trying to build a boat by collecting 6 pieces of their puzzle. Each player starts from their own corner of the board. During your turn you roll a six-sided die and move your gaming piece clockwise around the gameboard. 1st player to collect all six pieces and get back to their starting corner sails to the lighthouse island for search of a hidden treasure.

Players get pieces for their puzzles during their own turn when they pass their starting corner or when they hit a location depicting a happy sun on the board and their gaming piece also shows a happy sun. When player hits a location that shows different sun than their gaming piece at the moment, their piece is flipped over (happy/sad).

It is possible to get a piece of the puzzle during someone elses turn: The die has numbers from 1 to 5. One side has a picture of "Haisuli" eg. Stinky. Whenever this side comes up, whoever is first to hit the bell in the middle of the board (at the lighthouse island) grabs a extra piece for their puzzle.

Also, it is possible to lose already collected puzzle pieces when you hit a sad sun and your gaming piece also shows a sad sun or when you hit another players starting corner.

Game of The Year 2007 Childrens Game finalist in Finland.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Book, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Puzzle, Travel
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Over They Go
description:
A fun party game for all the family, Ages 4 and up
The object is to build a tower as high as possible before it topples and to score points accordingly.
There are two ways to play, rules for both are printed in the box lid.
The tower is built using the ping-pong type coloured balls and the connecting tubes.

name: The National Gallery
description:
An antique card game in which the players attempt to collect sets of picture cards belonging to particular artists. The deck includes an Index card for each artist which specifies how many cards are in that artist's set. The player who collects the most cards is the winner.

Alternate rules are included for a game in which one player, the "President", starts with all the Index cards and asks each of the players in turn for a card from a certain artist until all of the sets have been made up. The players win and lose counters from a pool during the course of the game. The player with the most counters at the end wins the game.

There were at least two versions of the game published - one for the "British school" of art and one for the "Dutch school."

name: Crown the Queen
description:
The object of this card game is to be the first player to crown the queen. This is accomplished by laying down cards to form the queen's procession.

Each player is dealt three cards and the remainder of the pack is placed face downwards in the centre of the table. Players look at their cards and the one on the left of the dealer takes the top card from the centre pack. He then sees if he has a police-card in his hand. If so he can start the preparations for his procession immediately by laying this card on the table in front of him, face upwards. Each player makes his own procession. There are eight cards in a complete procession. If he has no police-card he passes one card, face downwards, to the next player.
If he has been able to play a police-card he takes another card from the centre pack and, if able, plays a FORCES card on to his procession and so on. When unable to add to his procession he passes any one card, face downwards, to the next player, leaving himself with three cards as at first.
Cards must be placed in a line in the following order: policeman, 3 different forces cards in any order (soldier, sailor, airman), royal coach, page, archbishop, and queen. Each processional card placed in front of a player scores 10 points and the queen-card scores 30 points, giving a maximum of 100 points per game.

A game is completed when one player has presented the Queen for crowning or the last card of the centre pack has been taken.

There are 54 cards in the deck:
7 x Policeman cards
5 x Soldier cards
5 x Sailor cards
5 x Airman cards
5 x Royal Coach cards
5 x Page cards
4 x Archbishop cards
4 x Queen cards
14 useless cards (1 each of Trumpeter, Royal Arms, Buckingham Palace, Houses of Parliament, Big Ben, Marble Arch, Hyde Park, Union Jack, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, India, Ceylon.)

name: Triple Topper
description:
Play many classics, updated for the third millennium by adding a third dimension to card games. This deck has 5 numbers, 5 colors, and 5 suits. Each card contains 1 number, 1 color, and one suit, making 125 cards, 1 for each number/color/suit combination.

This deck can play many games. (14 are currently published at with more to come when I sell 100 decks.) But all games take advantage of the fact that it's a 3 dimensional card. Play 3D versions of Crazy Eights, Memory, Spite and Malice, Speed, Poker, Rummy, Blackjack, Cassino, Euchre, Tic Tac Toe, and 2 different versions of Klondike Solitaire. Plus there's 2 games which cannot be duplicated with regular cards.

One is a 3-variable trick-taking game where you want to take certain cards but not others,Circles are worth positive points, but are the least powerful suit, and squares are negative points but the most powerful suit in terms of trick taking. But Number rank and color team declarations take precedence over suit. Can be played cooperatively, 2 on 2, or 4 for themselves. Most net positive points wins.

The other game is an elimination card game where the object is to give someone six of the same number, color, or suit to eliminate them, and to be the last one standing. Blacks, Blobs, and Question Marks always bring its owner closer to elimination. And you can play offensively on your opponents cards, or defensively to make it harder to eliminate you. A near perfect chess match with cards for 2 players, a game of negotiations if played with more.

Coming soon: 3D versions of 2 competitive solitaires, Thirty-One, Go Fish, 2 Versions of Egyptian War, another version of Spite and Malice, another version of Speed, Pope Joan, and Eleusis.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Game System, Memory, Number, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Bocaro!
description:
From the instructions:

"Bocaro....it's fun, fast and easy to play! Trying to get 12 strikes in a row for a perfect 300 game makes Bocaro exciting.....every time you play."

Bocaro is played and scored just like the sport of bowling.

Each player may turn over (roll) two cards in each frame, trying for a count of 10. If the first card is a strike you don't need to roll another card. If the second card is needed and gives you a combined count of more than 10, you only count 10 for a spare.

name: Trivial Pursuit: √âdition Caf√© Jacques Vabre
description:
Limited edition of Trivial Pursuit for the French coffee brand Jacques Vabre.
Contains
1 board
1 dice
6 round meepled
36 colored triangles (to fit into the meeples)
396 cards with questions

Categories:
blue: production
pink: coffee tasting
yellow: history and legends of coffee
brown: the brand Jacques Vabre
green: coffee producing countries
orange: green coffee

The rules are similar to the classical Trivial Pursuit.
The question are all coffee related and quite difficult.
This game was never sold in shops but distributed by the coffee brand for promotion.

name: LaRue
description:
Larue is a tile placement game in which players alternately place triangular tiles on a board such that at least one edge colour matches that of an adjacent tile. The object of the game is to be the first player to have placed all of their tiles.

The game comes in brightly coloured box with the (brief) rules printed on the back of the box. Contents are: A card game board about 28cm square to which is stuck a card border enclosing a 24cm square play area; and 72 right-angled isosceles triangular tiles, each displaying three coloured sections. All the card components are about 2mm thick are fairly well made.

There is a solo version suggested whereby the player attempts to fit all the pieces into the playing area (while observing the tile placement rule)

name: Objetivo
description:
A game of questions and answers with the themes: Geography, Sports, Music, History of Brazil and Trivia.

These are two teams with up to four players. Each team draws a letter goal, the letter shows how many questions the team need to hit, a certain subject, get to eliminate a player of the opponent team.

To each question sure the team wins a victory for the charter issue.

When one stage of your goal is met, you eliminate a player of the opponent team.

The team that eliminated all players of the opponent wins the game.

name: Klettermaxe
description:
Mountain Bike game published by Simba Toys in Italy in the 1990's, a German version was also released.

The players use mountain bikes to reach the top of a mountain, the first one to reach the top wins.

name: Testament
description:
(from the publisher's website)

Testament - 6,000 Years In The Making

Testament is a Bible-based tradeable card game. The journey begins in Genesis and progresses to the end times as told in the book of Revelations. Bible personae and locations are introduced chronologically using Testament’s time progression game mechanic. Each card features inspirational artwork from history’s masters complimented by game-play relevant scriptural quotes.
Save The Followers

A complete match of Testament consists of two games requiring players to use the Faithful Player Pack of cards for one game
and the Unfaithful Player Pack of cards for the next game. Players randomly choose who starts the first game as the Faithful Player. Victory is achieved by the player who gets the most follower tokens to their Saved Zone using the Faithful Player Pack.

name: Pok√©mon Munchin' Munchlax
description: Similar to Mr. Mouth, the Munchlax head rotates in the middle, with the mouth opening and closing as players attempt to launch small plastic pieces of food into it within the allotted time. Players are then scored based on how much food they managed to get into Munchlax's mouth (20 points for a triangle "cheese" piece, 10 for a round "apple" piece, and 5 for a "donut").

name: Het Finlandspel
description:
(from the rulebook, translated from Dutch)
"The Finland game is a boardgame for 2-4 players, where every player can learn about the possibilities of Finland as a holiday destination by doing a tour of Finland."

Depending on the desired game length players get a number of cards corresponding with destinations on the board which have to be reached by moving the player's pawn across the board. There are also additional cards which the players can get by standing on yellow spaces on the board which give players additional destinations to visit or the possibility to e.g. use air travel to move faster. The game ends as soon as a player has no destination cards left in his hand.

Het Finlandspel is a promotional game distributed by travel agencies in the Netherlands in the early 1990s.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zirkusspiel
description: Moving in the circus, the players have to search for the animal species attendant related to their player role (Lions -> lion tamer). By memorizing the location of a players animal tiles and revealing them on his/her turn, the player can win.

name: The Interface of Time
description:
A skirmish level science-fiction miniatures game based on the short story "A Prayer Answered Just in Time" published in Gateway magazine.

"Nestled in the six extra dimensions of the Calabi-Yau Manifold (which is a plane higher than the four spatial dimensions of Hyperspace) every event in space in time meets with the Interface. The Interface of Time is a great ten dimensional construct which consists of archways that lead to any world at any point in that planet’s history. Humans can only perceive the first three spatial dimensions of the Interface. Thus it allegorically appears to them as a contemplative cloister with seemingly endless arcades leading forth from a monumental courtyard."

"In this game one player plays the mysterious Virtue and his human friends. The other player plays the infamous Vice and his company of evil time travelers." The object of the game is to destroy the opponent's four warriors.

name: Noar
description: Noar is a 2 player strategy board-game, that combines elements of Morris & Reversi, and is played on a Hypercube Board. Players take turns moving a piece , along the lines of the board, to a adjacent unoccupied spaces. The object of the game is to capture the other players piece by flanking it with two of your pieces.

name: Formosa Rail: 1899 from North to South
description:
Formosa Rail simulates ten years of railroad construction in Taiwan, bringing rapid ground transportation from north to south. Each player acts as one of the architects collecting five sources then constructs in four possible sites. Construction includes demolishing, tunnel and bridge building and track and station building. Player receives victory points for every construction and bonus victory point for most construction within a site. At the end of the game, player with the highest victory point wins.

Player: 2 to 5
Ages 8 and up
Time: 90 to 120 minutes

Contents:
1) 5 Player's token in 5 colors
2) 6 Player's Tile Card (3 triangle, 2 square and 1 pentagon)
3) 80 resource cards (17 labor, 15 iron, 9 rock, 21 wood, 16 brick, and 2 TNT cards)
4) 23 building cards (7 different buildings)
5) 18 building markers (3 different markers)
6) 1 round wooden marker
7) 22 rail tracks wooden stick
8) 8 landscape square wooden tile (2 mountain, 3 river, 3 forest)
9) 5 player's aid cards
10) 1 game board
11) 1 rulebook

Publisher: Academia Historica (www.drnh.gov.tw)
Production: 2Plus Studio (www.2plus.com.tw)
Designer: Ta-Te Wu, Jong Kong, and Sheries Liu
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Team-Based Game

name: Let's Go Camping
description:
