Roll and move game in which a die determines how far one can move (but the direction can be chosen). The goal is to eliminate all other players by reaching the same fields as them.

name: Katzen-Mau Mau
description: This game is similar to UNO, but cat-themed and with some minor rule changes. Also, each player holds two wooden cats. By handing in one of those cats, a player can choose to skip a turn and hand over play to the next player (together with all possible problems the skipping player may have faced).

name: Capture the Flag
description:
Race into your enemy's territory. Grab their flag and return it to your base and you will be victorious. But watch out, because your pieces can be captured and sent home empty handed.

Capture the Flag is a quick, fun game for two players. It uses a unique turn order mechanic, so you never know who will go next or what piece they will be moving.

name: Wroniec
description:
The game is published to remind people of the martial law in Poland from 1981 to 1983. Its subject is connected to the Jacek Dukaj's book of the same title.
The aim of the game is to help the main character to find his interned father. Players will have the possibility to experience a world full of agents and spies.
The game contains a small dictionary with terminology specific to the period, which helps to understand the reality of those times.

name: Counties of Britain
description:
Counties of Britain consists of groups of cards representing various counties of Britain. A group is comprised of a key card, listing all the towns (or districts) of a county, as well as a card for each of the listed towns, each having an illustration of the town and interesting, town-specific facts about industry, attractions or population.
Players compete to complete groups of cards, thus having a full county. The player who completes the most counties wins the game. In this sense, the game plays like 'go fish'.

The game was sponsored by the London and North Eastern Railway of the time and has reproductions of famous railway posters on the back of each card.

Counties of Britain is similar to Counties of England, also published by John Jaques of London.

name: Indian Safari
description: Indian Safari is an educational game about India designed for children aged 9 and above. The game board has a spinner which selects a state of India, and the player gains points for locating that state on the map. The player is then asked a trivia question about Natural Resources, Agriculture and Industry, Places of Tourist Interest, Buildings and Monuments or Culture of India. The first player to reach the end of the score track wins.

name: Campfire Clues
description:
The Game for the Great Outdoors

Grab some s'mores, gather around the fire and get ready to play campfire clues, the perfect getaway game. Families and friends will have fun trying to guess the animal, vegetable, mineral or natural wonder found on the answer board. The first player or team to reach the campsite on the game board wins the game

Contents: 110 Cards, 1 Game Board, 4 Pawns, 1 (Huge!) Die, 1 Instruction Sheet

Manufactured for Eddie Bauer Inc.

name: HBO Comedy
description:
Card game from company Trixeso.

Object of the game:
To get the most points.

How to play:
Cards are triangle shaped with pictures from movies with actors and from animations. Each player is dealt five cards and they start working together to build a pyramid 17 cards each side.
They must start from top and top card will not give points by itself.
When each row is finished 2-17 in three possible ways (triangle) then points is given. The one who placed the last card into that row will get points. 1 point for each card in the row (possible to make many row at once). 2 points for each one sex actor (male or female will give 2 points each, the one sex who is less than other). If sexes are equal, then both score 2 points each. 3 point for each animation, if at least 3 different are in the row and 5 points for the same card (3 of each in the deck). If every card is placed then the one with the most points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Stock Holding

name: Big Brother
description:
The aim of the game is to test your knowledge on how well you know your friends through a series of questions. The first player to get their token around the board wins the game.

You move around the board by correctly guessing who gave which answers to questions based on the four topics Friendship, Romance, Scandal, and True Colours. There is no right answer. Just correctly predict what others have answered.

Just like the TV show, you can nominate other players to be evicted. Votes are made in secret and then tallied when the last player passes the eviction point (about half way around the board). The player with the most votes goes back to the beginning. The first player to reach the "Win" spot wins the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Tootsie Roll Train Game
description:
This advertising travel game circa 1950's says on the Game box to "Have fun being the Engineer" in order to win TOOTSIE ROLLS.

Tootsie rolls were a brand of "chewy candy" manufactured in the USA since 1896. The game originally included some of these.

name: ChicagoOpoly
description:
A Monopoly variant based in the Chicago area. Comes with a short history of the Windy City, printed on the inner box.

From the instructions: "Entrepreneurs acquire Business Licenses, develop Offices, and purchase various goods and services (thereby stimulating the local economy)... Accumulate the portfolio of business holdings with the greatest net worth."

About NationalOpoly Sales Corporation: Headquartered in San Diego, California, they have produced city games in Chicago, Detroit, Honolulu, Minneapolis-St. Paul, Sacramento, and San Diego. Nationalopoly has made a commitment to aiding community organizations in each of these cities. As a result, NationalOpoly will contribute a minimum of $.50 of every ChicagoOpoly game sold to Comic Relief.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hearts for Kids
description:
A Classic Card Game for Beginners

Now, kids can join in the fun of one of America's best-loved card games. The concept is the same as the original, as players try to collect the fewest Hearts while they watch out for the mean, old Queen of Spades. But new rules and large cards make the game easy for chidren to learn and play - for example, players hold fewer cards at a time and count points as they go along. And once kids master the beginners' version, they can challenge their parents with the traditional game.

name: Green Day: Playing with Matches
description:
A card game revolving around the rock band "Green Day." It is a combination of the game Memory and a trivia game, based on knowledge about the band.

Played by shuffling the deck and placing all non-answer cards face down on the table. The youngest player starts by turning over any 2 cards in an attempt to find a match. If they do not match, they are turned back over. If a match is found, that player attempts to answer the questions on the cards. Play passes clockwise around the table. Correct matches receive two points and correct answers to the trivia questions receive 1 point. Players who answer both questions correctly get to take another turn. Once all cards have been matched, the player with the highest score wins.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Party Game, Trivia

name: Spanky Spanky: The Hanky Panky Game
description:
This is an ADULT party game with strong sexual content.

Players represent students at the Academy of Sweet Suffering (A.S.S.) and must attempt to move up the academic ladder to graduate... hopefully while receiving just a few spankings.

Each pupil starts the game in the locker room and advances along the path on the game board by answering questions correctly. Wrong answers result in the student getting a "black mark" score chip and three chips equals a spanking. The contestants take turns serving as the "Spankmaster General" to administer the punishments.

Various event cards guide the flow of the game, including domination and submission cards. The first player to travel up the ladder three times is declared the winner.

Includes board, cards, die, rules, scoring tokens, and a toy whip with a feather tickler!

Designed for 2 to 8 players or 2 to 4 teams.

name: TinkerBell Pardon My Pixie Dust Game
description:
From the box: Help TinkerBell and her friends get ready for Spring! Collect all the "Get ready for Spring cards" as you travel around Pixie Hollow. But don't forget your Pixie Dust... you need it to win!

Publisher: Printed under license by Cardinal. UPC 0-47754-17169-3

Theme: Disney Fairies, game for young children.

Contents: 4 playing pieces (each a different color), 16 cards (4 types: light, flower, animal, water), board, die, Pixie Dust card

Goal: Be the first player to collect all 4 types of cards (light, flower, animal, water) AND the only Pixie Dust card.

Game-Play: Roll the die and move around the board. Landing on the light, flower, animal or water fairy will allow you to take that type of card. You need one of each. There are spaces on the board that allow you to take one of these cards from another player. Also, there are Pixie Dust spaces. Landing on one of these allows you to take the Pixie Dust card (there is only one) from the other player. You need all 4 types of cards plus the Pixie Dust card to win.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Einspruch: Das Spiel der Rechtsirrt√ºmer
description: Einspruch (Objection) is a trivia game about (German) law. Players draw cards with statements regarding laws and try to guess whether the statements are true or false. Players have chips valued from 1 to 3 that they can bet on the result depending on how certain they are. Those who guessed correctly can move their pawns according to the chip they bet. The first player to reach the goal wins.

name: Kreiselspiel
description:
Each player spins all the impellers.
Each time an impeller lands in a hole you count those points to your total score. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Animal Rummy
description:
The players will be able to identify and sort animals into families according to their characteristics. The learners will be able to determine which animals belong to the Amphibian, Reptile, Mammal, Bird, Fish, and Arachnid family.

Components:
77 cards
7x10 animal groups
7 reference cards

name: ≈∞rkaland
description: This is a Hungarian space strategy game created in the 80's. One of the players, Captain John Konig protects the valuable energy packages while the others trying to get those from him. To achieve this he has to stop the other players, who have to get over various obstacles such as meteoric zones, narrow pass-through gates. These obstacles form concentric circles, the attacking players start on the outside, and their goal is to get to the center, get the energy packets, and take one of them to the starting zone. The quickest one wins the game. Each of the attacking players as well as Captain John Konig are controlling four spaceships.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Haribo: Die gro√üe Gummib√§rchen-Jagd
description: Each player has up to four gummy bears of their color. They bring more bears gradually into the game and send them off for the trusted Gummy Bear home trying to run away from the hairy, scary Gummy Bear. This is done by throw of dice. The player throws not only for his own movement but also for the pursuer, the Hairy Gummy Bear. If the Hairy Gummy Bear lands on a field with one of the players' bears, these capured bears are put in the center of the board, he is not freed until another bear is captured. The player who manages first to bring all of their color gummy bears safely home wins the game

name: CAP Kalle Ankas rymdspel
description: A simple roll and move Walt Disney game, but it is rare and it is sought by collectors.Donald Duck and his nephews are travelling in space.
categories: Dice, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Checkers III
description:
"Its just like checkers but..."
The Checkers III playing board is a hexagon divided into 96 triangular playing spaces, 48 dark and 48 light. The last player left on the playing board, following a series of capturing and trapping moves similar to checkers, but based on triangular movement, is the winner.

name: Territory
description:
From the Box:

Connect the Flags. Claim the Squares. A classic game with a new twist. When you have 4 flags around a square, you claim it with a colored flag. Then twist the flags to make a new square and keep on going. The player with the most territory wins.

name: Goda grannar
description:
From the publisher:
The biggest yacht, the fastest car, the hottest spouse and the most magnificent house – collect all the luxuries and make your neighbors green with envy, at the same time keeping a close eye on them. But remember that even the grandest empire may fall, so watch out for that nasty mother-in-law! The game where you treat your neighbors the way you always wanted to but never had the guts!

The game can be played up to 6 players. The game has four goals in the each corner of the board: the fastest car, the biggest yacht, the hottest spouse and the biggest and most expensive house. In the middle of the board you have deck of cards you use to get pieces you need to get next best thing in one of the four possible things. You move your playing piece around the cards and if you get the number necessary you can enter to the out of four big goal corners and try to get yourself the next best thing available! You win the game when the mother-in-law gets you and you have the most (better) stuff!
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Twister Moves: Hannah Montana Edition
description:
From the publisher:
Dance along to Hannah Montana's awesome songs! This cool Twister Moves game allows you to listen to her music and move as the DJ tells you to! Put the CD in your machine, set out the mats and away you go! Listen carefully to the instructions and follow the fun moves! If you're the only one to get the moves right, you win! Practice on your own and then compete against friends! A wonderful way to encourage active play! Great for any Hannah Montana fan!

name: Apr√®s Ski Het Spel
description:
There are 80 cards with questions at the front of the card. At the back of the cards there are collered lines (the ski arenas). The group or player who gets the longest line, wins the game.

The question are truth or style. If a player answers a question correctly or follows the instructions , he/she gets the card. Otherwise the card is put back in the box.

Contents:
- 80 cards
- 1 CD (just for fun)

name: Right Ascension
description:
New colonies need many things to survive... tools, food, raw materials, medicine, to name a few. Merchants and the ships they use to ply the stars are their salvation in many ways. You are one of those merchants. You are charged with ensuring that you are not only profitable, but you are keeping these new colonies alive and thriving in this backwater part of the galaxy.

You also have competitors... others who wish to attract the attention of the Emperor by being the best. You must struggle to supply systems with goods at a profit. You must also struggle to gain influence through your trade in key systems that will attract future rewards from the Emperor himself. But options are limited... you don’t hear of deliveries when needed and your opponents do.

You are beset with a changing political landscape in this sector as colonies grow. Demand for certain goods shifts like sand. Danger and discovery await. Your network of informants and insiders provide you with information. As time passes, it becomes harder to trade safely as success attracts attention — sometimes from unsavory characters. The finest merchants rise to this challenge, but they are ever-mindful of not making the Emperor jealous...

THIS is life in Right Ascension...
categories: Economic, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Transportation
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Hydro Lord
description:
From the rules introduction.
You are broke and have never succeeded financially. This time however it is going to be different, you manage to save a handful of dollars and decide to exit the rat race. You begin by investing in a business set-up; four months later you reap the rewards. Things are going smoothly, the money starts to roll in when suddenly your mates see a chopper overhead; but you are too late. Your business set-up is raided. This is one of the many scenarios that may happen to you.
Be captivated by sheer exhilaration as the game takes hold and catapults you into the secret lives of the pursued.
The winner is the player who at the end of the game, becomes Hydro Lord. Good luck.

name: Deadly Double
description:
A simple dice game with two special dice and depending on the symbols or numbers rolled you add another ante, get part of or the whole jackpot.

Famous for the ad for the game as hint for a conspiracy theory. The ad shows, among others, the numbers 12 and 7 and talks about peoples in airraid shelters, November 1941. This led to a FBI investigation if it was a secret code by the Japanes Intelligence agency for the attack on Pearl Harbour to warn their agents in the US.
The investigation led to a negative result, but the fame of the game stayed.

name: Prophecy: The Card Game
description:
Publisher's website

The goal is to find prophecies and their matching fulfillments for six famous Prophets. When a match is made it scores a point for the player who made the prophecy. The first player to make three prophecies is the winner! Throughout the course of the game, Trials and Tribulations stir up trouble. Angels and Guardians may be able to help protect your Prophets from time to time, and Divine Interventions can help you as well.

name: Campionato Mondiale Formula Uno
description:
User summary:
Roll and move race game of the early '70.
From rules:
Contestants will choose their cars and take the card boxes and card run.
Will proceed in turn by moving their marker on the track, every move you will throw 2 dice and the number obtained will happen what happens on their card race (eg wildfire: stop for 2 shifts, skidding: advance 2 spaces ...).
If the dice roll indicates the stop in the pits the player must stop at the next garage space on the track and throw a dice to see the consequences (eg, oil change: stop a turn; tire change: advance 2 spaces, etc..)
Win the race who will cut the finish line first.
It's possible can make an entire season of 15 Grand Prix.

name: Audubonopoly
description: It's Monopoly with the theme of the town of Audubon NJ. The game use local stores on the game board.The game was a fundraiser fo the local sports teams, The Green Wave.

name: Stink Fight!
description:
From the inside of the box of "Leapin' Lemurs" Peanut Butter & Chocolate cereal.

When Ring-tailed Lemurs get mad at each other, sometimes they wipe their scent all over their tails and have a sort of stinky sword fight with them. Seeing as you don't have a tail, this is an easier (and less smelly!) way to have a Stink Fight!

Object: To get your 2 tokens from the START row at the bottom of the board into 2 white spaces in the FINISH row, while avoiding other players or the black 'Aw Stink!' squares.

Components:
7 x 13 board
6 player tokens
Rules
Player provided die

name: Grandmama's New Game of Natural History
description: The center of sheet for the board for this game shows an elderly woman seated at a table surrounded by 24 compartments with fairy tale and nursery rhyme characters. There are the same number of cards with these characters together with another 36 cards showing birds and animals printed with descriptions and four lines of verse. Some of these are placed in the compartments. Players take turns to draw the character cards and collect the verse cards from the corresponding compartment. The winner is the player with most verse cards at the end of the game.

name: World's Greatest Word Game
description:
A Fabulous Game for Everyone who Loves Words -- Includes Word Poker, Word Scramble, and Word Builder

Combines three fantastic word games:

Word Scramble: Everyone works at once building as many words as possible using communal letter tiles. Player at the end with the most words wins the game -- fast and furious fun.

Word Builder: Build off other players words and be the first to run out of letters dealt -- play speeds up as the game progresses making for a fun and hectic finish.

Word Poker: Make the best poker hand you can while building words at the same time. Best hand wins unless you can out bluff your opponents during betting. Great combination of play in an incredibly fun game.

name: Final Cup
description:
Final Cup is a simple Dice Soccer game.
There is no ball in the game, the players are moved by a single 6-sided die. Once a player reaches the other teams goal a goal is scored.
The game was published in the GDR.

name: The Day's Doings of a Little Mouse: An Amusing Game for Learning French
description:
This game has 100 playing spaces. Players follow a young mouse from the time he gets up in the morning until he goes to bed at night. The French instructions are printed on the game board.

All numbers and rules are in French and the game was designed to teach the language.

Rewards: forward movement, extra turns.
Forfeits: backward movement, missed turned.

name: The New Game of Motor Tour: A journey of 440 miles from Edinburgh to London with incidents en route
description:
The board is numbered from 1 (Start) to 100 (London) with 101 and 0 after 100. The winner is the one who lands on 100. If a player lands on 101, he must leave the game as he had been killed. If a throw takes a player to 0 or beyond, they must return to compartment 86.

The Motor Tour may be taken part in by as many players as there are motors/markers. Each player starts at number 1 and plays in turn and must go on to No 2, that is, throw 1 before he/she can get a motor to commence the tour. The towns meed not be called at, but if fall on a town the player misses a turn to view the sights. More than one motor can be on the same division at the same time, and motors can pass and re-pass each other.
If fall on division marked with penalties or advantages, follow the instructions stated on the divisions.
publishers: Chad Valley Co Ltd., Glevum Games

name: Hide & Seek with the Kings & Queens of England
description: A card game with the players trying to collect additional cards to create sets/tricks.

name: Disney Handy Manny: Flei√üige Handwerker
description:
The game contains a tool box, six chips which show two different tools on their two sides (each tool appears twice) and 16 repair cards which show things that have to be repaired and the three tools needed for that.

One card is flipped open and all chips are put into the tool box. The active player shakes the tool box well, then flips it over and checks whether the chips (which fell out) show the three necessary tool symbols. If yes, then the player gets the card. If not, the chips are returned to the tool box and the box is passed on to the next player. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Idol
description: Another game based on a local implementation of the American Idol TV show concept, specifically the Swedish one. Consequently it involves trivia, singing and other elements that will cause non-fans of the franchise to want to run away quickly. Appears to be most closely related to American Idol All-Star Challenge DVD Game, although this one has 2 DVDs. Apparently expands on a previous game called Idol Karaoke.

name: Marvel Power Game
description:
The Marvel Power Game is a pull-out board game with multiple win conditions.

Gameplay consists of moving your character around the game board, accumulating cards, and battling your opponent by comparing the value of your cards.

Win the game by being the first player to accomplish one of the following conditions:

(A) Accumulate 200 Power Points.
(B) Reduce your opponent to 0 Power Points
(C) Land on your opponent's space.

name: Getta Goff Challenge
description:
The Getta Goff Challenge games are a series of milk cap games (also known as Pog) with special rules and instructions meant to add a more educational twist to standard Pog.

Traditional Pog is played by stacking a variety of milk caps (aka Pogs) on top of a playing mat. Players then take turns throwing a "Slammer" (which is usually a much thicker plastic or metal Pog) onto the top of the stack in an attempt flip as many of the stacked Pogs upside down as possible. Generally, players then take ownership of any Pogs that flipped.

In Advanced Math Getta Goff, for example, the players must carry out mathematical operations based on the instructions on the flipped Pogs.

name: Orient-Bazar
description:
Orient-Bazar

The treasure chests are empty, therefore the players need to first accumulate money before they can buy at the Bazaar.
Only the players who ride the Elephant are allowed to buy goods. The player who first owns all six goods in his color wins the game.

Each player receives a pawn and 15 Dinars. Each player rolls 2 dice, one for his pawn and one for the elephant. The player moves over "money spaces" to earn money, once he has enough money he tries to ride the elephant. While riding the elephant the players can buy goods (in their colors and in all other colors). If a player needs to buy a good from one of the other players it costs 150% of it's original price.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Untold Battle
description:
(from the Web Site)Untold Battle™ is a fast-paced, exciting way for players to duke it out with custom built creatures and parties. Showcasing the many Battle Factions of the Untold universe, Untold Battle was created for two players to choose two opposing factions and fight with tooth, bullet, tentacle and spell until only one side remains. But Battle players are not limited - they can use all of the Untold cards to change and make their units unique, or even create their own character, just as if they were going to play the roleplaying game. And Battle doesn't need to be two sided, the rules work for one-on-one, one-on-many, or many-on-many. Untold Battle Rules provide a brutal, bloody, and hard-hitting game that packs a punch!
The Battle Factions

Untold offers limitless possibilities for worlds and adventures. And on every world there are nations, corporations, shadow organizations, alien marauders, and so forth; we collectively call these Factions. We've built all the unique creatures, minions, soldiers, and things that go bump in the night and put them together in Battle Faction packs, so you can pick your favorites or mix and match to do Battle. Untold Battle offers an arena for all the forces of your imagination to duke it out. Now you can pit zombies against soldiers, or tentacled demons against steam punk robots. Or you can help shape the destiny of one of the Untold worlds: will the brave forces of the North American Union overcome the twisted Flux Horrors? Or you can help reshape the face of Europe as the Churl Confederation advances on the new knights of Novus Europa!
The Untold Rules

Untold Battle utilizes Untold Minion Cards because they are quick to use. Minions are one card, instead of a number of cards, that represent a single character, and that is important when your Battle has a large number of forces. And Minions still offer the limitless customization of Untold Powers through Swapping.

Once players choose their Factions and/or characters, Battle is as simple as lining up the cards on the table across from each other and taking turns between their minions. Battle utilizes Untold's simple and quick combat mechanics (see our Online Primer for more, or just refer to back of the handy insert that comes with every Battle Faction pack), and all the rules you need for the minions are on the cards!

name: Lines & Sunkers
description:
Fun-to-play board game of Atlantic Canada. (from the box front)

Description from the back of the box:

"Lines & Sunkers (tm) offers Down-East humour at its best. The game is all about Atlantic Canada - its people, history, and culture.

"There are many ways to play - you can even develop your own!

"Start at Stagehead and follow the wave-like motion of the Gameboard. Roll with the uncertainty of the die to a Lighthouse or Sunker. Experience the Luck o' the Irish. Meet your friends for an English Cup o' Tea. Attend the Acadian "Joie de Vivre" Festival, or the world-famous Gathering of the Clans.

"Will you be hooked by our questions, or will you simply be in a FOG? Answer incorrectly, and see what the Stun'd Box has in store for you. A Lucky Shot will take you to the challenges of the Holdin' Ground. Then Jig-a-Double to reach home Safe & Sound.

"You don't have to be a trivia buff to win - you just have to be good at collecting and holding on to your O-fishial Stamps.

"Lines & Sunkers (tm) - a true reflection of Atlantic Canada!"
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs Game
description: This is a card game with four suits - Triangles, Circles, Squares and Stars. The miniature cards feature illustrations from Snow White - Snow White, each of the dwarfs, the Huntsman, the Wicked Queen, the Witch, the Prince. Points are scored by laying down runs of cards. Points are lost if you then have to pick up tricks.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bayern-Quiz
description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the German state of Bavaria. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

--user summary by HilkMAN

name: Bamse: Pantomimspel
description:
Children's card game where you draw a card and then try to make a pantomime showing what the cartoon character on the card does. When a person succeeds with a card he keeps the card, and the person with the most cards when the deck is empty is the winner.

Distributed as a freebie with Bamse magazine sometime around 2005-2009.

name: What Was That Name?
description:
(as taken from front cover of rules)

Any number of people can play "What Was That Name?" It can be used as a part game in teams, just for a small group, or only two people.

The object of the game is for each player or team to list as many famous names as possible from the initials provided by the cards.

name: Monopoly: Miami Dolphins Collector's Edition
description:
From the publisher: Fin Fever! What true Dolphin fan hasn't dreamed of owning and running the illustrious Miami Dolphins? Now's your chance as you vie to buy, sell, and trade Dolphin legends from Bob Griese and Paul Warfield to Dan Marino and Zach Thomas. Helmet and Football Cards replace Chance and Community Chest Cards, and might read Win Back to Back Super Bowls, Collect $20 or Dolphins Complete Undefeated Season, Advance to Go! The 6 Collectible Pewter Tokens are: a Quarterback, Linebacker, Cheerleader, Football, Referee's Whistle, and Dolphins Helmet. So strap on your shoulder pads and see if you can match Miami's 1972 perfect season! Game comes with Game Board, Title Deed Cards, Dolphins Money and Banker's Tray, Dolphins Helmet and Football Cards, 32 Luxury Boxes (Houses), 12 Stadiums (Hotels), 2 Dice, 6 Tokens and Game Instructions. For 2 - 6 Players, Ages 8 and Up.

--

The Miami Dolphins Monopoly game is the first customized Monopoly game featuring the best of the Miami Dolphins that allows fans to buy, sell, and trade the most valuable players and championship titles in the quest to own them all.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Eten Drinken
description:
Trivia game about food.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Oranje Boven
description:
Trivia game about the Netherlands.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a tile in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored tiles wins the game.

Contents
- 112 question cards
- 20 tiles
- 1 Dutch flag tile
- 1 die
- rules

name: 1,000 WEED Games
description:
Taken from the Game rules:

1000 Weed Games is a set of pot-themed games where you can either change your game every round of play or select favorites and play the over and over again until everyone is green in the face!

Game Pieces include:
10 Game Concept Cards
10 Plot Twist Cards
10 next Round Cards
1 Categories Card
1 Tongue Twisters card
2 Hippie Cards
1 Pot Top
1 Spinner
11 Numerical Ranking Cards
2 Regular Dice
1 "Penalty" Assignment Die
Instructions

Each round players follow the instructions on one Game Concept Card and a Next Round Card. Hilarity ensues.

name: R√§kna med Posten
description:
This is a dice game of math. The box contains 20 dice (half with numbers of varying distribution, half with arithmetic operations), note pad and rules.

The rules specify four different games of varying complexity. In all games, the objective is to roll as high or low numbers as possible, but using different subsets of the dice. Since you also have operators at your disposal, sometimes it is also important in what order to use the numbers and operators.

name: Take It to the Max
description:
"From crooks (sharks) to friends (dingos)...As you pick up Character cards, you will eyeball some truly bewildering and at times downright embarrassing dilemmas cut from the deck of life and complemented by true blue Aussie trivia. The exercise may make you blush, call for help or glaze over like a stunned mullet - but it's all about having a point of view, not letting life go through to the keeper."
To win this board game you must be the first player to collect a diploma from each of the four courses an have accumulated 10 character points.

name: Welt des Allg√§us
description: A Trivia game about the Allgäu - a tourist region in the southwest of Bavaria in Germany. Its a multiple-choice-game where more than one answer can be correct. The players can pick as many answers as they want and if they get all correct get 1 point per answer. One wrong answer however and you end up with zero points.

name: Bil I Fil
description:
Moving your cars across the intersection and scoring points

Each player has 6 cars which move one step at the time.

You get higher points if you turn right.

It's a very large thin box and it pictures
cars on the wrong side (left side) on the street.

So it has to be published before Sweden got right side
traffic (and that was in 1967)

name: Meuterer!
description:
Meuterer! is a game about a rivalry between pirates on a ship. The players try to jostle other players shipmates into the water by playing different actions for the different fights. The Game Board consists of a framed picture (in another edition it's a video casette safer).

Players are either loyal or engaged in a mutiny. Depending on which side they are on they try to conquer different parts of the ship. By placing seamen in the first three round the players build some kind of basic position for the next game phase werde initiative cards are used to determine who is allowed to conduct the next (randomly determined) action.

With the randomly drawn action cards the players either can put in more seamen, gain gold or canonballs, move seamen, reshuffle the deck, engage in predetermined combat, garrison a seaman, replace seamen (because of the "ship's kobold") or engagen in a combat in a chosen location.

Aim of the combat is to jostle as much seamen from other players to gain sovereignty over the different parts of the ship on the gameboard.

After drawing the "reshuffle card" for three times the game ends and the score is settled. Control over the different parts of the ship is awarded different points.

name: The Weather Game
description:
"The fair weather game for all the family." Devised by Wincey Willis.

Players try to complete their colour section of the board first.

Each of the six numbered spaces must be filled with pairs (coloured symbols and black and white symbols), corresponding to the symbols on the player's forecast card.

Beware the Windy cards!

Box contents:
1 game board,
6 forecast cards,
1 swirler,
64 weather cards.

Source: box
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tilbake til 80 & 90 tallet
description:
A Quiz game that focus on the 80's and 90's. it is based on a norwegian TV-show with the same name.

The goal is to reach the end of the track first, by spinning the roulette. You advance quicker if you answer the questions correctly.

name: Mystic Realm
description:
Publisher blurb
Mystic Realm

Once upon a time there was a great realm, ruled by a wise and powerful sorcerer-king. The land was rich and the people prosperous. Out of their wealth a great temple was constructed, puissant magical items created and many fantastic beasts imported from faraway lands. But as is the way of all things, eventually the king grew old and passed on from this mortal plane.
His son inherited his realm and magical talent but not his wisdom. Greedy and grasping, searching for greater treasures and power than even his father had amassed, he reached past the limits set by the gods and opened a rift into a dimension of primal chaos. The once prosperous realm was sucked in and lost for millennia.
But now a new magic portal has opened leading to that mystic realm, or at least to what that realm has become. Overrun by monsters, the few remaining inhabitants are oppressed. The once-great temple is overgrown, the capital city lost in a jungle teeming with cannibals and wild beasts. But golden treasures and powerful magic items still remain, waiting for brave adventurers to discover.
And the greedy prince? He too, remains. Preserved by his wicked magic, he is now an undead master, the Liche Lord. Still ruling the ruined kingdom from his father’s throne, his only remaining desire to suck the life force from the bones of anyone foolish enough to enter his kingdom. Are you brave enough to dare his challenge? And are you clever enough to return with the fame, fortune and treasures of a lifetime?
Mystic Realm is a one to ten player game of adventure set in a fantasyland. Players take the role of a heroic character and travel through the realm searching for treasures and encountering dangerous monsters (and sometimes something even more dangerous: the other players.) The player who survives and returns to the portal with the most treasure and fame is declared the winner. There are twenty different character types to choose from, everything from an Amazon to a Ninja to a Witch.
Easy to play, the game includes: complete rules, five player aid cards, six encounter cards, six sheets of terrain tiles, and one sheet of DIE-CUT playing pieces (including treasures and magic items.) Paper, pencil and some six-sided dice (not included) are required to play.

name: Kvitt eller dubbelt
description:
Trivia game based on the 00s incarnation of a Swedish TV trivia contest. The title translates to "double or nothing", which describes the fundamental "push your luck" element: the goal is to answer six questions in succession (with a timer being used for the last four), or to stop and collect money.

Hasse and Karin Thorsvad are credited with supplying the questions, although the actual game designer is not credited.

There is a game of the same name based on a previous incarnation of the TV show.

name: Aladdin: The Series
description: A simple spin and move game, moving between the treasure locations to reveal and collect treasure tokens. If a revealed token is a thief instead, start your next turn from the thieve's hideout. Some movement spaces may force you to lose a treasure to Iago's hiding place, but you may also land on a magic carpet which allows you to go anywhere on the board, including Iago's hiding place where you can take all that stolen treasure. When all the treasure tokens are claimed, the player with the most wins.
categories: Arabian, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Game Of Footer
description:
The Chad Valley catalogue from 1910 stated that this is "The best indoor football game invented - highly popular with followers of the game." -----from the book "PLAYING THE GAME" by Brian Love, 1978.

The object of the game is to be the one to score a predetermined number of goals first. Players alternate throwing a die and moving forward that number of spaces, each moving from the center, on the ball, in the opposite direction toward the goal they wish to score. Certain spaces on the track award fouls, throw-ins, penalties, and offsides that result in the player's marker being moved forward or backward on the track.

If a player is close enough to their chosen goal (space 25), they score a goal by rolling a number high enough to go past 25. Landing on 25 itself allows the goalie to make the save and punt the ball back to space 5.

Either side scoring a goal sends both player's markers back to the ball in the center to start again. It is recommended to play a "best of 5" match.

name: 3 Code Football
description: The board features a Football (Soccer) pitch on 1 side and a Rugby League / Rugby Union pitch on the other, each being a 28 x 19 grid covered with symbols (letter pairs and crosses) which allow special movement and passing options. Rules are provided for each of the 3 codes. You place your team of men onto the board (ie 11, 13 or 15 counters) into standard starting positions and kick off. Generally a turn is to move one of your men 1 space (with the option of passing the ball), but trying to take advantage of the board's special options to progress down the field and score a goal / try, while your opponent moves their men into defensive positions to tackle (hop over) and regain the ball.

name: The Naked Brothers Band VIP Concert Tour Game
description:
From the back of the box and the instruction manual:

Score tickets & catch your fave band on tour!

Are you ready to rock with The Naked Brothers Band? Hit the roads and tour around North America trying to score tickets to the Naked Brothers Band's sold-out shows. Follow the band from city to city and visit awesome places like Seattle - Boston - San Fran and Miami. If you're the first fan to make it to the show, you'll get the best tickets and increase your score. So, hit the road and catch as many concerts as you can.

- Gameboard
- 4 Tour Bus cardboard pawns and pawn stands
- 21 City cards
- 24 Concert tickets
- 24 Rest stop cards
- 45 Travel cards
- Instructions

How to Play:
On your turn, you're trying to get to the next concert city to get the best seats possible. Concerts must be played in the order they are on the board, and all tickets from the first concert must be taken before the next concert can make its tickets available, and so on.

To move your bus toward a concert city, draw a travel card and place it face up so all can see. If it is a move card, there will be a white bus on the card. You can move your bus the number of spaces the white bus indicates. If there are other buses on the card, that color bus also gets to move. If your colored bus also happens to be on the card, then you may move again. Buses are moved in the order they are played on the card. In a two or three player game, ignore any buses not being played. If you happen to end your turn on the same space as another player, then jump ahead to the next space. In some cases, the player who drew the card will also get to move another player's bus. These are wrong turn cards. Any special instructions will be on the cards.

Sometimes a card will have special instructions, such as move to any city, or swap tickets with another player. In these cases instead of moving this turn, just do what the card says.

Once you begin to move in a direction, you cannot backtrack on the same road. The only exception is in the case where a card you draw has your color bus on it as well. These are considered two different moves. They must be done in the correct order on the card.

Ending the Game:
After all 8 concerts have happened, everyone adds up their points (from Rest Stop and Concert Ticket cards). The player with the most points wins the game. That player is the Naked Brothers Band's Biggest Fan!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Motus: Words In Motion
description:
User summary:

Played individually or in teams, this game involves travelling around a board, collecting letters which you'll use at the end of the game to make as many words as possible. Getting around the board *quickly* isn't necessarily a good idea because then you'll have less letters!

Despite dice rolling, multiple tracks on the board allow players to make choices about their paths. Landing in some places get you more letters or let you steal letters from opponents.

Blurb from publisher website:

MOTUS is an exciting game of strategy, where players use creative thinking to collect letters while travelling around the board, using the luck of the die. The game is designed to be played by young and old, capable spellers and not so capable spellers. Its clever design makes for an even playing field, so everyone can enjoy this exciting game.

Widely tried, tested and proven throughout Australian schools, teachers and students all agree that this thrilling board game is not only a world of fun but a fantastic way to improve student spelling capability.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der Knobelteller
description: Every player put a card with a number hidden on the table. Now you have to make a guess, how many points all cards are together. Put your chips on the "Knobelteller" and discover the cards.

name: This Is Your City Albury-Wodonga Game
description:
This was one of several games in a series that focused on Regional Cities within NSW and Victoria, Australia.

The primary function was to promote regions and businesses within the cities featured in each game.

But there was a game here too.

"The gameboard is a full colour representation of your city and the players compete with each other to race to targeted destinations on the gameboard. The first player to arrive at the targeted destination will buy that property and receive a destination card. The first player to purchase 10 destination cards and return home safely, wins the game.

Source: Back of Game Box

name: Reisen til den forheksede √∏ya Gral
description:
It is a race where the first pirate ship that reaches the island Gral is the winner. On the trip you meet different hazards such as pirate attacks, hurricanes and bad food.

This game is put in the world of Kaptein Sabeltann and came with the children’s magazine "kaptain Sabeltann nr 5 2010"

The game is a typical roll and move game, where you must follow the instructions on the square you land on. This could be miss a turn or taking a short cut in the same manner as snakes and ladders.

name: The Adventures of Captain Can
description:
"An exciting game for 3-6 players aged 7 to adult. Pit your wits against the evil Vandalan and his faceless helper Wannabe, as they try to wreak havok on planets Earth, Candoof, Canneri, Hedonia, Mystican and beyond. Only you, as Captains Can and Tinn, armed with belts of ingenious can gadgets developed by Professor Quantum on Planet Gadgetron, can save the day. Will you be the first to overcome Vandalan on his barren home planet, Destructon, and transport him back to earth to face The Wise Ones, or will you encounter the moving hazard Viroid on the way and lose your valuable protective Glittering Whirlwind? There are 12 missions and so many variables that this is a game that will hold you enthralled no matter how many times you play it" Source :- Captain Can News Transmission 1993 flyer.
Each player is dealt a "Mission Card" and, using a "Canmobile" playing piece, races around a board with an hexagonal grid showing various planets with movement controlled by means of a spinner which also causes collection of "Fortune Cards". At the end of the turn the Canmobile must face the direction intended for the next move. All movement [1 to 4 spaces] must be taken in full except when arriving on special marked spaces when cards may be picked up which may help or hinder the player's mission. The Mission consists of collecting 4 gadgets and delivering to a specified planet before anyone else.
Also included with the game is a 12 page booklet, "THE STORY OF CANS - from 1810 to the present day". This game was produced as a promotional item for the Canned Food Information Centre , Birmingham, UK and CarnaudMetalbox plc, Worcester, UK
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Honigb√§r und Stachelbiene
description: In the game, up to six bears try to create a store of honey. On the field, around a meadow, are six bear caves. In the middle of the meadow there are the bees. Every player has a choice to move the bears or the bees.The bears move exactly four steps, and if they cross one, they can lift honey pots, which they try as quickly as possible to transport to their caves. When moving the bee you roll a special die (2x honey symbol 3,4,5,6). The honey bee is then moved to a space and on their old space is a honey pot is laid. The bees can also chase the bears, if caught the affected bears lose the honey and start again in the cave. Honey which is already in the cave is safe. The winner is the bear who has a full stock (adjusted according to players) collected first.

name: Alef-Bet Bingo
description:
From the publisher:

All New Alef Bet Bingo! Two games in one! Alef to Lamed and Alef to Tav Now you can play Alef Bet Bingo while learning hebrew! - Even if you dont know it all yet! Good for both teachers and their classrooms, and for parents! Ages 3 & up - 2 to 14 players Each bingo card has 2 sides. You can play with: Either 16 letters per card (Alef to Tav) or 9 letters per card for younger children (Alef to Lamed) There are also 4 different colors of each letter so that if you are learning and someone calls a red aleph while you have a green one, you dont just forget the letter because you dont have it, you remember the letter because you need the same one - just in a different color.

name: Heroes & Villains from the Book of Mormon
description:
Summarized from the rule sheet

Heroes and Villains from the Book of Mormon can be played by two or more people. Each player is given four cards from the shuffled deck, and the rest of the cards are placed face down to be the "fish pond".

The first player asks any other player for a card related to one of the cards s/he is holding. For instance, if player number one holds the "Nephi" card with "Obtain Brass Plates" at the top of the card, s/he will ask for any of the cards named on the bottom of the card, all of which are "Nephi" cards. If the player asked has that card, s/he must give it up and the first player gets to ask again, and plays until forced to "fish" (drawing a card from the draw pile when the first player requests a card from a player that isn't in the hand of that player).

All four cards equal a book, and the player with the most books at the end of the game wins.

Includes:
Rules
44 Cards

name: Full Speed Ahead!
description:
Set during the Golden Age of Sail, players each take command of a nation state colonizing a group of unexplored islands. The goal of the game is to build the most productive empire through conquest, trading, and economic development.

A fully reconfigurable board ensures that every game plays completely differently, and scales up to make room for additional players. A three-tier tech tree creates an enormous amount of strategic depth. An innovative turn system allows players to trade off resources for extra moves. Fast-paced play keeps everybody playing and guessing until the winning empire is crowned!

name: Toxifax
description:
A complex simulation about raising industrialization and associated incremental pollution. The game is unbalanced: Goal of the "Toxifax"-player is, to pollute the other countries until the are bankrupt. The "country"-players try to clean their towns and finally confirm a test.

The game was produced by the former printing shop "Achilles" in Aachen on a very high quality level.
The pawns are ink bottle caps in different colors.
6 pages of rules were a high barrier at that time (not only for doctorates like Dr. Waldemar Lentz)

name: Cootie Card Game
description:
A Cootie-themed deck of cards for children. There are 6 colors (suits) of 7 body parts: body, head, eyes, mouth, antennae, left legs, right legs; plus 2 "I'm the Cootie" cards. Rules are included for:
- Build A Bug: draw until one player gets all his color parts.
- You've Got Cooties: an Old-Maid game.
- Squash the Cootie Bug: like SlapJack, but trying to collect all cards.
- Catch A Cootie: like Spoons, pass cards until you get a complete Cootie of one color.

name: Lost Souls
description:
From the publisher's website:
"According to ancient Mayan legend, a representative is chosen from the human race to play the Game of Lost Souls against the gods to guarantee that mankind passes into the new world.

The game is a battle of wits, strategy and luck. Understand your opponent’s choices and make wise ones of your own. The fate of humanity rests in your hands."

In this two-player game, points are scored by moving their 6 pieces to the center of the board. Each of 6 pieces have a different ability. Combat is a simple roll-off system, with powers modifying.

The game is not sold separately but comes with the young adult novel, Lost Souls: Burning Souls.

name: RuhrWeiber
description:
Translation of box back:

Did you know...
which woman from the Ruhr area was the first to drive a car around the world? Why the DFB used to forbid woman soccer teams? What Tana Schanzaras real name was? Or what a "Mutterklötzchen" is?

The female side of the Ruhr area: The game invites you to rediscover the history of the Ruhr area. All aspects of women's history with women in society, art, culture, economy, politics are made accessible in a playful manner. The game offers exciting questions regarding historical and contemporary women from all social domains, introduces women's groups, highlights "female" events and opens up places connected with women.

Includes four different rules to play.

name: Spellbinder
description:
Spellbinder - The Domino Word Game

An Absorbing Pastime for Children age 5-12

Complete words by adding to your opponents' dominoes. Be the cleverest 'Spellbinder' and the first to use all your pieces. A game for 2-4 players.

Source: box

name: Alligator Dice Game
description:
This is a game in Koplow's series of dice games that come in a tube and which usually feature dice where one side is replaced with a graphic of animal. In this case, you get five dice where the the one-pip is replaced with a graphic of an alligator.

The game is a simple dice rolling game - players roll the dice and need at least one alligator before they can score, They can set aside one alligator and other dice showing pipped sides which give the score - the other dice can be re-rolled once to attempt to improve the score. The player then decides whether to increase the size of their 'gator' by rolling all five dice and adding the sum of pipped dice to their score; however on this subsequent roll, any alligators rolled count as minus five points.

The player with the highest number of points after all the rolling wins.

name: Dooko≈Ça ≈öwiata z Janem Paw≈Çem II
description:
This game was officially released in October 2010 to mark the 32nd anniversary of John Paul's election as pope, although several hundred copies had already been sold.

A dice roll allows a player to travel to many of the 130 countries where the pope traveled where players collect cards with the Pope's messages.

name: Cascade
description: A tower is filled with 5 columns of coloured balls. Each player can on their turn take as many balls of the same colour from the bottom of the columns as they want. The winner is the player who has taken the most balls at the end of the game.

name: Sobid v√µi mitte?
description:
From the publisher:
Easiest party game for couples. This game is a good way to learn about your friends and family, to find people who think like you.
The couple that wins the game is the one who "clicks" more and gets to the finish first. Only thing you need to do in this game is to pick words from word pairs and then check, if your partner thinks the same. Is it blond or dark - your choice?

name: Foresight
description:
(from publisher's website)

Foresight is a unique deck of cards, unlike any other deck you’ve ever used. The cards are familiar, as long as you’re looking at the fronts, lovingly illustrated by Aaron Williams. But on the back, one or more suits appear, giving you a glimpse into the future. The better the card, the less information you have about what suit it is. That ability to look into the future gives the game its shape, and presents some unique challenges for the veteran card player.

Foresight is also an engaging trick-taking card game, using that special set of cards. The bidding system is at once familiar, a simple system of bidding how many tricks you are going to take, and different, in that you get to bid multiple times. As befits a game with as much uncertainty as Foresight features, you get to place several bets, rather than be locked down into one bid. And once play begins, part of your hand is obscured even from you. Managing your information and your crucial hole cards is a skill that is unique to playing Foresight, and it’s a fresh challenge that card players everywhere can appreciate.

name: Domino-Quartett
description:
48 square tiles (16 different cards 3 each) are shuffled and every player get 3 in the hand. Starting player put one card on the table and draw one card to have 3 hand-cards.

On your turn you lay a matching tile. Each tile has a triangle in one of the four colors and a triangle with a number 0,1,2 or 3 of dots.

When you finish on 4-tile square you count the dots on the 4 tiles.

After your turn you draw up to 3 cards

End: all cards are played. Player with the most points wins.

Special rule: You can put one tile in front of you if this impossible to lay it. (even if you have a matching tile in your hand) You can use this tile(s) in the following turn(s)

name: Journey to Extinction Island
description:
User summary:

This game is part of the Gone Extinct Groovy Tube Book published by innovativeKids. It consists of a hardcover book, a tube of plastic animals, and a game board in the attached box. The book describes various extinct animals, including the plastic animals it comes with, and the game rules are on the last couple pages of the book.

Journey to Extinction Island is a roll-and-move game that has 2-4 players traveling several small paths to collect specimens from each zone (Water, Flyers, Forest and Swamp), while avoiding poachers. The first player to collect one of each type and make it through the final zone (the poacher camp) wins the game.

name: Planeta Bar√ßa
description:
A Trivial-like game on all facts and history about the soccer team Futbol Club Barcelona, 'Barça'. As in Trivial Pursuit, players advance along the board tracks by correctly answering questions. The first player gathering six trophies will be the winner.

Questions come in six different categories:
- History
- Players, coaches and presidents
- Trivia
- Matches and biography
- Images
- Non-soccer teams

Game components:
- 1 gameboard
- 6 tokens
- 1 die
- 298 question cards, with more than 2,500 questions
- 2 cards
- 36 trophies
- Rulebook

name: Guinness World Records: DVD-Enn√§tyspeli
description: Guinness World Records DVD-Ennätyspeli is a trivia game about world records. Players or teams are answering questions and for every right answer a chip is awarded, the first player or team to get 10 chips is the winner. Most of the questions are on the cards, but some of them come from the DVD, most of those have a video about a record attempt and the question is about the video. There are also challenges where two players go head to head in a simple task like listing names or drawing a house - the winner of the challenge recieves two chips.

name: Hockey Ice Dice Game
description:
From the publisher:

A fun and easy hockey dice game in a mini hockey bag storage case ready for an 'off the ice' game anywhere and any time!

Includes four dice for offensive and defensive plays, rules and a scoresheet. Players roll the offensive dice to determine if a shot or penalty happens. The defensive player then rolls a defensive die to determine if the goalie makes a save or there is a score. Player with the most goals after 3 periods of play wins!

Game includes a small hockey bag for the storage of the game components.

name: Survival
description:
The Dutch game association Ducosim publishes the game magazine Spel!. With this magazine they will publish several 'Spel!enkaarten' (gamecards). These are games which fit on a A5 card. #0004 is 'Survival' and was included with Spel! 14.2 December 2010

In this game one player controls 6 wolves, and the other player controls 1 reindeer. The wolves try to surround the reindeer in such a way that it cannot move in any direction. The reindeer tries to escape the wolves and run towards the safety of the forest.

The reindeer moves in random directions, but the player can decide how far the reindeer moves in the given direction. The wolves are restricted to one square either horizontal or diagonal.

name: Bridges Over Worried Waters
description:
Anxiety disorders are the most common mental health problem during childhood and adolescence. The recommended treatment approach for anxiety is overwhelmingly Cognitive Behavior Therapy (CBT). Bridge Over Worried Waters is essentially a CBT program in a box that incorporates all of these techniques.

To start the game, players place a Worried Waters raging river sheet in front of them. Then they choose a Problem card that describes an anxiety-producing situation. Players then decide on an appropriate Solution card to use as a positive strategy to address the anxiety in the situation. Solution cards include: Self-Talk Cards challenge self-defeating thoughts by replacing negative thoughts with positive,optimistic thoughts. Relaxation Cards calm down by using deep breathing, progressive muscle relaxation, guided imagery, and meditation. Coping Cards distract by diverting attention away from anxious feelings to fun or effortful activities. When the problem has been successfully solved with one of the Solution cards, the player then tosses the Situation card into the Worried Waters, and the Solution card is used to create the foundation or top of a bridge. The object of the game is to build a bridge that carries the player across the Worried Waters to the safety of the other bank.

There are both competitive and cooperative versions

name: –ê—Ç–∞–∫–∞ (Attack)
description:
Tanks, infantry and aviation are waiting for your orders. Attack, defend and destroy hostile forces and take their headquarter to score even more points!

Before starting your game you have to prepare your forces (miniatures consist of several parts)

---

After placing armies along opposite sides of hexagonal gameboard, players start to alternate their turns. Each turn they have 8 Action Points, where each 1 allows to give orders for 1 unit. HQ cannot move. Every air unit must move each turn if not landed.

Tables used to describe terrain movement costs, units range and movement, and their firepower (type vs type). d6 used to determine damage. Some units hit several hexes at once.

One has to get 16 Victory Points to win. Destroy a unit to earn 1 VP. Destroy HQ to earn 3 VPs. Capture HQ to get 6 VPs at once.

name: America: The great board game
description: Roll-and-Move business game with 3 levels of playing circuits. You try to get enough companies and money to advance to the next level. Goal is to be in the thrid level and advance to your winning star in the center of the board.

name: Dora L'Exploratrice: Les Formes Avec Dora
description:
From the box:
Fun game for teaching the smallest kids about shapes and colors. The game is themed with Dora Explorer and it also can be played alone.
Solo play is just teaching a kid about the shapes and colors, while game with two or more kids has some rules to it as well.
Each player gets a small board, puzzle holes on one side. The board has 2 pictures, like pumpkin, pine tree and so on. The kids, one by one, now try to guess the shape and size of the picture.
First kid to complete the puzzle is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Lokalspelet, Kampen om stan: Gotland
description:
This is a Monopoly clone. The publisher Lokalspelet i Skandinavien AB did a lot of these games as promotions for different cities in the 1980s.

In the middle of the board is a photo of the Gotland and around that is a lot of the stores in the city. You can buy stock in them, and you can get cards that ask you questions about the city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Lokalspelet, Kampen om stan: √ñsterlen
description:
This is a Monopoly clone. The publisher Lokalspelet i Skandinavien AB did a lot of these games as promotions for different cities in the 1980s.

In the middle of the board is a photo of the Österlen and around that is a lot of the stores in the city. You can buy stock in them, and you can get cards that ask you questions about the city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Rescuers
description:
Snakes & Ladders game with cards. Card has the pictures from the animation released year earlier.
Each player rolls the dice then moves and tries to collect 3 cards from the different color, with at least 1 for each character.
First one to finish the race is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Pop-Up Dinosaur 1,2,3
description:
User Summary

Pop-Up Dinosaur 1,2,3 consists of two games in one box.

The first is a snakes and ladders-style game where players roll a custom d12 that has both movements and hazards to overcome on it. The first to reach the end of the track is the winner.

The second is a quiz game where players move around the board using a d6, answering Dinosaur trivia questions (which also have visual clues for smaller children) whenever they land on a footprint. Again, the winner is the first to reach the last space on the board.

The 'Pop-up' in the game's title refers to some cut-out dinosaurs which 'pop up' when the board is unfolded.

name: Rockstar Rehab
description:
In Rock Star Rehab, the board game, you can pretend to participate in all the same activities your favourite rock stars do on television or in the tabloid magazines.

With simple dice rolls, you can imagine yourself partying at exclusive night clubs, VIP house parties, and even going to jail. The goal of the game is to persevere your way through Rock Star rehab.

name: High Roller
description: Enter the world of high finance and higher risk with the High Roller dice game. Players roll the dice in an effort to increase their fortunes and build their "budding" business. But in this game, danger awaits you at every turn and getting busted is just a roll of the dice away. Each player rolls two numbered dice (1-6) and one event dice with the event die determining what the numbers stand for, where even numbers equal good results and odd numbers equal bad results. The game contains two numbered dice, one event die, 100 chips and a rules card. Each player starts with 10 chips (their stash) with the remaining chips forming the pot, and the one with the biggest stash when the pot runs out wins.

name: Monopoly: Chicago Blackhawks Collector's Edition
description:
From USAopoly.com:

Drop the puck. It’s game time!

What Blackhawks fan hasn’t dreamed of owning and running their favorite NHL® team – the Chicago Blackhawks®? The NHL and the Monopoly game have teamed up to put an exciting new spin on America’s favorite board game. Buy, sell and trade the most popular players and team assets in a quest to own them all. Wheel and deal Jonathan Toews, Patrick Kane, Duncan Keith, the United Center, and even the 2010 Stanley Cup® victory in an effort to own and control the 4-time Stanley Cup champions, the Chicago Blackhawks!

Put your game face on and get ready to hit the ice!

Game comes complete with six custom tokens; Hockey Puck, Zamboni® Machine, Skates, Forward, Goalie and Stanley Cup® Trophy.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Charleston-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Charleston we could into this box. From Sweetgrass Baskets to the Charleston Harbor and all the charm in between, here’s a fun way to experience Charleston, South Carolina!

HERE’S A QUICK IDEA OF HOW TO PLAY...

Buy your favorite Charleston Properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!

So choose your token and advance to Go Charleston! You may soon be the mayor of Charleston... Or you may end up in the City Jail!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Homage & Fealty
description:
Homage & Fealty is a card game for 2-6 players where you bid resources (your treasury) to woo population into your kingdom in order to enrich it. The more people you have, the more attractive it'll become and the more resources you'll have in order to woo more population.

You'll need the custom deck, 10 cubes in 6 different colors, poker chips that can handle at least 3 different denominations, and about 30-45 minutes of time.

Each card represents a person such as a farmer, potter, candlestick maker, etc. that have a certain cost to get them to move to your kingdom and declare their fealty to your crown. Each provides victory points which allows you to win the game. The player with the highest VP total wins.

Originally entered in Quick Print and Play Design Challenge - General Discussion Thread

name: Miss UK
description:
Miss UK is a spin-and-move game for 2-4 players. Players first compete to win the six regional finals - Miss England (North), Miss England (Midlands), Miss England (South), Miss Northern Ireland, Miss Scotland and Miss Wales. This is done by collecting different coloured cards as players take turns to spin and move. When one player has collected a card of each colour, the round is over. All players add up the points printed on their cards and the winner places a token in the centre ring.

After the six regional rounds comes the grand final. In turn, each token from the centre ring makes an entire tour of the board collecting cards on the way. When all six finalists have moved, the points are added up again and the winner is crowned Miss UK.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Show Jumping
description: A roll-and-move game from the 1960s. Players attempt to negotiate their horse-shaped playing pieces around the course collecting penalties and awards as they go. All faults are noted on the scoresheet and the player with the least faults wins. There is an advanced version which is against the clock.

name: Clangers
description:
The box contains a number of parts that allow you to play one of two games; Tiny Clangers Party or Tunnels and Trees.

Tiny Clangers Party involves going around the board trying to visit 3 planets to collect 3 different presents and be the first to arrive at the Party in the middle of the board. Movement is by rolling dice, although you can collect and use pennies to add 1 to your move.

Flip the board over and you're ready to play Tunnels and Trees, which is just Snakes and Ladders in Space. Players roll dice to move along the board-track, with some spaces shuttling them ahead, and some sending them back to previous spaces. There's nothing original about Tunnels and Trees, but it does let you pretend that you're a Clanger inside their planet trying to get out.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Zodiac
description:
"The Game With Your Stars - Influenced by Your Sign of the Zodiac and Daily Horoscope."

Zodiac is a game where players move around a board acquiring status symbols such as property, shares and other possessions. The winner is the first to possess a house, a flat, £1,000 in shares, a car and a boat.

The game features cards representing the twelve signs of the Zodiac as well as decks of Horoscope, Pot Luck and Star cards, all of which affect a player's ability to acquire status symbols. Also included are banknotes for use as currency.

Zodiac was published in approximately 1960.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Crossroads: The Accident Prevention Game
description:
Crossroads is a children's game. The aim is to be the first to move your token from your start space to the home space. Dotted around the board are hazards which cause you to return to your start space. The hazards include crashes, visiting the police station or visiting the hospital. Movement is carried out by means of drawing cards and moving according to the instructions on the card which are a direction and distance. In this manner, players must plan a route which does not hit a hazard or a dead end. If a player is unable to move their token, they must return to their start space and discard their hand of cards.

From the box: "An exciting and hazardous racing game for 2 to 6 younger players"

name: For Love or Money
description:
For Love or Money is based on an Australian TV game show first broadcast in 1959 on ABC.

A prize card is drawn and placed on the board (examples of prizes are fridges, drills and lawn mowers). Along with the prize's value, each prize card also has a code on it. The code is input into the Money Machine in the centre of the board and corresponds to a cash prize amount in shillings. The code is input by turning two knobs on the board until the correct numbers are displayed. A random question from the question book is read out which all players can answer, The player to give the correct answer can choose to take either the prize card, or go for the cash prize displayed on the Money Machine. If they select to go for the cash, a dial on the Money Machine is spun to determine the outcome. Getting a question wrong means a player loses a life, and when all three are lost, they are out of the game. There is also a jackpot prize to be played for. The winner is the player with the most money and prizes at the end of the game.

From the box: "Another Chad Valley Television Game: For Love or Money - With the 'Magic Flying Shilling' Sign. ABC Television's Top Ten Quiz Game"

name: Think!
description:
Think! is a children's memory game from the 1970s. The game comprises a 'master' board with 72 different images upon it, a corresponding set of 72 picture cards and a set of pegs. Each image on the playing board has a peg hole next to it.

At the start of each round two images are eliminated by shuffling the picture cards and placing two of them face down over the matching images on the board. Players then place pegs into the board in whichever spaces they like to mark images. Everyone has 10 seconds to memorise which images have been marked before the board is covered up by the box lid. The picture cards are then turned over one at a time to players in turn. If a player thinks the image on the card was marked on the board, they take the card. At the end, players get a point for each correctly taken card and lose a point for each wrongly taken card. The winner is the one with most points.

From the box: "The Memory Game That Really Makes You Think!"

name: Tackle!
description:
Tackle! is a football (soccer) game possibly dating from the 1960s. The object of the game is to score the most goals. Players each have a team of 11 footballers represented by small plastic tokens. One team is red and the other is blue. The playing pieces fit into holes in the board which is a football pitch marked out into hex spaces. There is a token for the football which can slot into the board or into the top of the footballer playing pieces to denote possession.

On a player's turn, they may choose one of three actions: 1. Move a player with the ball up to five spaces in the direction they are facing then (optional) turn and pass the ball, 2. Move a player off the ball, 3. Attempt to tackle an opposing player. There are additional rules governing the movement of goalkeepers.

From the box: "Tactical football for 2 players - move, turn and kick away!"

name: Wie: Wann ‚Äì Wo
description: A domino variant with the card symbols hearts, diamonds, spades and clubs. All dominoes are dealt to the players, one is placed in the center of the table. On his turn, a player tries to place a domino so that the card symbol matches the symbol on the adjacent domino. If he manages to create a square, he gets another turn. The player who gets rid of his dominoes first, wins the game.

name: Sport Dice Boxing / Sport Dice Basketball
description:
Two dice games, coming with a double sided felt mat as game board, 8 dice and 7 pawns.

In boxing, the players roll their punching dice simultaneously; the player with the higher punch value after three rolls wins the round. After 15 rounds the game ends and the player with most rounds won wins the game. When you roll extremely lucky with your punching dice, a KO result is also possible, thus ending the game earlier.

In Basketball you try to maneuver your pawn into a possible scoring space on the playing mat by rolling the dice, and from there you may score by rolling higher than the number on the space. The dice also cover defense rolls, fouls and rebounds.

name: Das unm√∂gliche Psycho Quiz
description:
A party game where you have to estimate the reactions of the other team(s)/player(s).

From the rules:
