name: Welt der Tierkinder
description:
World of baby animals
Facts from the animal kingdom: How can an emperor penguin its young among thousands? As newly hatched turtles find their way to the sea? Hedgehogs have spines at birth?

There are 2 questions in each card with 3 answers for each questions. The winner is whoever can answer most questions correctly and thus can collect the most cards.
If the current player answers incorrectly the next player may risk with one of his collected card to answer it.

Contents:

32 large format cards with color photos

name: Wunder der Natur
description:
"Wonders of nature" in English
The cards are divided into eight habitats: forests, lakes, rivers, mountain rain forests, savannas, steppes, deserts.
The habitats have different frame colors for clarity. For each habitat, there is one card each of the following five groups, ie a total of 5 cards: mammals, birds, amphibians and reptiles, spiders and insects, and plants. The aim of the game is to win by correctly answering the questions, all five cards of a habitat. For each question there are three possible answers,

name: Abenteuer Pferd
description:
"Adventure horse" in English
When and why do horses neigh? What does a horse express when it strikes violently with its tail? Plenty of fun and eye-opening facts about horses.

There are 2 questions in each card with 3 answers for each questions. The winner is whoever can answer most questions correctly and thus can collect the most cards.
If the current player answers incorrectly, the next player may risk with one of his collected card to answer it.

Contents:

32 large format cards with color photos

name: R√§tsel, Rekorde, Sensationen
description:
"Puzzles, records, sensations" in English
Trivia game on nature, on each card there are four questions, each with three possible answers, the players put chips on one of three answers and place their bet on any of the three betting cards with the corresponding response of the habitat.
The one who relies on an incorrect answer loses his chips. The players who have bet on the correct answer will receive back the double bet.

name: High Bidding
description: Party game. Players are given a story and they must look around during the party, to spot the correct words that are needed for the blanks in that story. The player who adds the most correct answers, wins.

name: Quick-Quiz: Technik
description:
"Technics" in English
108 game cards with 500 questions and 500 answers.
The question is asked and the quickest player with correct answer gets a point. Who collect 25 points first wins the game.

Contents:

108 playing cards,
notepad and pencil

name: Stragone
description:
The goal of the game is to take or block the opponent's checkers.

Each player's pawns are placed on the front rows. In his turn player moves his piece (pawn or stack).
To move, a pawn jumps one hex or be stacked one ofof his pawn directly next hex.
A stack of two pawns jumps 2 squares.
A stack of three pawns jump 3 squares, etc..
A piece by jumping over an opponent's piece "takes" and removes it from the game

Contents:

Game board
11 pawns for each player

name: Element Trump
description: This card game consists of 140 cards, 112 element cards and 28 elementary particle cards. Several different games can be played with the same set of cards. The basic game is played like UNO. Players have to match element cards with same period or same group. The elementary particle cards are used as action cards or penalty cards. One of the advanced version is played like mahjong. More rules of advanced is being published in the official web site soon.

name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Bockspringen
description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

"Bockspringen" ("Leapfrog") is a simple dice-rolling racing game for 2 players. Each player gets a set of 2 sheep (black or white) and leap-frogs his way to the finishing line. Each player rolls a d6 in turn and leapfrogs his sheep a number of times equal to the die result. The first player crossing the finishing line wins the game.

The box contains 2 black and 2 white wooden sheep, 2 blue wooden bars (start and finishing line), and a die.

name: Bo & Jo et les Pirates
description:
9 plates (all except the treasures) are placed face down on the game board.
In his turn player turns one plate face-up. If it is island or treasure hunter he turns a second plate face-up. If the second is also island or treasure hunter so that they form a couple (island and treasure hunter) he wins a treasure to be place in front of him. Otherwise he turns the plates back to face-down.
If he finds a shark he removes it from the game.
If he finds a telescope he may watch one plate not showing it to others.
If he finds a pirate he may steal a treasure from his opponent to aim and shoot his treasury with cannonball.

The game is over if all treasures have been found.
The player of the greates number of treasures wins.
If tied the cannonball firing decides the winner.

Contents:

1 wooden game board with 3x3 grid
22 wooden plates representing: 7 treasures, 4 islands, 4 treasure hunters, 3 pirates, 2 sharks, 2 pirate telescopes
1 cannon and three cannonballs

name: The BORED Game
description:
BORED is a card game where players seek to make sets of cards:

Three or more of the same number and diffeerent colors;
Three or more of the same color and consecutive numbers;
Five letter cards that spell out B-O-R-E-D.

Shape cards and instructional cards alter the flow of play or the construction and value of sets.

The long-term goal is to earn the five letters BORED on the "scorebored". Each hand that a player ends by making a B-O-R-E-D set is worth one letter; points accumulated through making numeric sets and straights can be used to buy more letters toward the win.

name: Horses
description: A simple betting game where a deck of cards is used to race 4 horses down the track. Method of movement is simply by turning over a card. The suit determines which horse moves. The action comes from betting on which hose will Win, Place and Show.
publishers: All-Fair Toys and Games (Alderman-Fairchild Co.), Modern Makers, Inc.

name: Jeu des Couleurs
description:
A card game 2 to 4 players.

Deal out all the cards and each player looks at their cards. Whoever has the green Blanche Neige (Snow White) card starts by laying down that card. The next player has three possibilities; he can lay down another Blanche Neige card or he can play the green 7 stars Nain (Dwarf) card next to the green Snow White card. Or he can pass if he cannot do any of these options. Note that you have to play the same card if going down the columns or the card with the next lowest number of stars if going across the rows. And so the game progresses, each player having more and more options to lay cards along the rows or below in the columns.

The first player to use all their cards scores a point and the first to rack up 10 points, wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Shufflin' Feet: Put Your Best Foot Forward
description: Shufflin’ Feet is the funny game that takes unexpected twists on every turn! The players compete to win chips by playing higher valued cards than their opponents. On every round players place one card down in front of them and pick a player to roll the cube. The cube has three number sides and three action sides. If a number is rolled, players bet that number of chips, flip the card in front of him/her and the highest valued card wins the chips. Actions consist of trade, slide, and chip. Each action moves cards around the table to an opponent. If an action is rolled, complete the action and pass the cube to the next player. Play stops when a number is rolled. Quick wits and a little luck can leave any player in position to win on any turn. It depends on which direction the feet shuffle!

name: Mouse Elexikon
description:
Elexikon variant for kids.
An electronic dictionary quiz game with over 1100 questions and answers with images for 1 or more players.
Players answer the questions with electronic mouse instead of pen. Mouse eye flashes green if the answer is correct.
Who has more correct answers at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Multipli Cat's
description:
Multipli Cat's is a card game of calculation, memory, concentration and speed.

Players take turns turning their cards over and compare their results. If 2 players have the same result (for instance 4 x 9 and 36), they must hit the mouse card placed in the center of the table (green card) as fast as possible. The quickest gives his cards to his opponent.
There are six different action cards which give more punch to the game. They either require speed or quick counting.
The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Level 3
description: A 3D tic-tac-toe variant with a random element, where the randomizer is provided by an electronic LED doohickey in the base of the board (requires 9-volt battery). The randomizer determines a random space (on the 3d tic-tac-toe board), and if it's occupied, its owner must remove the piece.

name: Licence to Kill
description:
A rare promotional card game made by Golden Wonder, a manufacturer of crisps in Britain.

The game, which can be played by 2-6 players, consists of:

a) 12 assignment files, each file giving the names and visual characteristics of the four enemy Agents to be captured and

(b) pictures of all 48 enemy Agents which together with 4."Licence to Kill" cards make up the pack of 52 playing cards.

Objects of the Game: Each player is given an assignment file which outlines the 4 Agents he must capture (the details on this file are not divulged to the other players until the end of the game). Using the pack of 52 cards, the players try to capture each of the Agents listed in their assignment file.

Deal 4 cards to each player and place the remaining cards face downwards on the table. (We will call this Pack A). The player on the left of the dealer then picks up a card from Pack A. If this is a card he wants he discards one of the cards in his hand. If it is of no use, the card is thrown down. Unwanted cards are placed face upwards in Pack B. In turn, each player can take the top card from either Pack A or B. One card must always be put back on to Pack B as at no time must you have more than 4 cards in your hand.

In each game you will find 4 "Licence to Kill" cards. If you are lucky enough to obtain one of these cards, you may interrupt the game at any time and exchange it for a card thrown on to Pack B.

Once all the cards in Pack A have been used, the cards in Pack B are turned face down and the game continues as before.

name: WWE Power Chipz
description:
From Topps' website: WWE Power Chipz is ready to become the latest hit with WWE's legion of fans! With over 140 Chipz to collect, look for your favorite WWE superstars including John Cena, The Miz, Rey Mysterio, Divas, and WWE Legends. Gamers will have 6 action-packed games to play with a special magnetic powerball. Roll your powerball over your Chipz, and watch to see how many you can get to stick. The more Chipz that stick, the more points you earn! Plus, special Ruby, Silver, and Gold Chipz give you bonuses!

In this game you lay out different WWE Power Chipz on the ground and take turns rolling a magnetic ball. Each WWE Power Chipz poker style chip features a wrestler and a star power. After rolling the magnetic ball, you claim whichever chips are stuck to the ball.

After all of the chips have been collected, you add up your total scores and whoever has the highest score is the winner.

name: All About Lancaster County
description:
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list. The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations are real businesses in Lancaster County, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Kimpassa
description:
A game for couples to find out what irritates them in their partners and what they really love about them. The game board is divided into to two parts, the first part of the board is about the things you hate and as you go on, you'll get to the side of the board that's about the things you love about your partner.

The game includes three different categories. The annoying things in your partner, the really irritating things in your partner and the things you love in your partner. In the first three categories, the pair draws three cards and then both of them arrange the cards in order of most annoying or most lovable by writing them up on paper. The pairs take turns on whose point of view the cards are arranged. If they get the most annoying/lovable thing right, they'll move 2 steps, if they'll get all right, they'll move 3 steps.

Also included is "What would you do category?" that challenges the partners to think how they or their partner would act in different specific situations, for example, how would you act if your mother-in-law would pay you a visit?

The pair that crosses the finish line first wins!
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Jeu du B√©b√™te Show
description:
The idea of the game is to play ministers.
Every turn new minister becomes Prime Minister.

In each round players try to favor ministers to hope him raise the new prime minister and get something back to their pocket.
Ministers can play a limited number of cards in each turn.

name: Jeu du Paf
description:
A kind of new version of Game of Goose with the theme of
P.A.F. is (French Audiovisual Landscape)

On the squares with usual pitfalls, you will pass small tests and answer the questions.

Otherwise, the rules of the Game of the Goose are unchanged.

name: Found in the Kitchen
description:
A party game where guests are each given a card with 18 pictures on it. The pictures are visual cryptic clues to a foodstuff found in a kitchen. For example, picture number 9 is a man cutting wood for logs and the answer is Chops. There are 18 such clues to solve and the first to hand in a completely correct card, wins.

This is one of the publisher's range entitled Can You Solve?

name: Motor Cars
description:
Party game that tests the players' knowledge of motor car manufacturers.

Each player is given a card with 26 clues to the name of a motor car. For example;
Clue 1: A Wanderer = Rover
Clue 13: A Famous General = Wolseley

There is one cryptic clue;
A Beheaded Duck, which is meant be a (M)allard!

They are generally British cars as you might expect in a British game but two relate to American cars. I don't think many Brits would know Dodge or Plymouth.

When a guest has finished all 18 solutions, their card is handed to the host. The first to do so, with 18 correct answers, wins.

Note that this box is much larger than any other party games that I have from this era. It is also bright and colourful, another trait often missing from similar games. Unfortunately, the company must have decided that this presentation was too expensive because they soon reverted to the more traditional sized and look of most party games by their competitors.

name: A Motor Smash
description:
Party game that tests the guests' knowledge of car parts.

Each player receives a card with 19 clues to the name of a car part. The clues take the form of an anagram with the letters all shuffled around. Example;

TBNOEN = Bonnet (that is the Hood for American readers)
GNANDRUNOBSIR = Running Boards (that is a very nostalgic feature of a car, I think).

The guest who first hands in a correct card, wins.

name: Behead Me Twice
description:
Party game, unusually published as a pad with removable sheets.

On this sheet are clues to two words. However there ia third word, which is the correct answer to the clue. By this I mean, each word, beheaded (i.e. with the first letter knocked off), gives another word, and this beheaded again, gives a third word. Clues to the first word and the last word are given. The players must work out the middle word. An example;

From a shelter for horses to skilful;
First word = Stable
Last word = Able
So the middle word is Table and that is the answer a player must find to answer it correctly.

The first guest to hand in a sheet with 16 correct answers, wins.

name: Country Squares
description:
Party game that tests players' knowledge of Geography.

Each guest is given a sheet of 16 clues to a territory in Europe, Asia, Africa or South America. I don't know why North America was left out, but it was. The clues take the form of three six letter words. Any two consecutive letters within each word will combine to form a six letter word answer. Example of a North American clue had North America been included;

SCARED
ANNALS
DANGER
The answer is CA NA DA so the answer is Canada

The first player to hand in 16 correct answers, wins.

name: A Day at the Zoo
description:
Party game that has correct answers but I expect the wrong answers provide more amusement.

Each guest is given a card that tells the story of a day's outing to a zoo. However the story is punctuated with blank words and the players must hand in a card with all the missing words added correctly. Each missing word is the name of an animal. For example;

"... as slow as a t - " = Tortoise.
That was an easy one. Now try this;
"Is it going to r - ?" = Reindeer (i.e. Rain, Dear)

The first player to hand in a correct card, wins.

One in the "Dainty" series of games.

name: A Sterling Competition
description:
A party game for wordsmiths.

Each guest is given a card with 24 clues. The answer to each clue is a word ending in 'ster'. For example;

Clue 1. Ogre = Monster
A harder one; Clue 9. Cockney Hawker = Coster

A costermonger was a person who sold things, usually fruit and vegetables, from a handcart in the street. A Cockney is someone traditionally born within the sound of Bow Bells, situated in the East End of London. However the name is often given to a Londoner born and bred anywhere in London.

The first guest to hand in their card with 24 correct answers, wins.

One of the games in the Dainty Series by this publisher.

name: House Hunting
description:
A party game intended to make "a tremendously successful party" (so says the publisher).

The host places Key Cards around the house or garden, depending on the venue for the party. For a garden party, it is suggested that you try to place the cards in unusual locations, including 'up a tree'!!

Each guest gets a card that shows, at the top, the name of a house (the British love giving a name to their house). That is their start point. They must find the Key Card with that house on it and that will tell them the name of the next house Key Card they must look for. When you find a house that you need, you must write down the defect of the house. This will prove that you did indeed find the card.

The first player to find all 12 houses required, wins.

Rather hopefully, the publisher says that if you buy extra score cards (called House Agents' Lists) up to 500 people can play! The mind boggles!!

name: Chouchou et Loulou
description:
The object is to find a word that begins with two letters.

On each card, a little phrase has a word in white. Each player or team has a few chips that show two letters. It should be the first to announce a valid word, starting with those letters, to complete the sentence. A word may be refused by a vote of players. Who complete the sentence first may remove one of his token out of his supply.
The first player who has no more tokens left wins the game

name: Bienvenue chez les Ch'tis
description:
You make the tour of the postman in answering questions about the North and passing of the cult scenes from the movie with the same name.

The game board shows town of Bergues. During the postman, the players will go through different stages, symbolized by the iconic scenes from the movie.

To be the winner of the game, simply answer correctly the questions on the Northern Department and on the film.

Contents:

220 cards
6 cyclists
a game board
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Robinson Crusoe
description:
Game from New Zealand, probably from the 1950's.

A simple roll and move game. Try to land on the green squares and avoid the red squares. If either colour is landed on, you must follow the instructions, good or bad.

First to get the hero from his home to being rescued, wins.

name: V√≠deo Disney
description:
Vídeo Disney is a brazilian trivia game based on the movies and characters of the Disney Universe.

Each player gets 10 cards, numbered 1-10, and 3 rubber tokens. In turns, players must:
- without looking, get one card from the player to his right. This card will represent the question number and the number of spaces the player will advance if he answer correctly;

- get another card from the same player. This card number will represent the number of spaces the player will go back if he doens't answer correctly;

- the player who had his cards taken then gets one quesion card, and read the question with the number picked by the player;

- he answers the question, or spend a rubber token to get a different question, and then advances or go back as mentioned before. After that, the player get his number cards back.

The first player to cross the board wins!

name: Les Ann√©es t√©l√©
description:
The goal of the game is to discover the name of a television personality behind other players. For this you need to win as many clues as possible.
The fastest player presses the buzzer to answer, if he answers correctly he scores a point.

Several clues are put into play in three sequences QUIZ, MIME and GENERIC.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: OPFOR: Zulu 6
description:
Welcome to the world of Zulu 6: the world's deadliest covert special missions force.

Assembled from the ranks of the most elite special forces units from around the world, the 6 warriors of Zulu Team are the guardians of humanity against the evil faction known as S.C.A.R. (Soldiers of Chaos, Anarchy & Rebellion).

Six of the world's top ten elite fighting forces are represented among the members of the Team: the Russian Spetsnaz, the French Naval Commandos, Israel's Shayetet 13, the U.S. Army Airborne Rangers, U.S. Marine Special Operations Command and the U.S. Navy SEALs.

Choose your side: one player controls Zulu 6 while the other controls S.C.A.R. The objects of the game: During each mission, Zulu 6 must use their elite combat skills to complete 2 mission objectives. S.C.A.R. must stop them with the use of overwhelming forces.

The game begins with the Zulu player choosing 3 of the 6 team members as his/her first assault team while S.C.A.R. player builds the game board by laying out 4 inch map tiles printed with a dirt path cutting through a jungle, placing each tile so that the path is continuous until the line of sight ends in a curve or a 3-way "T". As the Zulu 6 team moves along the path, the S.C.A.R. player continues to build it. Some of the map tiles contain hazards designed to slow the Zulu 6 team members while others contain mission objectives such as a prison camp, a weapons facility and a downed spy plane. There are also map tiles that contain symbols that allows the S.C.A.R. player to place a number of his troops in that tile to keep Zulu 6 from completing its mission. The S.C.A.R. player also has the ability to spawn more troops to keep the danger moving.

Combat between the 2 armies is resolved using 6-sided dice (D6). Each Zulu 6 team member has a stat card that explains his special skill and lists how many attack dice he gets during combat as well as areas to keep track of ammunition spent during combat (10 slots) and wounds taken (3 slots). Each time a Zulu 6 team member attacks, a marker is moved 1 space along his ammo track. The same happens when a team member takes a hit. Every roll of 5 or 6 on a Zulu 6 die roll is a kill. Each S.C.A.R. trooper only gets 1D6 and a roll of 6 on the die is a wound on the target Zulu 6 team member.

As the game progresses, Zulu 6 races to achieve mission objectives as S.C.A.R. sends wave after wave of troops at them. All the while, Zulu 6 receives 5 mission points for each objective achieved and for each S.C.A.R. troop killed and may use these points in trade for special actions such as healing a wound, an extra attack die, an ammo drop to reload weapons or even to call in reinforcements if a Zulu team member is lost in combat.

There are 3 missions to complete that make up the core game, each with 2 objectives.

With expansions coming soon featuring different mapped environments, daring missions, and new team members, you can take Zulu 6 around the world battling the evil forces of S.C.A.R.

name: Le Secret des Moines
description:
The monks go to the gathering around the monastery.

The game board represents a path consisting of multiple branches in boxes. For these cells will spread face down cards representing different plants.

The first player chooses how many spaces it will move. The other players will move the same number of squares in the direction of their choice.
Once on a box, the player becomes aware of the nature of the plant in secret.
- If it appears on his card objective (each player has different objective), he takes it in front of him.
- If it appears on the card of opponent, he places it before him face down.
- If the plant appears nowhere, it stays in place face up.

The first player return to the monastery with its five plants is the winner.

name: Puzzle Menu
description:
Party game. Each guest is given a card with 41 clues to something. The only help is that every answer relates to a course in a meal. So you start with Hors D'Ouvre and then Soup, and so on.

The guest with the most right answers, wins

name: Hi-Low Jambone
description:
This game was created during the playtesting and development Duplicate Heartless. More information on the development of the games, and the original posting of the rules, can be found in this thread.

As in keeping with Duplicate Heartless, players will draft dice from a pool of dice and the play with their dice in the open, making for a game that is combinatorial in nature during play, and also the idea is to have the lowest score.

This game differs from Duplicate Heartless, however, in several ways:

First, game involves using 14 dice of one color and 14 of another color.

Second, during the game, if the suit die is one color, then the player who played the highest number of the suit die of the pair of dice takes the trick, and if another color is led, then the lowest number die of the suit pair of dice takes the trick.

Jambone is a word connected with a version of Euchre where cards are played face up. In addition, bones is slang for dice. Hi and low were chosen as part of the name, because tricks won vary between either high pair of dice, or low pair of dice being the winning pair.

name: Genius Tennis
description:
A two player game played on a grid of 42 holes, 7 in each of six rows. The holes in the four central rows have point values of 10 20 and 30, the nearer the centre of the array the greater the value.
Each player starts with 20 pegs in the three rows nearest him, the centre two holes remaining empty. Pegs move by jumping over adjacent pegs as in Solitaire, and the jumped pegs are removed.
My game rules don't tell me when this process stops!
At the end of the game the players add up the value of the holes in which they have pegs and the greatest total wins.
publishers: Invicta Games, Jensen, Sp√≥≈Çdzielnia Rzemie≈õlnicza Piaseczno

name: Juniper
description:
Card game relating to trees.

The beatifully illustrated cards feature trees in sets of type. The game mechanic is set collecting, similar to games like Authors, Quartets and Happy Families. But there are also variant games by the author.

Designer Ruth Wheeler again works here with the artist Nellie Wilkinson, a proven collaboration initiated by this publisher

name: Tricky Monkey
description:
Publisher Blurb:

As all players play simultaneously let's see who's the fastest to win the fruit...

Unique, quick and fun game that will keep you on your toes.
Players must try and collect 6 fruit leaves before their fellow monkeys. However there is an additional obstacle lurking in the jungle. If players are not careful, a hungry gorilla may swipe the fruits that they have gathered. A colorful Toucan can also bring you luck and give you a chance to win more fruit.

The Object:
The first player to collect 6 fruit leaves is the winner.
If the gorilla collects 6 fruit leaves first, then it's the winner.

Combination of tactic decisions, speed, memory and fun...
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Memory, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Antiques Roadshow
description:
Trivia game with the theme of the questions being on different areas of antique collecting; Porcelain, Silver, Paintings, and so on. The game is licenced by the BBC who have been broadcasting the Antiques Roadshow for well over 20 years.

The object is to answer enough questions correctly to 'build' a medallion. When assembled (10 correct answers in all), you must answer one more question from the subject of your choice and if you get it right, you win.

One particular aspect makes it a true family game. The questions takes three forms. At the start decide if you are an Expert, an Enthusiast, or an Amateur. If you are an Expert, then you get the question as is. If you are an Enthusiast, you get three possible answers and must choose one of the. If you are an Amateur, you get two possible answers and must choose one. Thus children can play with adults quite happily.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Goalmouth Scramble
description:
A game for the committed statistical sport games collector - a statistical game of College Lacrosse. I think that it was an American game first played by native Americans but, here in England, it is always featured in 1950's girls' comics as being played at rather upmarket schools for girls.

As usual with this designer's games, a match is quickly resolved with a few dice rolls, so the keen Lacrosse fan can play a whole season of fixtures in a relatively short time.

name: T-Ball
description:
A Texan-made American football game based on the exciting new tactic at the time, the T-Formation. This is not a statistical game and is played head-to-head against your opponent. After choosing a card for the type of play you would like your team to accomplish and then refered to a table that gives the result of the play.

I think it could be played solitaire because I cannot see any interaction that would happen each turn.

name: Bell's 64,000 Question
description:
Quiz game who pinched the name from a different American game related to $64,000. the names are the same but the games are completely different. The 64,000 Question is a party game where guests are asked quiz questions. No board, no playing pieces, just question cards. This game has a board and playing pieces.

Up to four players attempt to get 10 questions correct and thus reach the spinner in the middle of the box. The spinner itself is used to determine the 'colour' of the question you have to face.

The questions are intended for children to answer, not adults.

name: He Shoots...He Scores!
description:
Statistical ice hockey game. A few dice rolls and the result is known, at that speed you can play a whole season within a couple of days.

All the Stanley Cup teams are rated, both as teams and as individual players.

It comes in the usual Valgames' pouch.

name: UNO: Limited Too It's A Girl's World
description:
From the box: Pack your bags and get ready for fun with the Limited Too edition of Uno! 110 Custom Cards featuring the Limited Too crew exploring their favorite cities with their best friends. Same great Uno play plus the exclusive Around the World card that allows players to travel to a new place and gain an edge on their opponents.

Summary: Just like standard Uno. The Around the World card allows you to swap all hands left, right or across, player's choice, and also choose the color like a Wild card.

name: Try-Angles
description:
Abstract game. There are 16 plastic triangular pieces and each turn you must add one to the table in Triominos fashion, that is, one against another, but not just matching numbers you must also match colours.

First person to use all their dominos, wins.

name: International Rugger
description:
Dice based Rugby game, The box folds out into the inside of a rugby stadium, and both players have an elastic band powered catapult they use to "throw" the five dice into the box.

The hope is that the five dice will form a combination of moves resulting in a try.

Most tries, wins

name: Grand National
description:
Horse racing game that takes its game-play from the traditional British card game of Racing Aces.

The cards are shuffled and a number are taken out of the deck and revealed to the players. In the race, cards will be revealed and the horse in that racing colours will advance one space. This is done for each card revealed until one horse crosses the finish line.

It will be seen that some horses will have less cards in the pack than others. This is because when you take out the cards before the race begins, those cards are no longer in the pack, so the horses affected have less cards available and thus have less chance of winning. The odds for them to win will be higher than the odds om horses with, for example, all their cards still in the deck.

Players bet on each race and after a pre-agreed number of races, the player with most money, wins.

John Rickman, British television's eccentric horse racing expert, pictured on the box.

name: Infection Control Game
description:
A promotional game so it is a little basic.

Using dice players move along a track, entering hospital and then getting out of the hospital at the end of the track. The trick is to avoid picking up infections although this is completely down to luck. If you land on the bad squares, that is tough luck.

It has an educational feel to it. The maker is unknown to me, it could be, probably is, American, but I did track down a Stuart Pharmacueticals in Australia. Wherever the publisher resided, the message is clear. Avoid infection!

name: Forfeits
description:
A party game, rare for this publisher. Indeed, it might be their only party game.

Three games are described in the rules - Forfeits, Double Forfeits and Charade Forfeits. They are all centred around the required player ability to perform some sort of action. The rules say that when one of their number has to do this, "the hilarity can well be imagined". Some cards are starred and if you draw one of these to perform, you can hand it to any other guest who now has to do the action. The games differ slightly in their winning conditions (the most successes, wins) except for the Charade variant where a team will win.

name: What's What?
description:
A game that will test your skills at mathematics.

Players draw tiles and put them on their rack. At the start of the timer, you try to form equations with your tiles (2x9=18, that sort of thing). You score points for the most tiles used before the timer runs out.

The most points when the game ends, wins.

name: Realstat Soccer
description:
A statistical sports game, focusing on the indoor soccer leagues of the MISL. Designed to play quickly so that a whole season can be played in one evening.

Each team is rated in various areas of skills. The statistics are in the form of paper sheets rather than cards. Dice are used to determine results of actions.

My set dates from 1990 and includes season stats for 1988 to 1990.

name: Realstat Hockey
description:
Statistical sports game based Ice Hockey. Includes the 1990/1991 NHL Teams and the 1991/1992 Playoff teams.

Each team is rated in certain areas and dice rolls are checked for each team to see the results of a match. Designed to be fast so that a whole season can be played in an evening.

Statistics are printed in lists rather than on cards.

name: Qwikscore Volleyball
description:
Unusual to find this sport in a statistical game. Designed around results for over 100 Men's and Women's Olympic teams.

Teams are rather basically rated but it only needs a dice roll or two to decide a result, meaning that a complete Olmpic Volleyball event can be replayed in an evening.

name: Qwikscore Bowling
description:
Statistical replay sports game based on the sport of 10 Pin Bowling. Over 100 professional bowlers are rated in various areas and matches are decide by a couple of dice rolls. This speed means that you can play an event featuring all the rated players and finish it in one evening.

Statistics are listed on paper rather than on cards.

name: Corral
description: This two-person game is played on a six-by-six checkerboard with squares of six different colors. Each player has a marker and three blockers. Player one moves his marker and blockers, attempting to corner player two's marker. A die determines the distance a piece may move and the color of the square to which it may move. If player two's marker is not cornered after six turns, the roles are switched, and player two tries to corner player one's marker.

name: Devinettes d'Epinal √Ä Colorier
description:
42 cards in seven sets of six. The sets are named;
1. Contes
2. Soldats
3. Mythologie
4. Métiers
5. Campagne
6. Brigands
7. Animaux

Players must collect as many sets as they can by asking for cards in one of the sets that they have at least one card in that set in their hand. When all the sets are grouped together, the player with the most wins.

This is a reproduction of a game published by Grimaud around 1848, so the graphics are rather interesting.

name: Math Twister
description:
The red deck contains five each of the numbers one through ten. The green deck contains 90 consecutive numbers from 11 to 100. Four green cards are randomly placed face-up in a row. Eight red cards are randomly placed face-up ---- four in a row above the row of green cards and four in a row below the row of green cards.

Players simultaneously use the red numbers and up to four mathematical operations to form an equation that equals one of the green numbers. The red cards used in an equation are discarded; the player who formed the equation keeps the green card. The green card is replenished immediately. The red cards are replenished when no player can form an equation with the red cards that remain on the table.

Play continues either until a player's green card values equal an agreed-upon total or until a player acquires an agreed-upon number of green cards.

name: Buried Treasure
description:
Somewhere on the island is buried a chest full of gold doubloons. The task of the players is to try and locate the exact position of this hidden treasure. It can be achieved by the simple means of elimination.

The map is divided into forty-nine squares which are numbered horizontally and lettered vertically (fig. 1). There are also fourteen 'location cards' each containing a reproduction of the island map and with either one row or one column shaded (fig. 2). At the beginning of the game, these cards are divided into two packs, one containing the numbered columns and the other the lettered rows. Each pack is shuffled and placed face down and the top card drawn from each. These cards remain unseen and give the exact location of the treasure. For example; should the card with column 3 shaded be drawn together with the card having row F shaded, then the position of the treasure is at square 3F. The twelve remaining cards are shuffled together and dealt equally amongst the players of whom there may be two, three or four.

Each player also receives eight digging tokens. Having looked at the cards in his hand, the first player will place one of his tokens on a square on the map board, say B6. If the player on his left has a card indicating either row B or column 6 or indeed both, then he simply says 'No' and the first player's turn ends with the knowledge that possibly the treasure is not buried anywhere in column 6 and/or row B.

Players continue to place tokens in turn until one of the players suggests the location of the treasure chest. That player then looks at the cards selected at the beginning of the game. If correct, that player wins, if not the cards are replaced face down and that player is out of the game.

A variant suggested by the inventor, which makes a longer but possibly a better game, is where each player only has one token and, after it has been placed on the board during the first round, it may only be moved to an orthogonally, adjacent square on each succeeding turn.

name: Micky Sport Domino
description:
34 cards, all featuring some of children's favourite characters. The cards are nice and large, just right for little hands. Children's card game that links dominoes with cards.

Each player starts with 4 cards and the first player to the left with a 'Doppel' (i.e. with two pictures the same on it) plays it to the table. The next player must add one at either end, domino fashion, or pass and draw a card from the stack.

The first player to use all their cards, wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Das √ú-50 Partyspiel
description:
Objective:
be the first climbing up the board to the top by knowing the correct answers.
A quiz game for people who just turned 50 and want to test their knowledge about trendy things from those times.

Whoever's guess is correct advances on the scoring board faster than other players.
More fun is achieved by reaching marked/coloured fields on the board; allowed ways of explaining are significantly reduced;

Content:

1 game board
6 characters
1 dice
104 cards with over 1200 terms
6 response cards
1 Hourglass
1 set of instructions
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: bodyIQ: Premium
description:
bodyIQ - Premium is a game about the body, how it works, how to improve it and physical exercises.

Basically it a trivia game with a twist. There are 12 categories. 10 based on some of the bodys most important organs, 1 health check and 1 physical excersise, 600 questions/task all in all. Each turn the player roll the die, and moves his marker along the paths of the body. Depending on the space the player ends on, he will either get a question, a health check or a physical task to do. If he answers correct, or performs the task, he will win the card, giving him a number of years.

For younger players there is a multriple choise option.

There are three suggestend ways to end the game:
1) Play until one player reaches 100 years.
2) Play until one player collects all 12 categories.
3) Play for a certaing amount of time.
Whoever has the most points (=years) at the end of the game wins.

name: Dits√∂: Legado de Nuestra Tierra
description:
Ditsö is a strategy game of skirmish battles for all the family, that shows native Costa Rican mythology, language, customs and traditions.

The game recreates the fight among gods and other magical beings to take over Tisingal, the place where, according to the legend, lay the lost gold mines of Talamanca.

With Ditsö the player get used to the Bri Bri language and learns about the importance of some symbols of great value for our ancestors, like the fact that Sibö is the creator according to the Bri Bri, Cabécar and Brunca mythologies,or the meaning of fur or feathers for the indigenous warriors.

The name of the game itself was thinked with this purpose. Ditsö means "group" or "clan", which is represented by character cards that each player chooses to form his/her tribe. Each card has an explanation about what each character means in the native mythology, and the locations and unique figures keep their indigenous names.

In terms of gameplay, Ditsö is played like a miniatures game, althoough it uses cards (folded in the middle so they can stand) instead of miniatures. Each player or team has a certain amount of points (100 points in a standard game) to recruit an army; each card has a value. It is allowed to recruit as many green cards of the same type as whished, but only one golden card of the same kind may be recruited.

Then players set their armies in the predesignated start zones and the game begins. Depending of the charactes chosen, they may have special abilities, but normally the options will be to start a melee combat, a ranged combat or just to move (some characters have the ability of flying). There is also the chance to counter attack, but the character should have this ability to do so.

The first player of team to destroy his/her opponent wins the game.

Ditsö won the 2011 Ideas Innovadoras Award in the social innovation cathegory, and is an attempt to rescue Costa Rican roots in a fun and familiar way.
categories: American Indian Wars, Educational, Fighting, Religious
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid

name: Tit 3 Tat
description:
Tit 3 Tat is game #30 of the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

Tit 3 Tat is a 3 player only game on half a checkerboard, with each player having 6 pieces of their color. In the game, players attempt to control more spaces on the board by the time the game ends. Pieces move like chess queens, and have the ability to pass through spaces control by their side. Each turn, a player must either move one of their pieces on top of a single piece of an opponent, or remove an enemy piece on top of a stack from two players (this is in the basic version, with a variant providing more complex removal rules). Effort was made to provide a 3 player game experience that would try to prevent players from colluding to gang up against a single player in order to eliminate them from play.

The game provides a unique feature where it is possible for a player to win a game, even if they haven't made a move. In addition, turn order is not fixed, and depends totally on who a player interacts with during their turn.

name: K√§pt'n Blaub√§r Raubm√∂wen-Zock
description:
Children's card game that will help a little with their mental arithmetic.

Four cards are placed face up. Each player gets 6 cards. On their turn a player may play a card with the same value as one of the cards in the four face-up cards. He then takes both cards and starts a pile of won cards. Alternatively, he may play a card from his hand that is the total of two or more face-up cards:
Example. The four cards face up are 2, 3, 5, 7. The player uses an 8 card from his hand to take the 5 and the 3.

The face-up cards are replenished after every turn so that each player starts their turn with 4 cards in the middle.

If players run out of cards in their hand, they are dealt six more cards each and the game proceeds as before. When there are not enough cards to complete a later deal, the game ends and the one with the most won cards, wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Star Wars: The Clone Wars ‚Äì AAT Attack
description:
Your mission is to seek out and destroy a Separatist Armored Assault Tank (AAT). You will need to get into close quarters with the tank and blow it up with a blast from your Thermal Detonator. Use the debris scattered around the battlefield for cover and look to the Jedi Anakin's Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi for aid. But beware, the evil and powerful Asajj Ventress also lurks about the battlefield.

On a 3D hex filled board, using roll and move mechanics, maneuver your plastic pre-painted Clone trooper miniature around the board trying to stay out of the firing direction of the large plastic AAT. Either through the use of cards or die rolls, your turn may also consist of firing red plastic discs with the AAT at the other plyers' Clone Troopers.

The game comes with a "basic" version of play using only a single 12 sided die as well as an "advanced" version using a 6 sided die and cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mark & Bein: Autorennen
description:
Motor racing game published in the Pöppel-Revue magazine, Issue 72.

The track is marked in small squares. Each player uses a different coloured pencil. In a turn you can set your speed, which starts at 1. This lets you move one square. On subsequent turns you can increase or decrease your spped by 1. So a car travelling at speed 3 may, next turn, go down to 2, go up to 4, or to stay at 3.

Your move is drawn on to the board, so different colored pencils or pens is essential. All movement must be in a straight line for each move, so you can only change direction on your next throw, and so on. Thus, it is possible to crash if you go too fast around a corner. Forward planning is required.

The torturous track is, in effect, a figure of eight. First car home, wins.

name: Figure Me Out: a game to help children learn about others
description:
From the publisher:
This game helps kids get to know each other. The game develops social skills by helping children learn to gather information about others and share information about themselves. Children take turns assuming the role of a reporter, getting to the bottom of a story by using Who, What, When, Where, and How questions to figure out what another player is thinking. These conversational skills are used to teach children how to begin and maintain an interesting conversation. A variety of topics (a hobby that interests me, a movie I saw recently, my favorite season, etc.) are used to generate ideas, or stories, for the players to figure out. The object of the game is to complete a full circuit of the game board and file your story by the deadline. Designed for children with Asperger Syndrome in mind. Said to help kids develop the social skills needed to begin and hold a conversation.

name: Deal or no Deal: Elektronische Versie
description:
Analogous to the TV program you can now play with family and friends about the big money.
Everyone chooses one of the suitcases from the electronic board and each round a certain number of cases opened, then the bank makes an offer based on the remaining sum, the player can accept or reject, he refuses to be in the next round, open suitcase. Who will score the higher amount, whether by accepting the bank offer or the amount in the last remaining case is the winner.

name: Qwikscore Hockey
description:
From the expert designer of fast-play statistical sports games. This one features ice hockey teams and leagues. 20 years of statistics are used, from the early 90's back to the 70's. The intention is to let you play a whole season in an evening or, at the very least, all your favourite team's matches.

Dice determine outcomes after rolls are compared to the various charts provided.

name: High Scorer Pro Basketball
description:
Statistical basketball simulation. Game designed with the intention that each match-up is quickly resolved (using charts and dice as usual in these types of game). The designer hoped that this brevity would allow a player to replay a whole season in a relatively short space of time.

Statistics included for the 1991/92 season plus two older seasons. Every main player in each team is rated as well as the team ratings.

name: Das N√ºrnberg-Quiz
description:
Trivia game about Nürnberg, a city in the German state of Bavaria.
71 questions with 3 variant to answer.
Answer correctly and get the card as a point.
If the deck is exhausted the player with the most points wins.

name: QuizDetektiv: Dinosaurier
description:
A quiz game aimed at children. The questions are all related to the theme, in this case, dinosaurs. You are given three possible answers and so if you don't know, you can have fun guessing.

The player who answers the most questions correctly, wins. As a little extra, each player can check their score against a table and will be rated as:
A Super-Meister-Quizdetectiv, or;
A Meister Quizdetectiv, or;
A Quizdetectiv, or:
A Hilfs-Quizdetectiv

name: Pocket Quiz: Englisch Aktiv
description: This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game for learning English. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Trivia, Word Game

name: Lernspiel: Der Menschliche K√∂rper
description: Educational range of games. This one deals with the Human Body. It is a very simple card game. You get asked a question. If you get it right, you gain a point. If you get it wrong, you lose a point. When the questions run out, or an agreed time-limit has been reached, the player with the most points wins.

name: Na Sowas!
description:
Young children's memory game.

The first player lays out six tiles where all the players can see them. Then each tile is covered with a wooden block.
Now, a die with six coloured faces is rolled and the first player announces the tile they think is under the block with the same colour as the die roll. The block is lifted and the tile beneath is checked. If the player was correct, they can continue with another turn. If the player was wrong, then the turn passes to the next player in a clockwise direction.

When all six tiles have been correctly named, six more tiles are revealed, studied and covered by the blocks again. When all 30 tiles have been collected, the player with the most tiles, wins.

name: Debtbusters II
description:
Educational game, designed to teach groups how to manage the federal budget over five years.

Not much fun here. It is extremely technical and comes with masses of forms, sheets, references, optional detail and teaching guides. Players are presented with a problem and must choose a way to improve the situation. If they are right, all well and good. If they are wrong, the results of their action are demonstrated.

The winning group are the ones who get the most decisions correctly.
publishers: Roosevelt Center for American Policy Studies

name: National Trust Golf
description:
Not confirmed on the box, but this must have been a promotional game for the National Trust, maybe to sell in their souvenir shops exclusively.

It is a simplicated table golf game, with marbles acting as golf balls and a cheap plastic golf hole, a flag (to add realism perhaps!) and a club for each player.

Set the hole somewhere on the table and whack a marble with your club. The fewest shots taken, wins.

I think you will need a spirit-level because slightly sloping tables and marbles don't go together very well.

Game is housed in a plastic pouch rather than a box.

name: Space Invaders
description:
Game given away in the first edition of the U.K. magazine, The Gamer.

The board represents a Space Invaders layout, broken up into squares. One player is the Planet Player (otherwise known as the PP) and the other is the Aliens Player (AP of course). The Aliens are represented by a single card that starts at the top and then will move across the board and down, just like the real thing. The PP gets to fire first and if he hits any aliens, they are marked off the card with a wax crayon. Then the AP gets to drop bombs.

On any one turn, the PP can fire four shots or he may move to any space along the baseline and get two shots only. A die is used to indicate successful hits.

The PP player wins if he destroys all the Aliens. The AP player wins if he can get just one alien to touch the baseline.

Variants are included for using two dice and for adapting the game for three players.

name: Galileo Mystery
description:
The quiz game for the television series on Pro 7.
Categories are: Purple: Jesus Christ, Green: Pirate, White: King Arthur, Red: Leonardo da Vinci, Orange: d'Artagnan, White: Various.
There are question cards, each with six questions and 3 possible answers per question. The players take turns to ask questions according to the color location of the other characters, all others respond with their cards. Who answers correctly, takes a step further on the point bar. For the first correct answer to a category you get a Mystery disc.
If all player finishes they scores according the finishing order and number of mystery discs.
Who has the most points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Cha Cha Checkers
description:
Game takes place on a 9 x 10 grid of circles; furthest row on either player's side of the board features circles filled with letters "C-H-A-C-H-A-C-H-A" and covered with game's checker pieces that have corresponding letters on top, each player having chosen a different side and color. Players take turns placing three shoe pieces of their own color on the board, which will not move during the game and will help or hinder the players depending on ownership.

Players then take turns moving lettered pieces, one at a time but with each piece needing to move five times (as the player says "Cha" with each step,) to get to a corresponding letter on the opposite side. Pieces can move in any direction except diagonal and can jump, but do not capture or eliminate others. First player to find a home for all their pieces on their opponent's side wins.

Note: the game does not have a publication date. However, it features both "Hassenfeld Bros." and "Hasbro" names listed as publisher, and the "cha-cha-cha" was first known at some point in the 1950's or 1960's.

name: Spin-Tac-Toe
description:
Spin-Tac-Toe combines Tic-Tac-Toe with a bit of luck. Instead of being able to mark a space directly you must use a spinner to decide if you can mark that square in the 3x3 field or not.

Each square has a half of the spinner circle colored red for "O" and blue for "X". On your turn, if you spin your color you can mark the square. If not, you can't.

The winner is the first to make a line of three. As in regular Tic-Tac-Toe it is possible for a tie.

name: Ratz Fatz in das M√§rchenland
description:
Like the other games in the Ratz Fatz series, this is a collection of games that can be played with the same material. This particular game focuses on fairytales.

Central idea: A story or poem is being read, the kids listen, guess, rhyme and grab an object.

Components: 3 wooden fairy tale figurines (frog prince, dwarf, puss in boots), 12 cards (showing objects from fairytales, like an enchanted mirror, a witch's broom, gingerbread house etc.), one symbol die, one booklet with rules, stories, riddles and poems

Games that can be played:

1. Group and name: The players name the figurines and things on the cards and explain what fairytales they are from, or who else is part of that fairytale. They also look for objects that fit a certain criterion (something valuable, something in which one can live...)

2. Grab it: The figurines or cards mentioned in one of the texts from the booklet have to be touched as quick as possible.

3. Memory game: Only six figurines and/or cards are laid out on the table, the others stay in the box. When a character or object is mentioned that is on the table, nothing happens. If one that is inside the box is mentioned, the players shout that word to gain one of the pieces from the table.

4. Memory and storytelling game: The players use the cards and figurines to tell a story. 4 cards are used for the first figurine, the next 4 for the second, and the last 4 for the third. Then the symbol die is rolled. The symbol decides which of the three stories the players have to re-tell.

5. What can you do with this: One player secretly decides on one of the cards. He/she then says what can be done with that object (e.g. "You can use it to make a rabbit appear from a hat" when they have chosen the magic wand). The other players try to guess the object. The first player to touch the correct card wins that card.

name: The Quitting Game
description:
The Quitting Game is a multiplayer take on the Prisoner Dilemma that challenges players to quit the game at the right time.

Players start with 30 points. As the game goes on, these points decrease by a random amount (1-6, based on a six-sided die roll). Each turn, players decide whether or not they will quit the game or stay in. After each turn, the points decrease. If a player quits they are out of the game (or round, if there are multiple rounds), and score zero points for the round, unless all players remaining quit together. At this point, players evenly divide up the number of remaining points, times the number of players in the game.

Goal of the game is to score the most points.

name: Scattergories: Catholic Edition
description:
Catholic Scattergories contains sixteen additional categories based on the Catholic faith!

How many Bible categories can you match before time runs out? Roll the letter die to determine the key letter for that round. You roll a "C". Now start the timer! How quickly can you think of a "Place Christ walked?..." Canaan!... "Things that separate us from each other?..." Carelessness!... Can't think of an answer? No problem. Just write down any answer that fits the category and you still score points if your answers are different from every other player. This game is entertaining, enhances faith and promotes learning.

Catholic edition and Bible edition use the same box. Catholic edition has a different barcode label attached.

name: Soccer  Game
description:
Year around soccer fun:

Comes with a game board, a set of dice,30 each of the following: Penalty Cards, Penalty Kick Cards and Corner Kick Cards

Object: Player with highest score wins

Designed for 2-4 players

Ages 4 and up

Players can lose the ball by landing on a pass blockers square, landing on a ball out of play square
landing on an offside square or by the results of a penalty card

Scoring Points can be accumulated by going completely around the board for 1 point or as a result of corner kicks or penalty kicks

First player to reach 20 points wins the game

name: Sushi Tower
description:
Sushi Tower is a Japanese toy-style game where players take turns stacking sushi plates on a revolving platform. As the stack of plates grows ever taller, the tower becomes more and more unstable. When the tower falls during a player's turn, they must pay for all the plates in the tower.

The game includes three plates of three different colors. White plates are worth 100 yen and are the most stable plate. Pink plates are worith 200 yen and have bottom that cause the pink plates to lean a bit. Blue plates are worth 300 yen and have an off-center bottom, which causes the blue plates to be the most unstable.

The last person with money wins the game!

This game is Game #32 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series. It is a game involving 32 pieces on 32 spaces, for up to 32 players. Players attempt to coordinate and negotiate in order to work their way to the top of their group, and add other players to their group, by moving their piece (or being part of a group that moves).

At the end of the game, a player's score is where their piece(s) is/are in its stack.

name: Die Welt der Tiere
description:
"The world of animals" in English
On 32 cards there are 2 questions with three answers each, on the back with information and illustration on the subject. Players receive questions cards, in case of 3 and 4 players also betting cards.

The active player is asked by the quizmaster, if the first answer is right, he is asked the second question. If the answer is again correct, the player receives the card and places it with his betting cards. In case the first answer was wrong the left neighbour of the player can risk an answer and use one of his betting cards. If he answers wrong, he loses he card. When no one has questions cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.

name: Willi wills wissen  Pferde
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target zone by answering most questions correctly & tossing luckily
- acting simultaneously -
active player draws a card and chooses a question - 3 answers are read, one of those is correct (multiple choice); players show answers simultaneously; correct? Move one step ahead. If leading player moves upon a 'tossing' space: Last and second last Player run a 'Rock,Paper,Scissors' competition to make a step ahead.

name: Le fleau des dieux
description:
Le fleau des dieux is based on a French comics translated in English in 2008 by Marvel ("Scourge of the Gods"). The theme of this game is a mix of both Space conquest and a the ancient Roman empire.

The game sets the players into conflict for the control of the galaxy. The victory is achieved if a player control a chain of five planets or seven in total (without the chain condition). The first phase consist of dividing the planets among all players, then you will fight to gain more.

At the beginning of his turn player should choose one of his planet, other player can do the same to participate in the fight.

The combat system is based on two type of cards :

units (with attack values depending on the field)
special cards


The winner will choose two planets participating to the fight and then each other player will choose one (except the last who will get nothing).

name: Activity Franz Ferdinand
description:
A game in the "Activity" family of party games. Players have to act out, describe or draw words or phrases specified on a card, and the others have to guess the term. If the player's own team guesses the term, they get to move forward on the board. First team to reach the finish line wins the game.

This is an edition for children, and it stars "Franz Ferdinand", a boar from the "okidoki" children's TV program by Austrian broadcasting company ORF. Many of the terms that have to be guessed are directly related to the TV program.
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Monetura
description: The board game, Moneture, illustrates operation of the National Bank of Serbia under inflation targeting regime. Players take the role of the Governor and apply appropriate measures to influence the actual situation, win or lose the number of points and maintain inflation within the target range. The points to be won in the game represent success features: inflation value, dinar value and public trust. In addition, for membership in the EU monetary system, three conditions have to be met (Price Stability, Financial Stability and Independence of the National Bank). The winner of the game is the player who first completes all the specified tasks and reaches the end of the inner circle of the board - average inflation of the European Union.

name: The Amazing Adventures of Fibber McGee
description:
Like the Wistful Vista Mystery versions, this is a word substitution tale and plays proceeds the same, though this is a different book. This edition provides a four-part adventure titled "The Amazing Adventures of Fibber McGee"

The back page of this book features ads for G-Men and Easy Money. Both games of the day also published by Milton Bradley.


"A hilarious party game for any number of players. A riot of fun for everyone - take it from me! - Fibber McGee

...by Arrangement with the National Broadcasting Co. Inc."

A large deck of yellow cards are placed face down on a table in a loose spread out pile. Each card has a few words that make up a partial sentence on them.

One player reads a story out of a booklet and when the reader encounters a blank line ("_______") in the story, they pause and another player quickly draws a card and reads what is on it, then the reader continues.

For example, "My first encounter came after a series of lessons from _A_perforated_fire_hose_ who had slain nine thousand bulls."

Some cards have points on them, so the player who drew that cards would get some points. When all cards have been drawn, the points are tallied and a winner determined.

name: The Little Game of Wine
description:
This wine-themed trivia/party game can be played in two teams or with at least two players.
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible, by answering questions about wine and performing tasks from the activity cards. Each card is worth 1 point. The first player to reach the finish space on the board wins the game.

Activity cards come in two types: "Picture Memo" and "Sparkling Letters". "Picture Memo" means the active player has to memorize the picture on the card. After 30 seconds, the player on the left makes up a question about the picture, which the active player has to answer. In the "Sparkling Letters" activity, there are three words on the card, with their letters jumbled. The active player has to guess the words while the timer is running.
categories: Memory, Party Game, Trivia, World War I

name: Frontier Apocalypse: The Hermit's Expedition
description:
In Frontier Apocalypse, the world famous gunfight at the O.K Corral never happens. The night before, the unspeakable happens and the world was forever changed. Some blamed the South, some blamed the North, some blamed England, some blamed God or the Devil, but no one really knew what happened or why. But somehow humanity was able to survive the pulverizing chunks of moon rock that struck the planet; somehow humanity survived the various super volcanoes, massive radioactive solar flares and other terrible apocalyptic events. Frontier Apocalypse takes place over 100 years after that unspeakable event. In Frontier Apocalypse the Wild West never ended, it just got Wilder!

Frontier Apocalypse: The Hermit's Expedition is a solo Role Playing board/card game in the vein of games like Dungeon, Talisman, Chainsaw Warrior, and Dungeoneer. The player creates a character rolling dice, and then explores a post apocalyptic wild west by flipping cards that either reveal territories, critters, contraptions or various other events or points of interest. There are also boards to help with organization of character stats, gear and the game world. The game has several randomly chosen Expeditions that the player will need to complete with their character in order to win.Combat versus enemies is resolved by the character stats and contraptions and dice rolling. The player wins by completing their Expedition before running out of supplies or getting defeated the by various strange and weird critters who inhabit the Frontier Apocalypse world.
categories: Adventure, American West, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Puuhs Riesen-Bodenspiel
description:
Very simple board game for the under fives (with supervision). The board is very large and made of some sort of synthetic plastic. It folds out like a piece of cloth to give it it's size. The board is a track, running from the Start to end at Winnie the Pooh's house. Dice controls movement and special squares (there aren't many as it is intended for the very young) must be obeyed. The first to get to Winnie's house, wins.

The poor quality box lets down the nice presentation inside. A lot of thought has gone into the board, both physically and artisticly. The four playing pieces are like large round half-discs so easy for children to use.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pictorion
description:
Game loosely based on a game within a TV show. Players on the television show get to walk across the studio floor by identifying patterns. This game recreates that with player boards. Each player gets one and must place a chip in a circle that matches the pattern on the turn of a card. There are 40 cards so each game should be quite different. The aim is to form a path of chips from any colour to the opposite same colour. The first to do so, wins.

It can be played by individuals or as teams (if four are playing.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement

name: Wieviel Uhr ist es?
description:
Children's game to help them learn to tell the time. The main game is a race to complete the jigsaw that makes up the board. Depending on age, allow a player 1 or 2 minutes to finish the jigsaw. The fastest wins.

The jigsaw features a clock in the centre with moveable hands, and around the clock are activities associated with the time of day. In the second game, a parent can ask such things as "When do you leave for school?" and if a player gets it right, then a point is scored. At the game end, the player with the most points wins.

name: Lustiges Beruferaten
description:
The game of guessing the answers to funny job descriptions.

The game has 198 riddles, each one relating to a certain profession.

The person to the left of the player whose turn it is, slides from under the shuffled deck of cards (so that no-one can read it as they would have done should he draw it from the top of the deck. Each card has 6 riddles. The reader of the card rolls a die and must read out the job against the number rolled. The guesser tries to answer correctly. If he does, his piece is moved up the board. If wrong, the card is placed on the top of the stack and it is now the turn of the next player, and so on.

The first player to get to the finish line (Ziel) on the board, wins.

name: Kandidatuur
description:
An educational game about works councils in the Netherlands.

Players are candidates for a works council. On their turn, players will roll the die to move forward on a track of experiences in a works council, and encounter various events. The first player to reach the end and get elected wins the game.

name: Visspel
description:
An angling game, where players try to catch fish with magnetic fishing rods. On each turn, players are allowed to catch one fish only - if multiple fish "bite" on your rod, they have to be thrown back. The player who caught the most valuable fish wins the game.

Similar to Gone Fishin' (perhaps an earlier version?), but without the junk you can fish up and this has a much shallower pond to fish from.

name: Iaz
description: The goal of the game is to throw those combinations with five dice that match the ones on the common cards in the middle of the table. Each turn, the dice are passed to the next player, wgo can choose which Dice to reroll. Whomever collects most points wins the game.

name: Fly-Over
description:
A game that owes something to Solitaire. The board is an equitateral triangle with parallel lines connecting each of the 55 holes.

Three game versions are included. The first is for two or three players and starts with the board emptied of all it's pegs. Each player takes turns in adding a peg. If the peg completes a line, the player scores points. When the board is filled up, the winner is the player with the most points.

Game two starts with the board filled with pegs except the the hole in the middle of row seven. Each player takes turns to jump over a peg Solitaire-style and can continue jumping if there are more jumps available to him. The winner is the one with the most pegs once no more jumps are possible.

The third game is for one player who starts with the board full of pegs except for the one in the middle of row seven. The game is won if the player can take off every peg by jumping them and get down to just one peg left. For a harder game, that last peg must be in the hole which was vacant at the start (the one in the middle of row seven).

name: Treasure Trail
description:
Game from the inside covers of the 1964 Boy's Own Paper Annual.

The rules:

FOLLOW THE TRAIL AND FIND THE PIRATE'S TREASURE!
Here's an exciting game that calls for some skill and judgement. Up to 13 players can take part. All you need is a small, coloured counter for each player and one die. Players throw the die in turn and move their counter according to the table below.
First throw a 6 and then start from any square at the west end of the map. STOP if you come up against a natural obstruction (such as a volcano or swamp), or the edge of the map, or a square occupied by an opponent’s counter, and lose the remainder of that move.
If you throw:
1 - Move one square in any direction and have another throw.
2 - Rest on your present square until the next throw.
3 - Bonus. Move three squares in any direction — including a combination of forward and sideways.
4 - Move four squares South.
5 - Move five squares North.
6 - Move six squares East.

The winner will be the first player to reach the treasure island on the right hand side of the board.

name: Sch√ºtzt unsere Erde
description:
A racing game with a theme of environmental protection. The first player to collect an eco medal on all six continents and to reach his/her starting location with 1.000 eco dollars wins the game.

Players travel around the world to take part in environmental protection activities and by doing so, win eco medals. Open cards present the actions that have to be taken. There is one card fewer than there are players, so there is competition for actions.
Movement on the board is determined by dice. One can choose to use only one dice and earn 200 dollars, or use two dice and earn no money, or one can pay 500 dollars to use the plane. When a player reaches the target destination, they earn an eco medal of this continent and the card is removed from the game and replaced with a new one. If a player lands on the same space as another, he/she can take away money or a medal from that player.

The game ends when one player has earned a medal of each continent and reaches his/her home town with at least 1.000 eco dollars in his/her pocket.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Godzilla Boom
description: Nothing more for now that the Godzilla Boom name and the detail that the design is a party/card game.

name: Die Wilden Fussballkerle: Das Wilde Fu√üball-Quiz
description: Another game in this popular TV franchise. Players take turns to ask the other players a question about the TV show, football rules or football tips. The most right answers, wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Car-Cards
description:
Card game intended to be played on a long car journey.

Each player gets a hand of four cards and when they spot something on their hand of cards they can declare it and score the points on the card. They then get another card and play on. At the end of the journey, the player with the most points wins.

A simplified version for younger children is played the same but cards that have a word in Blue, the player can ignore that word e.g. Spot a yellow car and the word yellow is in blue type, then the player just has to see any car to score. In this version everything spotted scores 1 point regardless of the point score on the card.

An advanced version is also described where players can collect sets of cards with the same symbol on the card. If they can get four of them, they can just declare them all (without seeing the objects on the cards) and score accordingly. Not sure why this advanced version exist but there you are, it does.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Transportation, Travel
publishers: Divercentro, Russell Manufacturing Company, Trefl Joker Line
