name: Delfi 10
description: Trivia board game published on 10th anniversary of Delfi news site. The players roll a die and step the given amount on the board. Previous player takes a card and reads a task or question to the player. If he/she carries out the task or answers correctly, he/she gains the card and points shown on it. The game ends when the first player reaches the finish on the track. Then the points are added up and the biggest score wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Robin the Boy Wonder
description:
Deal out the cards which each player stacks in a face down pile in front of them. Everyone reveals the top card. The highest card played wins the 'trick' and places the cards won on the bottom of their pile face-down. Play continues like this. If you run out of cards, you are out of the game. The last player still with cards, wins.

Card game for children totally devoid of skill.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Altijd 10
description:
The goal of the game is to be first to score ten points. On your turn, you throw two helmet figures, and depending on their resulting positions you score points.

A promotional game for Gauloises Blondes, and a variant of Pass the Pigs.

name: Lach niet te vroeg
description: A Pachisi variant with a small board: there are only 5 squares between the player's home spaces, and three pawns per player. Players roll dice to move their pawns, and race to be the first to make it from start to home.

name: Trans-Aktie Spel
description:
A trading game, where the players buy and sell houses and bungalows.

Each round, a random number of houses and bungalows is auctioned amongst the players in a Dutch auction. The players then select their selling price, and a random roll on the market value track determines which properties sell and which don't. Players also have to manage their land blocks to build the property on, which costs money each round. Once someone completes five blocks, the game ends and the player with the most valuable property wins.

name: Port of Rotterdam
description:
The players each control a number of ships, that sail to and from the port of Rotterdam in order to make the highest possible profits.

The players then roll and move on the board track, where they can encounter several events, like insurance, to wage, bunkers etc. Once a player has discharged a predetermined number of ships, the game ends.

name: Gunboat Diplomacy
description:
From the Second Edition Introduction

With the publication of this booklet, the Colonial War Games "Trinity" of The Sword and the Flame, The Sword and the Flame: The Sun Never Sets. and Gunboat Diplomacy is now complete.

From the Introduction

Originally developed by Mr. Bob Duncan in 1991 and demonstrated by him at various conventions around the country, Gunboat Diplomacy is a charming combination of wargame simplicity and, atmosphere, and utility. Mr. Duncan generously provided his game gratis to players while happily engaged in building his own model gunboats and conducting games we can only envy--or emulate.

The original rules were designed for battles between 25mm gunboats, mostly scratchbuilt. Specific rules for determining the full game details such as crew size, turning capacities, speed, when to make "Special Hit" checks, etc., have been added to the original rules.

Gunboat Diplomacy is a game played with ship models, either commercially produced or scratchbuilt by the players themselves. The game has been specifically designed to link with The Sword and the Flame: The Sun Never Sets and/or The Sword and the Flame. However, this is a "stand alone" wargame system requiring only the rules and components included or described in order to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame
publishers: (Web published), And That's The Way It Was...

name: Pony Club
description:
Children's game nicerly put together in Three-dimensions.

The game is in three stages.
Stage 1, you must learn how to look after your horse and collect things like a feeding trough and learn about things such as keeping your horse clean.
Stage 2, you need to train your horse. Learn how to start with a trot and then proceed to a gallop. Also learn how to jump (very important skill in this game because if you can't jump, you have no way of winning).
Stage 3, you participate in a race really, travelling around the outer track on the board and jumping all the obstacles in your way (a ditch or a gate, for example.

All three stages are resolved by dice rolls and earning what you require if you land on the right space.

The winner is the first one home from the 'race'. That player gets a rosette to place on their horse, of course.

name: ComPYL: The No Luck Press Your Luck Game.
description:
ComPYL is short for "Combinatorial Press Your Luck". It is a game that involves perfect information and involves no luck. In the game, players have a number of identical cards they use to advance their piece around a board, to spaces with objectives the need to meet. Players will take their cards, which are known to all players, and go around selecting a card from these cards to form their hand. Play continues until all players have created their hand. Then, players will play out the cards they selected for their hand. If a players plays all their cards from their hand, they then advance their score piece on the scoring part of the board a number of spaces that corresponds to the number of cards in their hand (the larger their hand, the further they advance).

Object of the game is reach target score/area at the end of the scoring track.

name: Dark Potential
description:
From the webpage

Dark Potential is a 28mm miniature wargame based in the post-apocalyptic near future of Earth.

Build up your chosen faction of miniatures ... and prepare to immerse yourself in a highly tactical skirmish-level wargame.

Will you fight for humanity's survival? Or will you side with the X'Lanthos menace? Or perhaps you don't really care for either, and will fight for the twisted Bioformed or the enigmatic Reclaimers?

Now you can decide the fate of the earth, and perhaps even humankind.

The games Indiegogo page related " is Dark Potential?

In short, it is a miniature wargame set in the near post-apocalyptic future of earth, roughly in the 2500s.

Humanity had managed to spread out to several other colonies in other systems, but then met with a hostile alien race that attempted to drive them back. This led to a war that annihilated both sides.

As most of humanity's population was still on Earth, the alien species (called the X'Lanthos) launched a virus meant to destroy all human life. Unfortunately for them it was only 99.99% effective, and left many survivors.

Those on earth revert to a basic survival mode, and nature starts reclaiming what was once hers."

The game is scheduled for release soon.

name: Mr T Card Game
description:
Children's game featuring their favourite A-Team member, B A Baracus, played by Mr T.

Each player has a hand of five cards and draws a card each turn (from the face down deck or the face up discard pile. The object is to get five cards that feature Mr T, 3 different team cards and a criminal. If this is achieved, that criminal is captured and removed from the game and a new round starts.

When all the eight criminal cards are captured, the game ends. The player who caught the most, wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Road Safety Game With New Road Signs
description:
The Road Signs in Britain were changed in 1949 as a first step to achieving a common design throughout Europe. This game was educational in that it taught old and young more information about the signs' meanings.

The Board is two intertwined tracks. Players start at the beginning of either track and roll dice to advance their playing piece. The spaces are mainly new road signs and they have an effect if you land on them. Each player is given a player reference card so that they can read the instructions for themselves.There are also diversions and instructions when to draw an Accident Card (which also must be obeyed).

The first player to get to the end of their track, wins.

name: Tiddleywinks Villa
description:
Game published in The Novelty Box, circa 1935.

Children's game that you had to make before you could play. Detailed instructions tell you how you make the Villa from an old shoe box.

The difference with this Tiddleywinks game is that there are six different scoring 'holes' in the villa. Positive scores are 5, 10, 15, 20, 50 and there is one negative score of -5. The hole for the negative square is twice as large as the positive holes.

In addition, you must make a chimney out of an old wine cork. This sits on top of the roof of course and if you can knock it off the roof, you score 100 points.

I guess Mum would set a winning score total and the first to get to that total, wins.

name: Small Battle On The Roof
description:
“Small Battle on the Roof” is a board game designed for two players.

Players command their own cat fighters to eat up their opponent’s food. The game board shows a roof of some warehouse. The roof tiles may be shattered when cats move.

Each player may take maximum 2 actions in his/her turn. Players take a turn alternately. During his/her turn, the player’s option is basically movement, but a turn player can use a special power called “Cat Special.”

The game was issued as a “demonstration version” at Essen 2012. The board consists of an A4 card (board and cut-out counters), with rules available from the publisher's website in English and German.

Takamasa Suzuki is credited in the rules as Designer and Koushi Kondou as Developer.

English rules downloadable from the publisher here
German rules downloadable from the publisher here

name: UNO: Chicaco Cubs
description:
Chicago Cubs Special Edition
112 Custom cards feature Derrek Lee, Aramis Ramirez, Carlos Zambrano, Michael Barrett, Jacques Jones and other Cubs stars.
Same great UNO play PLUS exclusive Acquisition card and rule.

name: Qwikscore Baseball
description:
Statistical baseball game. Features around 400 team statistics spread over 1976 - 1991.

Choose your teams and then roll dice to reference the result on charts. Normal baseball scoring and the team who hits the most runs, wins.

name: Surf 'n Tour
description: The object of the game is to circle the board until you have landed on all 12 of the Surf Spots. By landing on other squares you either collect or pay money depending on the instructions. There are also Trivia Challenge squares that tests your knowledge of surfing. The winner is the first player to land on all 12 Surf Spots.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Clifford the Big Red Dog: Be A Good Friend Game
description:
Be a Good Friend brings the endearing tales of Clifford and friends to life! Children use the colorful canine characters to trot around the board, and whirl the Clifford & Emily Elizabeth spinner to see where they will sit and stay next! Draw a card to see if you’ll be helping out a friend by scoring them a bone, or if you’ll be giving one of yours back to Clifford. Children will love the bone-collecting adventure, trying to collect the most to be top dog!

The goal of the game is to collect bones. When it's a players turn, he spins the wheel, and moves his pawn to the next space of the color spun. If it is his own color, he also collects a bone.
When the spinner points to a picture of Clifford, the player takes a clifford card. This card can either show one of the players or Clifford. If it shows one of the other players, that player gets a bone, and the player whose turn it is gets one as well. If the card shows Clifford, the player has to return one bone to the bank.

The game ends when there are no more bones left in the bank; the player with the most bones wins the game.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Air Challenge
description:
“Air Challenge” is a board game that lets players experience the thrill of runway operations and the challenges they pose, bringing the excitement of this world-famous airport into their living room! To win the game, players need to manage their cards to arrange aircraft takeoffs and landings on the two airport runways and collect stars as fast as possible. The first player to obtain 10 stars or points WINS!

Game Setup:
-Each player takes two Aircraft of the same color.
-Shuffle the Action Card deck and deal each player 5 cards.
-The rest of the Action Cards are placed face-down in the section of the board marked “Action Card (Draw)”
-Shuffle the Aircraft Cards with the Scenario Cards. Place the deck face-down in the section of the board marked “Aircraft Card (Draw)”.

Game Play:
-The order of play is to be determined by the players.
-At the start of each player’s turn, the player should make sure that each of the three Aircraft Card spaces, both North and South, has an Aircraft Card as shown here. If any of these spaces are empty, the player should draw cards from the Aircraft Card (Draw) pile to fill them. After the player finishes his turn, the next player should again replace the Aircraft Card spaces from the Aircraft Card (Draw) pile if necessary.
-If a Scenario Card is turned up before the game starts, no action is needed, and the drawn Scenario Card should be inserted back at the bottom of the Aircraft Card (Draw) pile. In subsequent turns, the instruction on the Scenario Card must be executed prior to any other action by any player.
--A player can take a maximum of three actions on each turn; in other words, he or she can play a maximum of three Action Cards. All played Action Cards are discarded at the area marked “Action Card (Discard)”.

Action Descriptions:
-Take off from the Runway, Play a “Takeoff Permit” Action Card, or “Landing Permit” Action Card.
-Select a face-up Aircraft Card from the “Aircraft Card space.
-Place an Aircraft on the selected Aircraft Card and place the set at the first space of the Runway.
-A player uses “Arrow” Action Cards to move the Aircraft on the runways by matching the number of stars on the Aircraft Card. For example:
-1-Star Aircraft: Requires one “1 Arrow” Action Card to move the Aircraft one space forward.
-2-Star Aircraft:Requires one “2 Arrows” Action Card OR two “1 Arrow” Action Cards to move the Aircraft one space forward
-3-Star Aircraft: Requires one “3 Arrows” Action Card, OR one “2 Arrows” Action Card plus one “1 Arrow” Action Card, OR three “1 Arrow” Action Cards to move the Aircraft one space forward.
-So, the higher the number of stars an Aircraft Card has, the more difficult it is to move because it requires more arrows on the Action Cards. Using more “Arrow” Action Cards than what is required is acceptable for moving the Aircraft, but the player will not receive the difference back. For example, a player can use a “3 Arrows” Action Card to move a 1-Star Aircraft one space. However, the other two arrows will be forfeited.

-When a player has moved the Aircraft to the third space on the South Runway AND then uses one or more “Arrow” Action Cards that allow the Aircraft to move one more space forward, the takeoff process is complete. The player may keep the Aircraft Card and get a score according to the number of stars shown on the card. The first player to obtain 10 stars wins.

-An Aircraft that has not completed the takeoff process in one turn will remain in its final position on the runway until the player’s next turn. Aircraft idling on the runways are subject to other player’s actions, including “Diversions” and instructions shown on drawn Scenario Cards.

Diversion:
-When a player wants to take off, land or move an Aircraft on the runway but is obstructed by another player’s Aircraft, he may use a “Diversion” Action Card to divert it.
-When a player uses a “Diversion” Action Card to remove another player’s Aircraft, the player being diverted can use an “Emergency Takeoff / Landing” Action Card to stop the diversion. Without the emergency card, the affected Aircraft Card will be removed tothe “Diverted Flights” area.
-When 10 Aircraft Cards have been removed to “Diverted Flights”, the game ends in a draw.

Other Important Points :
-A player cannot keep more than 10 Action Cards at any time; otherwise, he or she needs to discard the extra cards in the “Action Card (Discard)” area.
-When no more Action Cards remain, shuffle the cards from the “Action Card (Discard)” area and place the shuffled deck face-down at the “Action Card (Draw)” area.

name: Frischer's Fitz
description:
This is described as a fun tongue-twister game.

The nicely illustrated cards are shuffled and placed face down on the table.

The first player picks the top card from the pile, notes the text, place the card face down in front of him and speaks the tongue-twisting sentence aloud. If he is deemed to be correct, without pause or error, he gets to keep the card. But if he has made ‚Äã‚Äãa mistake or speaks too slowly, he has to pass the card to his left neighbour, who makes the same attempt.

If none of the players could recite the phrase correctly, the card is placed under the deck.

Winner is the player with the most cards after the deck has been exhausted.

name: Mein Mann kann
description:
The board game based on the German TVshow with relationship tests.

In the game it is important that the women know their husband well. They compete with other female teammates and put chips for different bets, eg Snacks eating contest or funny dance routines etc. If a bet is successful, the woman receives all applications and thus comes closer to the victory.

The women have to keep a cool head and play good bets. Essential is a good knowledge of the strengths of the man who in turn must show full commitment in the betting order to seal victory. "My husband can" is an ideal party game and suitable for couples or those who want to be there.

Couple with the most points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Vakantielandenspel: Frankrijk
description:
Name translates to 'Highlights of the Game: France', part of a series of such games with different countries being the subject.

This is a game where you can show off your knowledge of France by answering questions on History, Art, Culture, Sport and Food.By answering questions correctly, and with a little luck, you will collect souvenirs of the country.

The game consists of 48 question cards, 30 souvenir cards, one round ard, 1 rules card and 1 pamphlet with informative background information about your holiday destination.

On each card there are questions in 5 categories and each is designated with its own icon and colour. The five categories in full are;
Eten en Drinken (Green) - Eating and Drinking
Geschiedenis (Yellow) - History
Sport, Spel en Vakantie (Orange) - Sport, Games and Holidays
Kunst en Cultuur (Red) - Art and Culture
Stad en Land (Blue) - Cities and Countries

On each card the category questions are in a different order. On the back of each card are the answers. You play in rounds. The Round Card is placed on the bottom of the deck. You start with the first question on the card you have just drawn. If the Round Card is on the top of the deck, you put it back on the bottom and then ask the second question, and so on until 6 rounds have been played. On the question cards there are also commands, recognizable because the icon box is blank. These commands are on the lines of "Change a Souvenir to a different colour, Lose a souvenir, and so on.

The Question reader is the player to the left of the player whose turn it is. If the question is answered correctly, the player receives a souvenir in the same category of the question. If the player answers incorrectly then that player must lose a souvenir (if he has one) in that category. The question card is then placed on the bottom of the stack and the turn passes to the next player in a clockwise direction.

Maximum number Souvenirs
The number of souvenirs that a player may have in a category is a a maximum of '2 players - 3', '3 or 4 players - 2'.. If a player gets a question in the category of which he already has reached the maximum, then he can choose a souvenir of any other category if he answers correctly. At the end of your turn you can exchange any 2 matching souvenir cards for one in any other category.

The winner is the first player to get souvenirs in all 5 categories

name: The Black Pirate's Treasure
description:
Real-time race game published in More Games, Puzzles and Pastimes, published by Odhams Press in 1959.

Rules:
Long ago the Black Pirate buried his ill-gotten gold on Dead Man’s Island where it has lain ever since. You yourself can reach it if you follow the trail taken by the pirate. Any number of persons up to four can take part in the hunt. Start off together, each using an unsharpened pencil (which will not mark the book) and follow the track. The route divides at many points and if you choose the wrong path you must return to the junction and try again. The chances are the same for all, so see if you can be the first to reach the Treasure!
categories: Children's Game, Pirates, Puzzle, Racing, Real-time

name: Motor Cycle Racing on a Parkland Circuit
description:
Game that was in More Games, Puzzles and Pastimes, published by Odhams Press in 1959.

A simple Goose type game. The track features 71 spaces and 23 are 'special', i.e. when landing on one you must obey the instructions. The first player to reach the finish line, wins.

name: Dinosaur Whirl
description: Go on a hunt for special dinosaur eggs! Land on an egg space and you can collect one from Dino Rock. If you roll the dinosaur give him a spin to see what happens. Uh oh- any players knocked off go back to start and leave their eggs behind. The player who has the most eggs at the end of the game wins.

name: De 4 seizoenen
description:
The 4 seasons (Homebase) is a memory game with all illustrations in the theme of the various seasons.

The players try to get rid of their stack of cards as quickly as possible by searching matching cards. When the upturned card matches the card that the player is, those two cards from the game and a new map of the player's pile reversed.

This game lets you play at different levels: easier for young toddlers and harder for older or more experienced players.
This game exercises: the concept of 'seasons' and the specific characteristics of each season. This game trains the memorizing and recognizing identical images.

name: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Mini-Spiel
description:
In Die Siedler von Catan: Das Mini-Spiel, players try to be the dominant force on the island of Catan by building settlements, cities, and roads. On each turn dice are rolled to determine what resources the island produces. Players collect these resources to build up their civilizations to get to 7 victory points and win the game.

Probably a promotional giveaway similar to the Keltis Mini-Spiel (same box size). Basically it's a stripped down 3 player-only version of the "Travel" edition. There are no development cards, no "longest road" or "most knights" bonus points; resource hexes, resource die roll numbers and player starting positions are pre-determined. Otherwise mostly standard Catan rules apply, first player to reach 7 VP wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Moony's Seaside Game
description:
Moony decided to go to the seaside for the day. Here is a jolly seaside game for you to play with your friends. You need counters - small buttons will do - and a dice. At some of the spaces there are things that happen to Moony on the way to the seaside. Remember, he can change into anything just by thinking about it! You have to do what the words in those spaces tell you. The first player to get to the seaside, is the winner.

Published in the Playhour Annual, 1976

name: Top of the Form
description:
Quiz game loosely based on a TV show that featured teams of schoolchildren. Actually, the name and the picture on the box were the only TV show link.

One player doesn't play at all, he or she is in charge of asking the questions. As a player or team get right answers, they advance up the board. First to reach the top, wins.

Game has 1,000 questions. In those pre-Trivial Pursuit days, all quiz games (in my shop, at least) were terrible sellers. I actively tried not to stock them.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Goodnight Moon 123 Counting Games
description:
Goodnight Moon 123 is a numbers game for children based on the Goodnight Moon book by Margaret Wise Brown with illustrations by Clement Hurd. The rules offer seven variations of play for children at different levels of skill and experience. Ultimately, this is a matching and identification game. Each number has a written number tile, with some text, and a sister tile with a number of illustrations that match its number.

According to the publisher, this game encourages listening, matching, and beginning number and reading skills.

Contents: 12 sturdy, interlocking matching tile pairs, rules for play, and notes for caregivers about games and skills

Reading is not required to play.

name: Malifaux: Lilith Avatar of Nature's Malevolence
description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

Lilith's Avatar is unique in that she interacts very heavily with terrain, and can make significant changes to woods terrain and the board as a whole. She creates and spreads woods terrain, and then makes that woods terrain very scary for her enemies. She retains most of the abilities of her pre-Avatar form, though many become more woods-dependent. Lilith also gains some very useful long-range attacks and damage effects, which can assist in pushing opponents around and controlling board position.

In Avatar Form, Lilith suddenly needs to worry about two things that didn't matter as much before, woods terrain and Blood Tokens.

Woods Terrain: An overwhelming portion of Lilith's Actions, Spells, and Attacks work only in woods terrain, or work much better in woods terrain. Lilith wants to stay near the woods, and to keep her enemies near the woods too. Place your initial woods terrain carefully, keeping near any objective locations and any likely spots for enemies to congregate. Be sure your Illusionary Forest is in a good place, too, before you Manifest Lilith's Avatar. You can spread woods further from these existing locations, using Lilith's Sanguine Proliferation spell. This requires a 9 card or better, and suits don't matter, so you should plan to have a card in hand for it in case your flip isn't enough. This growth can seem very slow, however, since you can only expand by 3" for every action, so it's usually best to do this only if you're setting up an immediate attack on an opponent who's not quite in reach of the forest on Lilith's turn. Note also that Sanguine Proliferation costs a Blood Token, which can be in short supply.

Gaining Blood Tokens: If you're fighting against living or Undead opponents, Lilith can usually gain a Blood Token every time something dies: anyone killed by her Nature's Revenge spell, or killed within 8" of her and in base contact with a woods terrain, generates a Blood Token. Note that you also generate Blood Tokens when your own models are killed within 8" of Lilith if they're in base contact with a woods terrain. Lilith's most likely crews (Nephilim and Waldgeists) are all considered living, so this may provide some benefit or at least consolation. She can also gain a Blood Token when she kills a living or Undead unit by using Drain Blood, but this is a (0) Action so she can only use it once per round. Note, though, that if your enemy has a lot of Constructs, Nightmares, Objects, Spirits, or Soulless models, these won't give you any Blood Tokens so it may not be worth Manifesting.

Spending Blood Tokens: While pre-Manifest Lilith only really keeps her Blood Tokens to feed her young or try to meet a scheme for VP, in Avatar form she has tremendous need of Blood Tokens. Avatar Lilith uses Blood Tokens to use her Erupting Underbrush mass melee attack, to expand the woods with her Sanguine Proliferation spell (though she can use Blood Tokens from nearby minions within 6" instead for this), and to attack units with her Nature's Revenge spell (though this may also give her Blood Tokens back, possibly generating a profit if she kills a lot of wounded minions). On top of this, she can also use Blood Tokens to grow and mature her Nephilim. The demand and uses of Blood Tokens are quite high for Lilith, so take some care in choosing the right way to spend a Token. A good general rule is: if it's going to kill at least one enemy model, it's worth spending a Blood Token, especially if that model is living or Undead. Otherwise, the Blood Token is probably better spent growing a Terror Tot.

Card Flow Control: Avatar Lilith retains her Rush of Magic Ability and Bloody Fate trigger, so you will often pull a card and discard it during play. This doesn't give you more control cards, but it can be a helpful way of raising the average value of your cards and helping you find the Mask (or occasionally Crows) cards you need. Remember to use these card flow effects, since they will help refine your hand.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: Catcher Quartett
description:
This card game is a traditional Quartett game using the picture cards but it also has a second game that uses the backs of the cards. This game is called Catcher Quartett and is only for two players.

Each card has a wrestling move on it.The four moves are Press, Pin, Drop Kick and Body Slam.

Each player is dealt half the deck. Both players choose a card secretly and then both cards are revealed simultaneously. If they are not the same, the following applies:

PRESS beats PIN
PIN beats BODY SLAM and DROP KICK
DROP KICK beats PRESS
BODY SLAM beats DROP KICK and PRESS

The strongest card takes the weaker card. Play continues until all the cards are used and the player with the most cards wins. If you want a longer game you can continue until one player has won all the cards.

name: Knipperlicht
description:
Spin the unpredictable wheel and follow the instructions. You must solve a question to the card you want to get or else the wheel decides your fate? Collect as soon as possible the entire family of one of the 7 vehicles and defeat your opponents. Who will win this game traffic?

It is a family game about road safety and traffic rules. It was read by the cell education of the Belgian Institute for Road Safety.

The game:
-promotes the knowledge of the highway
-allows young and old to think about road safety

name: Doppelwort Kids
description:
Educational game for young children.

It suggests that an older sibling or relative reads out the cards.

A double word is one that consists ot two separate words making up one word. Clues, riddles really, are on each card. This is read out. The first player to call out the double word, wins a counter and the first to win 5 counters wins the game.

Example of a double word
One word = Salad
Other word = Öl
Together they make Salatöl (a dressing for salads).
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Pop Goes Froggio
description: In Pop Goes Froggio a friend of the frog is selected by spinning a butterfly unit. After this all players at once try to find this friend by flipping over lily pads which are scattered around the room. The player who succeeds may launch the frog off his lily pad and try to catch it.

name: Minden Professional Volleyball
description:
This designer has always been a little quirky (he is a friend so he won't mind me saying it) and he deveoped his various skills at making a statistical game that was unusual, this game.

As usual with these games, there are numerous charts and tables enabling you to replay Pro Volleyball matches. I believe the pro league did really exist, in Canada.

name: Minden Replay Baseball
description:
The designer is most noted for his statistical games that create games for sports not usually depicted in such games. Britain hardly ever developed stats games up to 1980 or so, and Gary filled the gap in the market by making games for Cricket and Soccer. However he must have felt that he had to make at least one American staple and so he published this.

As usual with statistical games, all you need are two dice and all the charts and tables provided within the game. Thus you can try to replay a whole season (if you fancy playing over 1,000 games!)

name: Wally Woo and Dasher Diesel Have a Race!
description:
Children's game that appeared in the Robin Annual.

Join in the race with counters and a dice! Start either on blue Wally Woo the wooden train, or red Dasher Diesel. The number you throw with the dice is the number of "squares" you move forward. If you land on a Blue, have another turn — if you land on a Red, miss one turn. You can go either way in the middle, to avoid a crash! The first person to reach the other end of the track, wins!

name: Good Ol' Boys
description:
Statistical sports game featuring stock car racing.

As usual with these games, dice are rolled and the result cross-referenced against charts and/or tables.

name: Table Basket Ball
description:
Rare subject for a game in Britain, where Basketball has never reached a popularity seen in America.

Players assemble the plastic basket, which stands 12 inches tall. Then players take turns to catapult the ball with the intention of scoring baskets. First to score a pre-agreed number wins.

name: The Underground Game & What's the Letter?
description:
A box of two party games together.

The Underground Game:
Any number of players above 2 can play although 4 to 12 players provides the greatest fun. It is ideal for all ages from 11 years upwards and will be of particular appeal to those who enjoy crossword puzzles.
Each player is handed a card on which there are 32 clues to the names of stations on the London Underground. A time limit should be set in which the players must find as many answers as possible. When the time limit has expired, players may take turns to call out their answers which the M.C. will confirm if correct. Players score 1 point for each correct station.
For those not familiar with the London Underground, maps are supplied. These should be passed round to give each player an equal chance to use one.

What's the Letter?
Each player is handed a card and must answer the questions using one or two letters from the alphabet as applicable. The M.C. should announce a time limit of say 5 minutes for this game. Players are given one point for each correct answer with extra points if they have more than one acceptable answer to a question.
categories: Party Game, Trains, Trivia, Word Game

name: Lucky Dip Quiz
description:
A standard party quiz game really but an added feature is how time is used up. All 84 question slips are laid face down on the table and shuffled around. A time for the quiz to last is set by the host, say 20 minutes for example.

At the word "Go!", each team captain comes to the table at the same time and each selects a question slip. This is then taken back to his team, who may consider what the right answer may be. When ready, the team captain goes back to the table and hands their answer to the host. If it is right, the captain takes another slip and returns to his team. Note this is done in real time, there are no turns as such. If the answer is wrong, the captain must wait half a minute before being allowed to take a new question to his team.

When the time is up, the team with the most correct answers wins.

A variation is provided for individuals to play but it is pretty tame, just being a regular quiz game.

name: The Game of Football
description:
Game in The New Book of Games, circa 1950.

The player who wins the toss begins the game, by placing the “Ball” on the circle of his colour in the centre of the field. He then throws the dice and moves the ball along the line opposite the number thrown. The same player continues to throw until the ball is lost to an opponent by being kicked on to a circle of the opposing colour.
When the ball is kicked out of play it is placed on the goal-keeper’s circle, and he takes the resultant goal kick.
After a goal has been scored, the ball is kicked off by the side which has lost the goal, and the game restarted as in rule 1.
A fixed time for playing should be settled before the game begins, and it is won by the side which scores the largest number of goals within that time.

name: The Air Race Game
description:
Game found in the New Book of Games, circa 1950.

Two, three or four players can take part. If only two or three are playing, they will select their startin points as they like from the four provided and noted in the left hand bottom corner of the board; if four are playing, all four will be used.

Each player plays from his starting point in the direction of Melbourne along the route indicated by the colour noted in the left-hand bottom corner of the board; thus, a player starting from London travels along the white line via St.John’s, Quito, Buenos Ayres (Note: this is not an error, this is how it is spelt in the rules), Cape Town, Lisbon, Cairo, Calcutta and Borneo, to Melbourne, which is the end point of the race for all players.

The first player to throw a six begins the race, moving along his route as many bars as he had thrown points. If a throw takes him to an obstacle, he must move back, miss a number of throws, or wait for his next move till a six is thrown, according to the directions on the board in each case. If a lucky throw lands him on to “Following Winds”, he moves forward as indicated.

The first player to reach Melbourne is the winner.

name: Happy Families Thrive on Cadburys Bournville Cocoa
description:
Cadbury advert/game from The Champion Annual for Boys in 1950. At this time, Cadbury often used the back of children's annuals to advertise and they nearly always liked to make it a game as well.

HOW TO PLAY: All you need to play this game is a dice, together with a dice cup (an egg-cup will do) and some coloured counters or buttons, one for each player. The game can be played by any number of players, and the first player to reach 80 and get into ‘bed’ is the winner. Don't forget that you must obey any instructions that you land on. With your last throw you must get the exact number to reach 80: if you throw too high a number you must wait for another turn.

Cadburys, the makers of Bournville Cocoa, hope you will have a lot of fun with this game, and that Mummy will always give you plenty of lovely chocolatey Bournville Cocoa to help you to grow up healthy and strong.

name: CityProGame Kassel
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Kassel each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Educational, Travel

name: Progress?
description:
"In this game you pit your wits against chance, disease, moneylenders and an unjust world. Even survival is a success, but which of you will make most PROGRESS up the social ladder."

Each player takes the part of one family, consisting of 3 characters. Each family starts out as a labouring family, but by hard work, saving and a lot of luck, may afford to get one member of their family a better job. By advancing each member of the family, the players try to progress to the top of the social ladder.

A family game for 2-6 players, produced by Traidcraft, a UK charitable organisation.

name: The Football League 1888/1889
description:
Statistical sport game. Amazing theme taken, a very early British Football League season - and he is Swedish!

As usual with these games, dice are thrown and cross-checked on various charts and tables. You can easily play the whole season in an evening (there were only 11 teams in those days).

name: Match Point
description:
Statistical Sport game by a Swedish designer. Fast replay tennis matches, so you can play a tournament such as Wimbledon in short time (not every round obviously but certainly from the quarter-final matches onwards.

Roll dice and cross-check result against various charts and tables to get a result of a match

name: Orbitalis
description:
A Game of Valence

The object of the game is to create the most particles. Players take turns dropping a proton on an empty cell. When a proton is dropped, the surrounding cells are examined in order to determine if an electron is to be created there or not. An electron is created in a surrounding cell if there is a majority of one color's protons surrounding that cell. In that case, the newly created electron takes on that color and orbits the surrounding protons. If the number of surrounding protons of either color is the same, then an electron is not created in that cell, or if the cell already contains an electron, that electron vanishes.

The score indicators display the total number of particles owned by each player. The game ends when no remaining proton placements are available. The player with the most particles wins. Ties are not possible.

name: Uno: Pinkalicious
description:
Similar to Uno with a special card for this edition: Pinkititis - if you come down with a case of Pinkititis, there's only one way to cure it: discard it and cover it up with all the green cards in your hand! You may choose the next color to resume play. If you do not have any green cards, use the card as a wild and select the next color to resume play. The point value of the Pinkititis card is 50 points

Game comes in a standard cardboard box and a collector's tin

name: Malle Getallen: Optellen en aftrekken
description:
Malle Getallen (Crazy Numbers) is a Quartett with math exercises. The game is played with deck of cards, which is divided into sets of four cards, each with its own symbol. On each card, there is a math exercise (add or substract from 0 to 20).

Each player starts the game with six cards. On his turn, a player may ask another player for a card with a specific symbol. If that player has that card, he reads the exercise out load. If the asking player gives the correct answer, he gains the card, and gets to go again. If he does not give the correct answer, or if the other player does not have the card that was asked for, the asking player gains the card from the deck, and his turn ends.

When a player has collected a complete set of four cards, he sets them aside and gains one point. The game ends when all sets have been set aside; the player with the most points wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: High School Musical 3 Prom Night Game
description:
Card game that uses similar mechanics to Uno and Whot but adds a slight twist with the Action Card choice.

The cards feature three areas, one of which must be matched to be able to play a card. The choices are numbers, suits or Action symbols. The cards have numbers and suits because you could use the deck to play traditional card games. If you cannot play a legal card, then you draw another card from the deck.

The Action Symbols allow the player to make a special action. Most of them you get to choose who is affected rather than the traditional way of the effect being forced on the next player to your left.

The game ends when one player has used all his cards, of course after he/she has remembered to shout out "High School Musical" when they are down to just one card.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pog Word Builder Game
description:
Pogs are small cardboard disks with a variety of designs on them; they were popular in the early 90's. In the original game of Pogs, players would gamble Pogs from their own collection in an attempt to expand their collection further. Players would stack Pogs face down in a stack and throw a 'Kini' (a hard plastic disk, sometimes referred to as a 'Slammer') from above in an attempt to turn the Pogs over and claim them for their collection.

Pog word builder combines the classic action of Pog with the challenging gameplay of Scrabble. Use 1 letter and 2 letter Pogs to build the biggest words possible. Pog's are obtained in the same way as the original game, by by trying to turn over a stack of Pogs containing unknown letters. The player who builds the most words wins.

As the emphasis of Pog word builder is on the number of words, rather than the length or the quality of words, the game is easily accessible to young players.

name: Rupert's "Write a Letter" Game
description:
A children's game from the Rupert Fun book, in 1988.

A parent should first write some short messages, each on a separate piece of paper and give one to each player. It is important that each message should be different and yet have the same number of letters in it, say fifteen.

The idea of the game is to see which player can first cross out all the letters of his message. To do this the players take turns to shut their eyes and put the point of a pencil on the checkered squares of the game. If the pencil lands on a picture, the player must say what the object is. For example, “D” for Dog. If “D” appears on the player’s paper it can be crossed off the message. Sometimes a player will be lucky enough to land on one of the squares which contain an alphabet letter (that too can be crossed off). Should the pencil land on a blank square, the player ends his turn. The games goes on in this way until one player has all the letters of his message crossed out.

Here are some examples of ready¬made 15-letter messages which the parent can use to start the game.
PLEASE COME TO TEA.
DO YOU LIKE MY TOYS?
MEET YOU TOMORROW.
I HAVE SOME SWEETS.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Educational, Word Game

name: Veto: The Boardgame
description: Based on the best-selling Veto (second edition) CCG – the first and only Polish collectible card game – Veto: The Boardgame is set in the 17th century, the time of noblemen, winged hussars, court intrigues, and elections of the king. In this political game, which also includes voting mechanisms and resource management, players are trying to place their candidate on the Polish throne.

name: Chaos: Path Maker
description:
Introduction: You are trying to construct a path, while fighting chaos, by constantly flipping and
placing cards. Play your hand carefully, or you will lose, and chaos will destroy.

Setup: Shuffle the nine cards, and draw 3 of them.

Play: On your turn, roll 1d6 twice, and flip those numbered cards. Next, place 1 card from your
hand, or play a card to use its power. If you place a card, you must connect it to an already played
card that has a matching symbol. If you play it for its power, discard it. It becomes a chaos card.
You must do at least one action on your turn. After your turn, refresh your hand up to three cards.
Drawing Cards: When you draw cards, you use the side that is face down.

Chaos Cards: If you discard a card, it becomes a chaos card. Every turn, any card with a number
one higher than its flips over.

Winning: You win if you place at least four cards that are all connected. This means they each
attach to another by matching symbols. You lose if you don't.

name: Sicher auf dem Fahrrad
description:
Children's game intended to teach road safety, particularly for young cyclists.

The board reflects a ride through town and ends where you started from. A dice is used for movement but has some choices if you are lucky. If you roll an arrow, you can advance up to 4 spaces. If you roll a card, you draw a card and another player asks you the question. If you are correct, you can move up to 6 spaces. If you roll the pedestrian, you can move him. He is an extra piece on the board and can 'walk' from zebra crossing to zebra crossing. If he is on a crossing when your piece arrives before it, you cannot go over the crossing until the pedestrian has been moved elsewhere.

The first player to arrive home, wins.

One nice touch is that the question cards can be sorted in to four levels of difficulty, so the game can happily be played by various age groups.

name: Ord p√• ord
description:
This letter tile game has been described as a mix between Tetris and Scrabble. 48 tiles are drawn in a random sequence and "dropped" into a slanted 7x7 playing field with the goal of creating as many and as long words as possible, horizontally and vertically. The 49th joker tile is available to be dropped at any time.

After its original release, the game has been implemented several times as computer games and web applications (often but not always titled WOW: Word on Word), with seeded tile sequences to facilitate competitive play.

name: Tolvan
description:
This is a minigame where you take turns to roll three dice and hopefully add up the numbers in ways that allow you to advance your pawn on a track from 1 to 12 and back again. You may keep rolling as long as you manage to advance, but if you then get a useless roll you go back to where you were.

Apparently if you subtract the press-your-luck element you get a traditional game known as Ohio or Martinetti

name: T√ºbinger Stocherkahnrennen
description:
Tübingen is a traditional university town in central Baden-Württemberg, Germany. Once a year during the Feast of Corpus Christi there is a punt boat race (Stocherkahnrennen) in which competitors are mostly students. This is a very important local and touristic event which gathers usually about 10.000 spectators.

This boardgame tells us about this event. Each player controls 3 or 4 punt boats (depending on the number of players). On each turn a player rolls a d6. If he rolls 1-5, he moves certain number of fields forward or diagonal. If he rolls a 6, he must roll an event die (d8). If the result of the event die is 1-6, the player moves accordingly but if the result is 7-8, he looses his turn.

Punt boats can also be sunk. To sink a boat it must be surrounded by opponent's boats. Sunk boats return to the start fields or to the anchor field.

The game ends when all punt boats arrive to the finish line. Each boat recevies points adequate to its position on the finish line. 1 point for 1st place, 2 for 2nd, etc. The winner is the player with the least points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Miniland Adventures!
description:
This is a small(ish) game about traveling across a small island in hopes of killing all the bosses in the castles. You will fight many monsters, and hopefully upgrade.

On your turn, you move, then check for monsters. After that, you move again, but any monsters on the board will move after you. You may fight them, or try to run away.

If you enter a castle, you will have the option of slaying the boss, or maybe something else (like searching for something).

Combat is the simple mechanic used in most FF gamebooks. Roll 1d6. If it is equal to or lower than the stat being tested, you succeed (hit the enemy).

name: Princess Pony Trek
description:
A pre-teens game for girls, published in an annual for Princess Comic fans. A Goose-type game, spin and move, obeying any instructions on the squares you land on. First to 60, wins.

The rules:
First you will need a top with numbers on it which you can make yourself out of a piece of plain postcard and a matchstick (see the picture above), or a dice.
Two or three of you can play this game and you will need a small coloured counter each (or a coloured bead) to represent you on your pony as you trek along. Each of you must throw the dice or spin the top in turn, and go forward the number of squares shown by the top of the dice, or the side of the top that comes to rest on the table.
But when you have reached the proper square you must follow any instructions that are lettered beside it. The winner is the one who gets back home first.

name: Andy Pandy and Teddy are Fast Asleep
description:
Game published in the Andy Pandy's Annual, aimed at pre-school children. One player is red and the other player is blue. The red player travels along the red line and the blue travels along the blue line. Both lines are equidistant from the winning space in the middle of the board.

Moves are determined by the throw of a die. When the blue player lands on a yellow square, he goes forward two spaces. When the red player lands on a green square, he goes forward two spaces. If either player lands on a grey square, that player has to go back three spaces.

The first player to reach the centre illustration of Andy Pandy and Teddy having a sleep on a garden bench, wins.

Andy Pandy was created for the BBC television slot that later became Watch With Mother. In 1952, 13 episodes were recorded and these thirteen shows continued to be broadcast for 18 years! In 1970, the BBC made another 13 shows, this time in colour.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Flick Your Chip
description: The board features spaces numbered sequentially from 1 to 100. Each player selects a marker and a chip of a given color and places his or her marker on 50. An initial flick of the chip indicates the direction in which a player will move. Subsequent movement is determined by cards. Players take turns drawing a card, and all players must move according to the dictates of each card. Some cards require you to flick your chip or to invert your chip before you move; other cards give you a choice, such as either moving the distance indicated on the card or taking your chances with a dice roll. The first player to move past either 1 or 100 on the board is the winner.

name: May Day: Dice Game ‚Äì Hey Its Fred!
description:
Spread peace with May Day Baskets. Be the first player to score 99 points. Roll the 10 custom dice and keep any Peace symbols you roll. Then roll the remainder or stop with what you have. But, if you roll a reverse R Rabies Cat symbol and no Peace symbols then your turn ends and you score no points for that turn. Green Splat symbols rolled have no effect good or bad.

Each dice has 3 May Day peace symbols, 2 neutral splat symbols and 1 rabies cat R symbol.

name: What's Your Cosmo?
description:
What's Your Cosmo? is a set of custom playing cards that are used to play a variety of games that range from easy to difficult and from 1 to 6 players. There are seven unique card games using double-sided playing cards, two different wild cards, positive and negative signs, letters, and five title cards.

The object of each game involves making triples, straights, equations, or completions. In addition, the COSMO game system (a set of standard and customizable rules for games that use the What's Your Cosmo playing cards) provides plenty of space for ingenuity to create and design fun, new games.

The COSMO deck is one hundred cards. The dark side of the cards features one of the numbers 1 through six or -1 through -6. Each number appears six times. There also are Sun and Infinity wild cards. The light side features one of the letters C, O, S, or M, with the O appearing twice as often as the other letters.
Instructions are included for seven games, including solitaire and a children's game. Many of the games involve building sequences or sets; others use simple math. Games that use only the light side of the cards tend to be variants on spelling COSMO or finding the letters in COSMO.

name: A pet for Laura
description:
Laura received a pet rabbit (named Fluffy) for her birthday ... Upon opening the rabbit cage for the first time her new pet runs under her bed. The goal of the game is to assist Laura in luring her new friend out from under the bed.

Play begins with the puzzle turned face down on the table and the rabbit counter on the left most picture on the board. Beginning with the youngest player, the die is thrown. If a Carrot appears, the rabbit counter is moved one space towards the right (towards Laura). If a Candy is rolled a jigsaw piece is turned face up. If the Rabbit is rolled a jigsaw piece is turned face down (assuming a face up piece exists). Play then advances to the next youngest player and continues round robin until either all of the jigsaw pieces are face up (unable to help Laura lure Fluffy out from under the bed) or the Fluffy counter advances to far right most space (Laura).

name: txTylz
description: 56- 2 sided, hand stamped wooden tiles depict words, word parts, letters, pictograms, symbols, and/or numbers.Grab as many as you wish but at least 10 and say what ever you can say in an interconnected manner that makes sense within 2 minutes while other players hover to gain points off your demise.Players use their tiles to form interconnected sentences, words, slogans, phrases,names, countries, etc...anything that makes sense and can be explained if challenged. High points win.Players score two points per tile played but subtract points for unused tiles.Bonus Round points are scored at 3 points for and one against for all un-played pieces. Proper spelling, grammar and English are not necessary and Multi and Bi-Lingual use is allowed. Phonetic, symbolic, numeric and literal use for all pieces. Think Caveman,Shakespeare and Einstein trying to communicate.

name: Travellino Kids
description: Players roll the dice and move their characters on the game board. On different fields of action, the children collect cards of each of the continents, learn animals, sights, buildings and various travel opportunities to know. The goal is to have six different continent maps collected by the World Travel. The winner is the one who first returns with six continent cards to its initial continent.

name: Ambiguity
description: Welcome to AMBIGUITY, the head-spinning letter-turning word game. The Goal: Roll the eight letter dice into the tray and turn over the two minute timer. Now the fun begins because the letters on these dice are ambiguous and represent several different letters depending on how you turn your head to view them. Quickly study the "face-up" letters, without moving them, and write down as many words as you can spell, Players earn points for word length. The first player to score 100 points wins. So what are you waiting for? Get ready for some head-spinning fun.

name: Elvis
description:
Elvis - The Game that Allows The Legend To Live On

Using tokens that include a blue suede shoe or a teddy bear, players roll and move around the board, hoping to land on enough spaces (or draw enough record-shaped cards) to earn $25 million - in a combination of cash and gold records (which are valued at $250,000 each). Most cards list an accomplishment ("Variety declares Elvis "The King of Rock and Roll!") or event (Daughter Lisa Marie is born) in Elvis’ life. Many cards let players collect money and/or gold records. Others force them to pay money to the bank. Some send them to specific spaces on the board.

Several of the spaces are named after places where Elvis spent his time (Graceland, Hollywood & Recording Studio). There are also Army and Hawaii boxes, where (if you draw a card and get "drafted" or go on vacation) your token must stay for one or two turns.

One unique feature about the guitar-shaped game board is the "On Tour" row of spaces that make up the guitar’s neck. Most of the ten spaces here are just the names of cities where Elvis toured and don’t offer anything of value. But the ultimate goal is to reach the last space - Las Vegas - by rolling the exact number needed. When a player makes it to Vegas, they immediately collect $500,000. For their next 4 turns, as long as a 1 or 2 is rolled, the player can stay in Vegas for a "Return Engagement," collecting $500,000 each time!

Players get a "grace" period and can take out a loan if they lose all of their cash and are forced by a card to make a payment to the bank. According to the rules, "In the spirit of Elvis’s well-known generosity, no player can be forced out of the game by going broke!"

name: Lane Ludo
description:
This is a race game playable on a Byzantine Chessboard. Players roll a die and move one of their pieces. Players have a different piece in a different lane and attempt to navigate their pieces home. In the dice version, each player has 4 pieces, one of which fits into each lane (4 of the rows), and each piece faces off against a single enemy piece.

The game also includes a diceless variant where how far pieces move is not governed by a die roll, but the position of the piece in relation to other pieces on the board.

name: Wer wei√ü ... 25 bunte Fragen?
description:
Inter-war trivia game.

The box contains 25 tiles, each with a subject on them (e.g. Fluss (River), Dichter (Poet) and so on). There are also 17 circular counters, each with a different letter on them. The idea is to name a subject beginning with a certain letter.

A game master sets the 25 subject tiles face down in front of him, and the 17 letters should be placed in a bag. Now he turns the top tile over. Then he draws out the first letter counter. Now, the players call out possible answers (Example Subject could be Country and the counter might by R. Correct answer could be Romania). Who answers first gets the question tile. The letter tile is however is placed back in the bag so that it might re-occur in the game.

If a tile and counter is not answered by anyone, then the tile is pushed under the stack and will be later revealed to ask that subject again but hopefully with a different initial letter.

Who finally has the most tiles when the tiles run out, is the winner.

name: Sooty's Short Cut Game
description:
Simple Goose-type game. Sooty sets out in his car to get to Sue's house. On the way, he must obey the special square instructions, good or bad.

Recommended for two or more players
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Minions and Heroes
description: Minions and Heroes is a trading card game that's built for 2-4 players. Players will attempt to capture 5 region cards by strategically using the Minion or Hero cards in their hands before their opponents do. The game also offers several different game types and variants as well so you and your friends can use the rules that fit your play style.

name: L.A. Game
description:
Players take turns rolling the die and moving around the board trying to become the most chic person in Los Angeles. All the major attractions are featured on cards players use to collect cash. The player with the most money wins.

From the box: "Be seen in all the right places, wear all the right clothes, have all the right friends, or lose...The ultimate status-seeking, power-tripping, money-spending game, babe."

name: WorldWise Geography Card Game: Americas
description: A simple but effective series of games for learning the exact whereabouts of countries, oceans, and seas around the globe. Each player is dealt ten cards. The top card on the draw pile is flipped over to begin the play. Moving left, the next player has to play a card that borders the card on the top of the play deck. If a player does not have the necessary card, there are some other options. The player can bluff, or other players can call the bluff. Either the bluffer of the questioner will have to draw cards, depending on the card that was played. The player can also play a wild or a super wild card if they have one. Wild cards restart the play deck and super wilds can be designated by the player as any card from the deck – and the next card played would have to border this card. First player out of cards wins

name: Bear in Underwear Backpack Adventure Board Game
description: Bear and his animal friends have found a backpack full of goodies. Players roll a jumbo multi-colored die to travel around the 3-D game board, through the forest and over the bridge, landing on colored spaces directing them to collect their animal’s favorite food, forest item and underwear. If a player lands on a space numbered from 1-3, they reach into the red box backpack to pick out that number of items that might match the items on their animal card. If they're lucky they'll grab one they need, otherwise they share it with the other players. First player to collect all the goodies for their animals wins in this silly game based on the books by Todd H. Doodler. No reading required. Everyone plays on every turn.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Le projet du si√®cle: Jeu sur la construction des ouvrages du Complexe La Grande de la Baie James
description:
[Adapted and translated from the French-language rules]

The development of the energy potential around James Bay is without a doubt the greatest technological adventure in Quebec's history. To transform this vast network of lakes, rivers and forests into an enormous hydro-electricity complex is a great challenge. Le Projet du siècle invits you to think on this challenge and to experience all the steps of constructing a hydro-electricity complex.

Le Projet du siècle spans a diverse territory: camps, dozens of construction sites, giant dams, levees and other building works. For this game, we used actual technical drawings from the LG2 dam, encompassing the power station, the 2.8 km dam and over 30 levees, for a total of 46 million square kilometers of building works. Other illustrations refer to other parts of the La Grande Complexe.

The aim of the game is to be the first to construct a hydro-electricity complex. Each their turn, players will develop their own construction techniques. It is important to read the rules book for each step of the game.

The game has two main phases, each with their own track on the board. First is the Organization phase, where players acquires Exploration, Project, Financing and Worker cards to begin a Construction site. In the Construction phase, players will build dams, levees and their power station. Opportunities to act will be determined by the places on the board a player rolls and moves to.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: K√∂pfchen K√∂pfchen
description:
Contents:
One Board
1 rules sheet
4 letter racks
100 wooden tiles

Word game. Separate the vowels from the consonants. Up to four players draw 3 Vowels and 7 consonants. After everyone has their starting 10 tiles, the remaining tiles are mixed together and left face-down as a draw pile. Words are formed vertically or horizontally but two words going in the same direction cannot be formed if it does not leave a space between the letters of both words. The box illustrates this rather well. If you cannot make a legal play, you draw one tile. If you can now play a word, you do so. If not, draw another tile, and so on. If you cannot make a play after drawing three tiles, your turn ends. The winner is the first player to get rid of all his tiles.

In addition, on the board there are some coloured squares. Should your word cross such a square, you must do the following:

Yellow field: Randomly pick a tile from the right neighbour.
Red box: Give the left neighbour a random tile.
Blue field: Take three tiles from the existing stock.
Green field: You must swap one of your tiles with another player. Both players choose a tile for the swap and the tiles are swapped face-down.

name: Quinquereme
description:
Quinquereme is a light dice game loosely connected to the navies of ancient Rome. Each player has to complete twelve scoring categories in any order, e.g. three of a kind for numbers 1 to 6, four of a kind or a straight of consecutive numbers. Dice may be rolled up to three times per turn. Scoring may vary, dependent on how many throws a player has already used during his/her turn.

Three, four and five of a kind are referred as Triremes, Quadriremes and Quinqueremes. Players unable to assign their result to any of the available score categories have to 'sink' one of their ships (i.e. mark zero points in a category).

After all categories have been filled, points are added and the player with the most points wins.
The game uses standard six-sided dice with roman numerals from I to VI.

name: Nine Holes
description:
Nine Holes is played on a 3x3 square grid in which the spaces have three different colors. Each player has three pieces which start off the board. Players take turns entering the pieces on the board and then (assuming no one has won) moving a piece to an adjacent space (including diagonally).

The object is to get all three of one's pieces into an orthogonal line or on all three spaces of one color.
publishers: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC

name: Pencil Football
description:
Pencil Football is played on a sheet of lined paper. The lines are numbered along one edge, goals are drawn near the ends, and then irregularly-spaced line segments are drawn along the lines to create obstacles.

Kick-offs, extra points, and field goals are accomplished by placing a pencil at a certain point, closing your eyes, lifting the pencil, and attempting to bring it down as close as possible to the goal line (for a kick-off) or in the goal area (for a field goal or extra point).

Regular plays are done by placing the pencil at the spot where the ball is, closing your eyes, and attempting to draw a path towards the goal that avoids obstacles. Each player gets four chances (downs) to advance the ball in this way, then the opponent takes over.

The game can be played solitaire using a provided board.

name: Triple Ha!
description:
Triple Ha! is the game of cardboard credit rating agencies. Introduce yourself in the big circus involving states, rating agency and crisis phenomena!

Each player takes charge of a State and starts with a more or less average (of course, Italy is worse off than Germany to start) notation. The State card is used to record scores.

Each turn, one of the states plays the role of the CRA.

The CRA chooses a Crisis card among the first three on the top of the pile and puts the States to the test:

1) CRA requests States an estimate of a real quantified data. The more a state is mistaken, the lower its rating will fall...

2) CRA suggests a crazy imitation on the subject of the Crisis card. The most convincing State may increase its rating by three grades.

After 9 turns (about 30 minutes), the game ends and the State with the best rating will be declared "Survivor of the Crisis."

"Triple HA!" is both informative and humorous and deliberately shifting between tragedy and comedy, in order to discuss the crisis without over-dramatization. This game will lighten up your evenings even when the CAC 40 is down 1.15%!
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Voting

name: Hoe overleef ik al die vragen? (√©n antwoorden!)
description:
A card game themed around Dutch author Francine Oomen's books.

The title translates as: How will I survive all those questions? (and answers!)

In this card game you and your best friends test how good you know each other by making lists on what the others like best.

Everyone draws a table for herself on a piece of paper with the numbers one to five and the word points at the top of the columns.

One player draws a card and reads it out loud, for example:
What do you think I think is important about friendship?
1. honesty
2. companionship
3. humor
4. trust
5. feeling comfortable

The others write down all five items in the sequence of which they think their friend finds most important. The one that drew the card writes down her top 5.

For every item that's on the right place, the players gain three points

The game goes on until everyone has drawn three cards. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Identity: The Board Game
description:
From the box:

Play the hit NBC tv game show at home.

Match 12 complete strangers with their own identity as you try to collect the most money and win.

Contents: 100 stranger cards, 12 card stands, instructions and solutions booklet, wipe off money board, easel, wipe off pen and guessing pad.

name: Who Kidnapped Father Christmas?
description: A fun matching pairs based board game for 2-6 players aged 6 & up...As you travel around the board you have to match pairs of naughty animals to get points..The person with the most points at the end is the person who kidnapped Father Christmas & gets all the toys ! (ie wins)..But watch out as other players can steal your cards which means you have less points than you thought.

name: Bobo Grabbelboom
description:
Learn to count in a fun way!

Choose a card with sums (for smaller children it is possible to choose a card with only numbers) and lay it in front of you.

Each player grabs a number-card from the Lucky Dip Tree on his turn. Is this number the result of one of your sums? Bingo! Be the first to complete your card and you'll win the game!

But be carefull for those tricky cards. When turning Bobo you'll be able to choose a number card of your opponents, but with some cards you have to give one of your cards to one of your opponents!

name: PairPlay
description:
PairPlay is "a memory game with an educational twist. How well do you know your European countries and their capitals?" (quoted from the publisher blurb)

It is a variant of Memory, containing 108 cards (54 pairs) of European flags. When a pair is found, the player has to name the country and its capital to claim the cards.

name: Monsterkuddkrig
description:
Swedish children's game (literally: monster pillow fight).

Dexterity based game where the object is to throw pillows at the opponent's monsters. The first one to knock down all of the opposing monsters is the winner.

name: The Munsters Picnic Game
description: This is a Roll and Move game. On some spaces, players may lose turns or move back a few space. The first player to move from start to finish wins. Players must spin the exact number needed to win.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Krackades
description:
Krackades is a wild party game where you compete against the clock and each other to Act, Draw, or Sculpt (playdoh included) the most outrageous and irreverent things imaginable!

Players have 60 seconds to Act, Draw or Sculpt a wild phrase. To win teammates must guess 3 cards in each section before the other team.

However, the opposing team doesn't sit idly by -- they can choose to trip up the other team's success by using special cards called Krack Attacks! The first team to correctly guess enough cards wins.
categories: Deduction, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: F√¶rdsels Teori
description:
Everyone is a winner, because by playing this game you broaden the knowledge for traffic rules!

In FÆRDSELS TEORI your purpose is to answer questions correctly and gather the four tokens: Orange, Blue, White and Black.

There are four large fields (one in each corner) where you will get a token for correct answers.

From the center to the corners there are fields divided into Red, Yellow and Green.
If you land on RED your turn is over.
If you land on GREEN you can roll the die again.
If you land on YELLOW you will have to reply a question: Wrong answer will end your turn, a right answer will give you another go.

The winner is the one who got all four tokens AND returned back to Start where (s)he will have to answer correctly on FOUR out of SIX questions.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Liedon kultainen kyp√§r√§
description:
Players are trying to find the golden helmet, which was buried with a mighty man centuries ago in the area of municipality of Lieto. They travel around Lieto and the player who is the first to find the helmet is the winner.

Game play is simple roll and move, the helmet is always in the same location. There are some other locations along the track, where players might get a free roll or lose a turn. About one fourth before the goal it is possible to choose from three different paths.

The game is basically an advertisement of the Lieto.

name: Boar King
description:
Here comes the Boar King! It messes up the crops and attacks other boars and people. To keep peace in the mountain, the brave boar hunters are recruited for the hunt!

Are you ready? Don’t forget to put some glorious tattoo on your face as a token of blessings and braveness!

Deal one player aid card and one hunter marker to each player. The game starts with the youngest player.

In clockwise order, each player rolls the die and everyone acts according to the image shown on the die result. The player who is the last to perform the appropriate action must be painted a brush of tattoo on his face by one of the other players.

The game ends immediately when at least one player’s face has been painted with six brushes of tattoo.

name: Zombie Death Force, Go!
description:
Zombies have arrived and it's up to you to build a team and equip them with weapons to fight off of the hordes of the undead.

Zombie Death Force, Go! is a fast paced, easy to learn game where players attempt to build their attack team and arm them with zombie-crushing weapons.

Players have 2 stacks infront of them in which to play Weapon and Team Member cards. The goal is to collect 5 team members and 5 weapons. There is a 3rd stack where Action cards are played. These help (or hinder) players in the game. Each card has a value and at the beginning of each turn, players add up the value of all cards on the top of each stack and draw that many cards.


No cards are held at the end of the player's turn, play it or loose it!

name: Kreuz und quer durchs Sachsenland
description:
Objective: be the first to reach the target (Dresden) moving by turns - "Roll and Move" game.

Move forward according die roll along the red line; if you end on a blue marked space follow the blue line until you join the red line again.

If you end on a green marked space, follow the green line back to the red line.

Equipment: board, 8 meeples (can be extended), 1 die

Probably published during the 1950's.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Scarf Heroine
description:
Scarf Heroine is a free, family-friendly wargame with a Steampunk/cartoonish vibe that pits small squads of units led by a Hero or Villain in strategic, skirmish combat.

The game uses Print and cut miniatures depicting fantasy armies with different diameter bases. Actions are resolved through distances measured in inches and dice rolls. All stats for units are Provided through cards which can be used to track down effects and skills.

The game also features the use of an "Order Deck" of special powers that grows every game turn.

name: Bicycle Race
description: The board depicts an oval shaped racetrack divided into spaces. The object of the game is to win the race.

name: Hit or Miss
description:
This game requires one standard deck of cards and only a very small play space.

This is a solitaire card game where the goal is to keep scoring "hits".

Players deal one card at a time, counting from 1 to 13 as they do so. When the rank of a card matches the number counted, it is removed. When a player reaches the end, they start again where they left off, until all cards are removed. If a player goes through the deck twice without scoring a hit the game is over.

name: The Great Striptease Game
description:
