A party game for two or more players.

In this ADULT game you follow the game boards outer circle in a race to collect one of each four categories of cards - when this is done you can enter the inner circle to your way towards the finish line where you wait to see who is the loser! He/She will have to do a real striptease!

The game contains of four sets of coloured cards plus a pile of wild cards which can be used when the original coloured card is already collected.

On both circles there are strip fields where you spin a roulette wheel to see if you have to take something on or off...
The inner circle also have spots where you use the wheel to do actions (Such as kiss the feet or massage the shoulders) to another player.
categories: Collectible Components, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Burgen am Neckar
description:
Objective: Conquer castles and fortresses along the Neckar river.

- acting/moving by turns -

Players roll the dice, move their pawn and try to conquer castles by finding correct answers for the questions about Knights and castles during the Middle Age.

First player occupied all castles wins the game (player elimination). Kids may play the game in a 'Roll & Move' modus without cards.

The game board features the following casles and fortresses:
Bad Wimpfen / Pfalz Wimpfen: German Wikipedia article
Burg Guttenberg: German Wikipedia article
Heidelberger Schloss: English Wikipedia article, Wikipedia article
Hornberg: English Wikipedia article, German Wikipedia article
Schadeck / Burgruine Schwalbennest: German Wikipedia article
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Care Bears: Spell BEAR!
description:
At the start of the game, one copy each of four different Care Bear cards are placed in the center of the table within reach of the players. The four Care Bear cards each have a letter associated with them (B, E, A, and R). The remaining cards are shuffled and distributed to the players. Youngest player goes first and play proceeds clockwise.

Players take turns revealing cards from their stacks in a forward motion. When a card is revealed, the players vie to slap the corresponding Care Bear card in the center of the table. Whoever does so first claims the card they slapped. If two players slap at the same time, whoever covers more of the card with their hand claims the card. The claimed card is replaced by the one that was revealed.

The first player to collect cards that spell BEAR wins (i.e., a set of the four different Care Bear cards). For a more challenging game, the rules recommend a variant where incorrect slaps result in the player losing a previously collected card.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: Patent-Mine
description:
Patent-Mine is a roll and move educational trivia board game for kids/adults that teaches the patent process and little known facts about African American inventors.

Players move their pawns around the board, answering trivia questions about African-American inventors. When someone has a right answer, he may continue to advance on the board. The game continues until one reaches the end line (making a full turn of the board), winning at the same time.

name: Kaboom!
description:
In Kaboom! players attempt to unload a gigantic bomb on each other. You may ship it to a stranger, drop it down a chimney, or simply toss it over the neighbor's fence... anything! Just make sure you're not holding it when it blows!

Each round of Kaboom! is divided into three phases.

1. Preparation

Players draw cards and lay TRAPS, by placing cards from their hand face-down on the table.When another player attempts to pass you the bomb, they will likely set off one of your traps in the process.

2. Passing

The player with the bomb passes the bomb by placing it before one of the other players' traps. The trap is revealed and the instructions on the card are followed. The bomb is likely to pass to several players during this phase. Whoever is holding the bomb at the end of the phase panics!

3. Panicking!

When a player panics, he/she must reveal the top card from the draw pile and suffer the consequences listed in the bottom right corner of the card. This may include discarding cards, passing cards to other players, or exploding! When a player explodes, they lose and are removed from the game.

The remaining players start a new round, pass around a new bomb, and establish additional losers. Of course, the last man standing may be thought of as the "winner." But it goes against the spirit of the game.

name: Hello Kitty √Ñppelspelet
description:
Hello Kitty Äppelspelet

Ta dig upp för stegen och plocka äpplen. Den med flest maskfria äpplen vinner.

Hello Kitty The Apple Game

In this game you help Kitty and her friends to gather apples. Roll the dice, climb the tree, and gather apples. But beware! Some apples have worms and should be avoided.

name: New York
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of New York each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Tile Placement
